job_summary:
The Position
 
 Roche Data Scientists are essential leaders in driving and implementing a broad range of quantitative drug development strategies; they bring data to life and enable the organization to make the best possible data-driven decisions.

 As a Data Scientist at Roche Pharma, you’ll actively shape the future of healthcare as a member of Data and Statistical Sciences (DSS) within Product Development (PD) and PD Data Sciences (PDD).
 You will be responsible for the strategic and analytical activities of the molecules and devices in our pipeline on a level matching your seniority.

 DSS activities span multiple therapeutic areas, a wide range of data types, and collaborations with a variety of experts, all with the goal to develop innovative healthcare solutions for patients and society.
 Your responsibilities in support of our PDD products may include a wide variety of contributions: partnering with key stakeholders, working on the molecule portfolio, supporting specialized business areas, or contributing to key initiatives that shape our technical, business and healthcare environments. You may be a work product owner and leader, quantitative expert on a project team, or driver of key internal or external relationships.

 Data Scientist - Statistical Scientist Specialty 

Provides statistical expertise and strategic drug development leadership to support the launch of new medicines, to address questions about approved products to support their appropriate adoption in clinical practice, and to explore future clinical development projects, research applications, development science applications
 Contributes to functional, cross-functional, enterprise-wide or external initiatives to enable broader and more effective use of traditional and innovative data sources and analytics to advance science
 Contributes to cross functional strategic plans to support evidence generation across the molecule lifecycle.
 Is accountable for the statistical integrity, adequacy, and accuracy of deliverables on these projects, e.g. the design, conduct and evaluation of experiments
 Provides analytical and strategic leadership for exploratory analysis activities, e.g. biomarker development and PK/PD modeling


 Key Accountabilities

 Data Sciences Leadership

 Accountable for the development and implementation of Data Sciences products.
 Lead and/ or support multiple elements of the drug development process across various phases of clinical trials.
 Lead and/ or support regular review of opportunities to simplify and innovate, and collaborate with experts in DSS, PDD and beyond to accelerate and deliver patient benefits faster.
 Lead and/ or support prioritization efforts, demonstrating urgency and taking smart risks to make considered decisions in a fast-paced, evolving environment.


 Drug Development Strategy and Execution

 Lead or contribute technical expertise to multiple elements of the business, including: strategic planning; communication; and implementation.
 Support and/or represent DSS and PDD across multiple functions of the Roche global organization, which may include; Pharma Development, Medical Affairs; Market Access, Global Product Strategy (GPS).
 Purposefully collaborate and influence to support PDD to be at the forefront of our industry for Data Sciences.
 Collaborate with experts internally and externally to support our product pipeline.
 Build strong partnerships and opportunities to collaborate and innovate with varying stakeholders across the Roche global organization in support of Roche products, programs, processes, systems, and/or compliance.


 Career Development

 Continuously look for opportunities to broaden knowledge, capabilities and skill set to enable talent to flow into different Specialties and Disease Areas.
 Role model knowledge sharing within DSS, PDD, and beyond.
 Act as a coach, mentor, or buddy to help colleagues grow and develop.


 Technical Accountability

 Contribute technical, therapeutic and business expertise within and external to DSS and PDD, which may include: Research and Development products; Drug development and clinical trial products; Current and new technologies; Working with external data and external organizations; Global Health Authority requirements; Data Sciences industry landscape; Statistical methods and techniques; Analytical strategies; Programming languages; Software development; Data standards; Therapeutic area expertise; Outsourcing expertise; Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable (FAIR) Data Principles; Data Citizenship; Data Privacy; Best practices; and Process improvements, etc.
 Explore ways of modernizing insight generation through new innovative tools and technology.
 Build expertise in novel data types, statistical methods, programming languages, and analytical methodology, which may include advanced analytics, special trial designs and types, and data handling methods.
 Demonstrate a good level of system awareness.


 Qualifications

 Master’s or Doctoral degree in a quantitative discipline (mathematics, statistics, quantitative biology) with or without equivalent education in scientific, medical or relevant technical discipline.
 Experience in the pharmaceutical/biotech industry is preferred.
 Understanding of the end-to-end drug development lifecycle, particularly as relevant to the Specialty of interest, is preferred.
 Track record of establishing successful internal partnerships and collaborations.
 Influential and confident communicator.
 Demonstrates experience or is adaptable to utilizing and/or models modern ways of working consistent with an agile and growth mindset, and agile behaviors and methodologies.
 Fluency in written and spoken English.
 Ability to work across multiple cultures and countries.
 Knowledge of GCP, international regulations, guidelines and their application, and all other applicable compliance standards is a plus.
 Willingness to travel as required.



   Who we are
 
 At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

 Basel is the headquarters of the Roche Group and one of its most important centres of pharmaceutical research. Over 10,700 employees from over 100 countries come together at our Basel/Kaiseraugst site, which is one of Roche`s largest sites. Read more.

 Besides extensive development and training opportunities, we offer flexible working options, 18 weeks of maternity leave and 10 weeks of gender independent partnership leave. Our employees also benefit from multiple services on site such as child-care facilities, medical services, restaurants and cafeterias, as well as various employee events.

 We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion, and strive to identify and create opportunities that enable all people to bring their unique selves to Roche.

 Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

The Position
 
 Roche Data Scientists are essential leaders in driving and implementing a broad range of quantitative drug development strategies; they bring data to life and enable the organization to make the best possible data-driven decisions.

 As a Data Scientist at Roche Pharma, you’ll actively shape the future of healthcare as a member of Data and Statistical Sciences (DSS) within Product Development (PD) and PD Data Sciences (PDD).
 You will be responsible for the strategic and analytical activities of the molecules and devices in our pipeline on a level matching your seniority.

 DSS activities span multiple therapeutic areas, a wide range of data types, and collaborations with a variety of experts, all with the goal to develop innovative healthcare solutions for patients and society.
 Your responsibilities in support of our PDD products may include a wide variety of contributions: partnering with key stakeholders, working on the molecule portfolio, supporting specialized business areas, or contributing to key initiatives that shape our technical, business and healthcare environments. You may be a work product owner and leader, quantitative expert on a project team, or driver of key internal or external relationships.

 This position is a Data Scientist with a role as an Analytical Data Scientist, with the following core activities and key skills:

 Delivers data analysis products such as data tabulations, analysis datasets, statistical tables/listings/figures, and interactive applications related to clinical trial data and analysis
 Supports study results reporting by producing these deliverables in collaboration with internal and external colleagues
 Provides analytical and programming expertise, and contributes to the production of programming packages and functions that can be used across studies and molecule programs
 Supports regulatory submissions to health authorities and contributes to data standardization in order to maximize reusability
 Key skills include expertise in R, knowledge or modern version control tools and software development techniques, and knowledge of CDISC data standards


 Key Accountabilities for Data Scientists in DSS (dependent on experience):

 Data Sciences Leadership

 Accountable for the development and implementation of Data Sciences products.
 Lead and/ or support multiple elements of the drug development process across various phases of clinical trials.
 Lead and/ or support regular review of opportunities to simplify and innovate, and collaborate with experts in DSS, PDD and beyond to accelerate and deliver patient benefits faster.
 Lead and/ or support prioritization efforts, demonstrating urgency and taking smart risks to make considered decisions in a fast-paced, evolving environment.

 Lead or contribute technical expertise to multiple elements of the business, including: strategic planning; communication; and implementation.
 Support and/or represent DSS and PDD across multiple functions of the Roche global organization, which may include; Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED); Genentech Research and Early Development (gRED); PD; Market Access, Global Product Strategy (GPS); and Pharma Technical (PT).
 Purposefully collaborate and influence to support PDD to be at the forefront of our industry for Data Sciences.
 Collaborate with Global Health Authorities to support our product pipeline.
 Build strong partnerships and opportunities to collaborate and innovate with varying stakeholders across the Roche global organization in support of Roche products, programs, processes, systems, and/or compliance.


 Career Development

 Continuously look for opportunities to broaden knowledge, capabilities and skill set to enable talent to flow into different Specialties and Disease Areas.
 Role model knowledge sharing within DSS, PDD, and beyond.
 Act as a coach, mentor, or buddy to help colleagues grow and develop.


 Technical Accountability

 Contribute technical, therapeutic and business expertise within and external to DSS and PDD, which may include: Research and Development products; Drug development and clinical trial products; Current and new technologies; Working with external data and external organizations; Global Health Authority requirements; Data Sciences industry landscape; Statistical methods and techniques; Analytical strategies; Programming languages; Software development; Data standards; Therapeutic area expertise; Outsourcing expertise; Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable (FAIR) Data Principles; Data Citizenship; Data Privacy; Best practices; and Process improvements, etc.
 Explore ways of modernizing insight generation through new innovative tools and technology.
 Build expertise in novel data types, statistical methods, programming languages, and analytical methodology, which may include advanced analytics, special trial designs and types, and data handling methods.
 Demonstrate a good level of system awareness.


 Qualifications

 College/University degree – Bachelor degree or higher or equivalent education in scientific, medical or relevant technical discipline.
 Experience in the pharmaceutical/biotech industry is preferred.
 Understanding of the end-to-end drug development lifecycle, particularly as relevant to the Specialty of interest.
 Track record of establishing successful internal partnerships and collaborations.
 Influential and confident communicator
 Demonstrates experience or is adaptable to utilizing and/or models modern ways of working consistent with an agile and growth mindset, and agile behaviors and methodologies.
 Fluency in written and spoken English
 Ability to work across multiple cultures and countries
 Knowledge of GCP, international regulations, guidelines and their application, and all other applicable compliance standards is a plus
 Willingness to travel as required



   Who we are
 
 At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

 Basel is the headquarters of the Roche Group and one of its most important centres of pharmaceutical research. Over 10,700 employees from over 100 countries come together at our Basel/Kaiseraugst site, which is one of Roche`s largest sites. Read more.

 Besides extensive development and training opportunities, we offer flexible working options, 18 weeks of maternity leave and 10 weeks of gender independent partnership leave. Our employees also benefit from multiple services on site such as child-care facilities, medical services, restaurants and cafeterias, as well as various employee events.

 We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion, and strive to identify and create opportunities that enable all people to bring their unique selves to Roche.

 Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

INTRODUCTION: 




    For our client who is located in the German part of Switzerland, we are looking for an individual as
   
 Data Scientist

     The start date is as soon as possible.
   





ASSIGNMENT DESCRIPTION: 


In-depth analyses of topics covering all aspects of business. Examples range from new customer acquisition and initiatives to reduce customer churn to product experience and strategy
 Accountability for the end-to-end analytical process; from data cleaning and manipulation through design of appropriate analysis and carrying it out, to preparation and ultimate delivery of findings and recommendations to the end client
 Understand, model and visualize business processes to predict and improve the performance, efficiency and bottom line of the company
 You develop a world-class matching engine to be able to deliver the best job opportunities to your talents
 You will work closely with the Tech, Product and Data teams to implement data products
 It is part of your responsibility to design and implement pipelines for data collection, ingestion, validation, transformation, augmentation and visualization together with the data engineering team




REQUIRED PROFILE: 


University degree or PhD in statistics, mathematics, computer science or other quantitative field
 At least three years' experience in a similar position
 Excellent analytical skills with strong knowledge of basic statistics and other analytical techniques
 Development experience with Tableau or Qlikview
 Advanced SQL skills, good command of at least one programming language (R or Python preferred)
 Expert in using PowerPoint as a communication tool
 Passion for helping leaders understand and maintain focus on complex performance dynamics
 Exceptional motivation and ability to work reliably in a high-pressure environment
 Drive for lifelong learning and skill acquisition
 Sharp eye for detail and accuracy in analysis and expression
 You have a strong track record of delivering NLP and ML solutions, preferably in the recruitment industry
 You are passionate about writing code to transform or extract knowledge from text data, including Deep Learning and statistical methods for NLP
 You enjoy identifying and understanding business goals, developing scalable solutions and working on them independently
 fluent in English, German is a plus


 Application process:

   Interested? You can find more information here:

INTRODUCTION: 



   As a preferred supplier for Roche Diagnostics Int Ltd in Rotkreuz, we are looking for an individual as
  
 Junior Data Scientist

    (contract for 12 months, with possible extension). The earliest start date is asap or within 2 months. Remote/Home Office: first three months 100% on site, afterwards can be discussed.
  




ASSIGNMENT DESCRIPTION: 


Understand product requirements and translate them into data science outcomes that will support Product Care activities
 Build and own Tableau dashboards with data narratives (KPI, trends etc)
 Support the entire SD Product Care team with ad hoc data tasks/requests including data engineering tasks
 Apply automation to make the most of our data platform's computation and storage resources
 Leverage big data technologies perform distributed data processing pipelines: AWS/ Snowflake




REQUIRED PROFILE: 


Min. Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Software engineering, Mathematics or similar (STEM) 
Min. 6 months of experience as a data scientist, preferred in a project environment 
Hands-on coding and programming experience (e.g. Python) 
Project experience with SQL development
 Fluency in English (spoken and written), German is a plus
 Great problem solving and communication skills
 Able to prepare and create clear documentation and communicate and adapt the processes
 Ability to interpret and translate/explain technical requirements into tasks


 Nice to Haves:

 Experience working in an agile development environment as part of a sprint team
 Interest in Machine Learning

job_title: Data Scientist for social good (15hr / week)
job_summary:
Deploy your skills for meaningful social impact 

 Would you like to create an ontology to structure an extended database of educational material from the different Wikimedia communities, including various Swiss universities? The aim is to avoid material duplications across regions and foster collaboration between authors. What about receiving mentorship support along the way? 


women++ is holding deploy(impact): a hands-on software development program for social good. This is not a paid position, but rather a volunteering opportunity to apply your tech skills to creating solutions that foster education! 

 More than ever, NGOs need tech support to continue their missions. With deploy(impact), you can make a difference. Develop software with a dynamic, interdisciplinary, and remote team from requirements to proof of concept directly with a project owner that needs your help! 

 This program will run from October 8 to November 19. 

 Participation will be remote and will require 15 dedicated hours per week. 

 There are only 40 spots available and the selection process is on a rolling basis, so make sure you apply soon! 

 Tasks 

 This is a great opportunity to work on a data science project for a social cause! 


Your role: you will be part of a research-based team/project in the creation of data science solutions for a real PO. 



You will work in a team of 4-6 people amongst other data scientists, a project manager and a back-end developer.
There is an opportunity to take the data science lead role if you have extended experience or you wish to try this role for the first time.
Looking for your first data science project? This is your opportunity to put your skills into practice no matter your level of expertise.
 Requirements 

 You agree that all work done by project teams during the 6-week period must remain under a recognised OSI license - an open source initiative. 

 “Hire for attitude, train for skill.” We believe in that. So even if you do not fulfill all the requirements below, but you want to be a part of a great project for a social cause and are committed to the project's success, apply! 


Requirements:


Successfully completed data science studies or comparable training and experience in professional related projects.
You are a team player with an independent and solution-oriented way of working.
You have experience or are interested in an agile, remote teamwork environment
 Benefits 



Mentorship and work-opportunities: Take your profile to the next level with direct mentorship and educational workshops from tech teams of world renowned companies throughout our program. Create new connections with other tech professionals and maybe find your next dream job.
Hands-on experience: Contribute your skills to the product’s development, from business requirements definition to proof-of-concept, together with product owners.
Networking: Expand your network and leverage your freshly sharpened skills with abundant opportunities to meet fellow bright minds with common goals.
Social Impact: Have the chance to witness your software being implemented in non-profits with global reach and demonstrable social impact.
Prize: the most successful solutions will win a prize.
 To complete your application you will receive a link with further instructions to the official application form. 

 We look forward to your application!

We are a Pharma and Life Science IT service provider that has been successfully carrying out 'state-of-the-art' projects for international customers for more than 28 years, now. Our consultants work in

our office in Basel
from home
on our customer’s premises

We are a dynamic forward-thinking and expanding organization with a great team spirit and always on the look out for like-minded individuals. If you are driven by ambition and highly motivated by challenging jobs, as well as financial incentives, you have come to the right place.With our attractive compensation and fringe benefits model, this is a great opportunity to maximize your earning potential. The further development of our colleagues and team members coupled with an excellent work atmosphere are amongst the top values of our company.
Our “Data Science” initiative is seeking professionals with the profile below. As experienced Data Scientist you have a proven track record in successfully managing laboratory research or clinical data projects. Your professional background and experience enables you to efficiently support our customers in bridging between IT and business to build and optimize their IT landscape.
Your Areas of Responsibilities: 

Work through our customer's entire data ecosystem to understand their needs and where to find and collect that information. Support/coach developers in the understanding and preparation of real world digital mobility outcomes such as walking, speed (e.g. accelerometer)
Build and program machine learning and statistical models based on digital, molecular, clinical and Real World Evidence data.
Advise on current/future clinical studies and ensure one is up-to-date with advanced data analytics both in standard statistics and machine learning activities
Support the evaluation of the designed models and present results through data visualization
Drive the execution of data science experiments based on business requirements and data and present the results to business stakeholders
Coach team members on the design and scientific background of statistical models
Organize knowledge sharing sessions in order to teach Data Science basic principles to project team members

Your Qualification and Experience: 

University Degree in Statistics, Biology, Computer Science, Bioinformatics, etc.
3 - 5 years of relevant work experience in Data Science
Experience modelling, integrating and comparing a wide range of clinical data types
Experience in applying major data science, statistics and machine learning algorithms (e.g. Data Science, Support Vector Machines, Neural Nets, Deep Learning, Machine Learning) and methods for exploratory, and confirmatory data analysis in mid to large volume data sets (at least 3 years)
Substantial experience with SAS/R and/or Python, ideally in Pharma/Biostats or Experience in computer aided drug design.
Knowledge of big data platforms (e.g. Hadoop, SPARK) would be an asset
Work well within a team and collaborate with individuals with technical and non-technical backgrounds
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
Ability to work in an international environment
Fluent in English - oral and written, German or French would be an advantage

Job Type: Full-time

job_title: R&D Research Scientist in Food Materials
job_summary:
. 



Position Snapshot 

Location: Orbe, Switzerland 
Company: Société des Produits Nestlé S.A.  Act. Rate: Full-Time  Type of contract: Permanent contract 

What we offer at Nestlé 

Flexible work policies in terms of core hours and working from home. Please talk to us during the recruitment process about what flexibility could look like for you! 
Genuine opportunities for career and personal development 
Modern “smart office” locations providing agile & collaborative workspaces 
Dynamic international working environment 
Attractive additional benefits 

Position Summary 

As a Research Scientist, you will manage the development of knowledge and scientific advancement in food material science (powder/solid, semisolid and liquid products characterization, with a strong focus on food texture and physical food safety) for both the Infant Cereals and Healthy Snacks categories. You will build your expertise and apply your knowledge in the field, to provide relevant scientific/technical guidance in response to business and consumer needs. You will also manage knowledge building projects, support new product development and technical assistance projects, and mentor interns/students/fellows/laboratory technicians. 

We offer a dynamic, inclusive, and international working environment with many opportunities across different companies, functions, and regions. Don’t miss the opportunity to join us and work with different teams in an agile and diverse context. 

A Day in the Life of a Research Scientist 


Develop, contribute and propose new ideas/activities/methods/projects to NPTC/R&DC,SBUs and Operations 
Build and document knowledge and share about latest methods, trends and developments in the field of food material science 
Propose, plan and deliver technical solutions and scientific evidence in projects for NPTC/R&DC/NR and/or Markets 
Lead & manage knowledge building and business-related project activities with initiative 


Propose new projects, write briefs, manage project activities and stakeholders according to I2L. Ensuring all stage gates are closed timely and within project costs, and performing risk assessment analysis 
Substantiate patent applications with scientific data and support patent attorneys in patent writing 
Provide accurate and on-time support to operation with effective (quality, cost and on-time) and sustainable solutions 
Give operational support to customers, assistance in industrialization start-ups, follow-up product launches, including technical, product and process improvements 
Develop related tools and competencies in the domain of activity 


Actively participate in expert network to promote cross-fertilization between different sites (R&D, Org. Units) 


What will make you successful 


MSc or PhD Degree in the field of food science, chemistry/physics, 


Specific knowledge on instrumental texture characterization, sensory analysis, texture functional role of ingredients (lipids, carbohydrates, proteins) and texture design, and oral processing of food is a plus 
Good knowledge of quality, safety and hygiene requirements 
Strong knowledge of food manufacturing 
At least 3 years of work experience in the field of food physics and food chemistry, food processing/engineering or food science 
Excellent communication skills in English are a must have, French is desirable 


At Nestlé, we want to help shape a better and healthier world, inspire people to live healthier lives and deliver impact at a scale and pace that makes a difference. We do this by fostering a diverse, friendly, supportive, and collaborative environment, that creates positive disruption, embraces innovation, and empowers people and teams to win. 
We aim to hire friendly, respectful, inspiring people who care about the people’s lives that we touch every single day. 
Be a force for good. Join Nestlé and visit us on www.nestle.com . 




.

A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.
 Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world’s largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.
 Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times, some of the world’s largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world.
 Join one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world’s most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.

 Purpose of the role
 We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

 What you will do

 Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
 Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
 Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
 Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
 Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated 
Collaborate with the data science team in developing advanced analytics applications for the business unit
 Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units


 Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
 Strong analytical skills
 Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
 Advanced knowledge of SQL
 Good knowledge of a BI tool, preferably Tableau
 Good knowledge of Python is a plus
 Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas


 Why you should join Proton


 Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and supporting organizations that advance the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.
 Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit, with people coming from all walks of life. Many members of our team spent time at the world’s top academic institutions, including MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Princeton, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH.
 Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service – Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more.
 Grow with us - We’re one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields.
 Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else’s problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.
 Benefits – these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events, and team-building activities.


 Proton uses the Recruitee recruitment platform for a more effective hiring process and a better candidate experience. Your data will always be kept confidential and is not shared with any third parties. You will receive emails from the email address careers@protonmail.recruitee.com or other addresses on the protonmail.recruitee.com domain as part of the recruitment process.

 Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation where Proton employs the relevant candidate.

 By applying to a role at Proton, you acknowledge that we will process and store your personal data for at least the duration of the hiring process and as necessary to enter a contractual relationship with you.

Therefore only applications from candidates within the EU or candidates holding Swiss work permission are required.Preferred Interview Dates

Job Type: Full-time

World market leader with a significant product range  We are the global leader with the broadest portfolio of high-performing and sustainable core materials made of PET foam and balsa wood. We are the pioneers in sandwich technology with more than 75 years of experience. Since the very beginning our focus has been developing strong and solid, yet lightweight core materials which allow the manufacturing of more durable, sustainable, and energy-efficient end products for our customers. 3A Composites Core Materials is a global organizational unit within the 3A Composites Group, a part of Schweiter Technologies. The purpose of our products is to create a stronger, lighter, and greener future.  
We are looking for Data Scientist 80-100% 
Standort: Sins | Eintrittsdatum: asap; for production/R&D site and division head office in Sins, Aargau
Your responsibilities:


Establish 3AC Core Materials’ capabilities in data science by defining the processes & technologies and ultimately build up a team
 Understand the nature of the business, discover the key challenges and articulate adequate technical solution
 Develop machine learning solutions to create new business opportunities by evaluating advantages and drawbacks between different ML technologies
 Analyze the data collected from the manufacturing processes to extract insights and realize improvements
 Collaborate in a cross-functional environment and report & communicate the key insights of your work to stakeholders


Your profile:


3+ years of experience in data science or data-driven engineering roles
 PhD or MSc in statistics, computer science, or equivalent engineering degree with background in machine learning
 Track record of building your own ML pipeline by collecting, validating, processing, training, analyzing, and visualizing real-world use cases, preferably in Python
 Strong hands-on experience in software development
 Ability to document and communicate complex results to a technical and non-technical audience
 Experience or interest in production technologies similar to foam processing and chemical processing
 Good fundamentals in project management, preferably matured in a multinational organization
 Strong business acumen, structured and logical thinker, result oriented, capable to take and substantiate decisions; Driven to continuously learn by solving complex challenges by applying scientific methods that have real-world impacts
 Fluent in English is a must, solid spoken German skills required (B2)


What do you also have to know?
We offer a flat organizational structure with efficient decision-making possibilities and an engaging working environment. We look forward to receiving your application over our online career tool.  Please hand in your CV as well as a short project list. If you have any questions, please feel free to send an email or a callback request to Evelyn Gieray, HR Director, evelyn.gieray@3acomposites.com.  For this position, applications from recruiters will only be considered with prior approval.

job_title: Data Scientist for the Division of Dermatology
job_summary:
Contexte

The Lausanne University Hospital (CHUV) is one of five Swiss university hospitals. Through its collaboration with the Faculty of Biology and Medicine of the University of Lausanne and the EPFL, CHUV plays a leading role in the areas of medical care, medical research and training.
The Division of Dermatology is performing cutting-edge basic and translational research in the fields of immunodermatology (psoriasis, atopic dermatitis, lupus erythematosus), keratinocyte biology (epidermal genetic disorders) and skin cancer (tumorigenesis and immunotherapy).
You will be embedded in the research group of Professor Michel Gilliet and focus on projects in dermatology while collaborating and interacting on a daily basis with a dynamic and growing team of data scientists at CHUV. You will also be asked to intimately collaborate with clinicians of the division and assist the development and implementation of precision medicine in the Division. Particularly, this position will be fully embedded within the Biomedical Data Science Center (BDSC), directed by Professor Raphael Gottardo. Members of the BDSC develop and apply (in collaboration with researchers and clinicians) computational and statistical methods to analyze large amounts of genomic, clinical and experimental data (single-cell RNAseq, spatial transcriptomics, CyTOF, etc) in order to accelerate medical discoveries that will help us treat our patients better.

Mission


You will delve into applied problems in dermatology from a data analysis, as well as computational methods development, perspective
You will collaborate with basic scientists and clinicians to take advantage of large datasets generated by novel experimental technologies to accelerate translational discoveries across the CHUV community and partner institutions
You will collaboratively work on developing and implementing new statistical pipelines and workflows to facilitate reproducible science and enable cross-study analyses
You will integrate a growing team of computational scientists including postdocs/students, data scientists and programmers
You help disseminate scientific findings through publications and presentations at national and international conferences.


Profil


MSc degree required, PhD preferred
Experience (minimum 1 year) in working with multi-modal and multi-omics data (including single-cell data) and in performing standard statistical analysis (e.g. linear and generalized linear models, correlates analysis, etc)
Knowledge of machine/statistical learning
Knowledge of R (and/or Python)
Experience in using a high-performance computing environment (local cluster or cloud) would be a plus
Knowledge of Unix/Linux would be a plus
Interest in basic, translational and clinical research along with willingness to combine dermatology and computational approaches
Dynamic and team player with interesting in working, teaching and learning from data scientists, medical doctors and biologists
Excellent analytical, communication and organizational skills
Creative thinking
Proficient in English (written and oral). Proficiency in French is a plus.


Nous offrons

To become an employee of the world-famous University Hospital Center from the Canton of Vaud is an assurance of:

First-rate social benefits such as a Paternity Leave of 20 days and a Maternity Leave of 4 months (there is also the possibility to obtain a complementary breastfeeding leave of 1 month)
Regular salary progression adapted to your responsibilities
A 13th salary and 25 days of vacations per year
A right to at least three days of training per year, by accessing a wide offer of courses not only from the CHUV Training Center but also from external providers
Possibility to access one of the 500 furnished apartments offered in the surrounding neighborhoods in case of relocation in Switzerland
Discounts proposed on social and cultural events, goodies and other services, thanks to the “H-Oxygène” association
Signing up to our Mobility Plan and benefit from different advantages (discounts on public transportation, promotion of “Mobility” car fleet and discounts on electric bikes)
Being able to enjoy our high-quality corporate restaurants, located in every hospital building, with employees’ discount.


Contact et envoi de candidature

Contact person in case of questions about this role : Prof. Raphael Gottardo - 021 314 10 36, Prof. Michel Gilliet – 021 314 03 60 (secretariat)
All of our applications are processed electronically. For this reason, we kindly ask you to apply exclusively by clicking on the APPLY button at the bottom of the advertisement. Should you have any technical question, please contact our Recruitment Team (021/ 314-85-70 from 08h30 to 12h00 and from 14h00 to 16h30).
Should you be selected for this position, please note that you will have to provide us your criminal records, the original copies of your diplomas and your piece of identification.
The CHUV applies the highest quality requirements as part of its recruitment process. In addition, mindful to promote workplace diversity and inclusion we strive to ensure equal treatment and avoid any discrimination. We are looking forward to receiving your application.
We would like to inform external recruitment agencies that any application inserted directly on our recruitment platform won’t be accepted and cannot be charged. Thank you for your understanding.

company: Transports publics de la région lausannoise
job_summary:
Acteur de référence en matière de transports publics, les tl contribuent à l’attractivité et à la qualité de vie d’une agglomération au rayonnement international.  
Nous transportons chaque client·e en faisant battre le cœur de la région lausannoise par un engagement pour une mobilité simple, innovante et durable.


Vous souhaitez rejoindre une équipe dynamique et innovante ?


Devenez notre futur e


Data Scientist





 Votre misson


 Au sein de l’équipe data science, vous êtes l’interlocuteur rice privilégié e des différents représentants métier de l’entreprise et identifiez avec eux les attentes et besoins en termes d’amélioration décisionnelle. Pour cela, vous devez extraire, analyser, questionner, interpréter des données afin de les transformer en informations et proposer des solutions convaincantes à vos partenaires.


Vous êtes en charge d’identifier de nouvelles données pertinentes, de mettre en place des modèles de données les intégrant et de proposer de nouveaux concepts de visualisation ou d’apprentissage (machine learning).

 Vous avez également la responsabilité de sensibiliser l’organisation aux nouvelles approches de traitement de la donnée et de promouvoir les solutions techniques choisies à l’ensemble de l’entreprise (évangélisation de la data interne).

 Doté e d’entregent et de très bon contact, vous êtes avant tout un e fin communicant e et savez vulgariser les données recueillies afin d’en raconter une histoire à vos interlocuteurs puis argumenter vos propositions d’améliorations.


A la fois curieux se et orienté e solutions, vous accompagnez l’organisation dans l’amélioration et l’évolution des méthodes utilisées dans le domaine de la data science. Enfin, vous êtes à l’aise avec les chiffres et savez programmer.






 Votre profil





De formation universitaire (Master), dans un domaine analytique (data science, informatique, mathématique, statistiques)
Au minimum 1 année d’expérience professionnelle dans l’analyse de données et le développement de solutions
Maitrise des outils de data visualisation (Tableau,..), connaissances en langage de programmation liés au domaine (Python, R, SQL…)
Doté e d’un très bon sens de la communication, d’une aisance relationnelle et d’une curiosité intellectuelle développées, et de bonnes capacités pour analyser et synthétiser les informations
Bonnes connaissances en anglais





Vos petits plus





Expérience en modèle prédictif et solution de machine learning
Connaissances en gestion de données non structurées






Délai de postulation: 30 août 2022

Who we are:
 We're an ambitious team of researchers, builders, and entrepreneurs with many years of experience in the crypto space and are passionate about digital assets. With a new product roadmap, we are adding several new products to our portfolio, beyond on-chain data - we are becoming a more comprehensive go-to crypto platform for various needs. 

 Glassnode is a leading market intelligence platform for on-chain and derivatives data. We offer the most comprehensive library of advanced on-chain metrics and insights for Bitcoin, Ethereum and hundreds of other digital assets, bringing data intelligence to the blockchain and cryptocurrency space. 

 With an emphasis on user-centric interfaces, we aim to deliver intelligible, actionable, and unique insights from blockchain data and beyond, helping investors make educated decisions in an overly emotional and irrational market, and equipping blockchain teams with valuable insights on their projects and tokens. 

 Senior Data Scientist (m/f/d). Remote. An employment contract or consultancy is possible. 


About the role:
 Extend the crypto data analysis frontier by embarking on a journey of shaping our innovative, industry-leading products powered by accurate and reliable data. 

 We are searching for a driven and proactive Data Scientist ready to contribute to taking our product and research suite to the next level. You would be expected to provide in-depth research on on-chain activity, financial data, and crypto portfolios. Your work includes developing new research methodologies, creating intelligible insights for our users, as well as defining novel metrics that enrich our product offering, 

 Join us remotely, you can be located anywhere around the CET time zone, as our work is 100% online. The position requires a full-time engagement; both a Contract and an Employment Agreement are possible. 


What you will do:


Analyze on-chain and crypto-financial data from various sources, crypto platforms, and ecosystems, utilizing modern data science toolkits
Create new metrics and insights that will shape our product offering
Explore and analyze crypto portfolios to provide actionable insights for end users
Develop new methodologies to generate high-quality data from raw blockchain data, e.g. for address clustering, flow characterization, or pattern detection
Visualize and communicate the research output and work with our content team to create content and articles and share insights with our users
Stay in tune with current developments in the crypto space and independently identify promising research directions

What you need to have:


4+ years of hands-on experience in data science or a relevant field
Exceptional programming skills in Python and its open-source data science ecosystem (pandas, numpy, scipy, matplotlib, jupyter notebooks, ...)
Excellent SQL knowledge and BigQuery
Very good communication + writing + visualization skills (matplotlib, plotly, ggplot2, …)
Experience in data mining and munging, statistical analysis, and machine learning
High motivation to dive deep into specifics, while retaining a pragmatic approach
Passion for sound and reliable data
Experience working with financial and/or market-relevant data
 \_\_Bonus\_\_\* You’re a crypto Investor and/or trader, keeping up to date with the industry 



Familiar with large-scale data analysis and ETL pipelines
Experience GCP or other cloud infrastructure
Experience with Graph analysis

What we offer:


A modern technical stack with an emphasis on quality
Flexibility to organise your work and hours the way you like, our remote-first setup enables this for everyone
Join a young, self-funded and already profitable company in a future-proof market
Freedom to own your decisions and experiment, we need driven experts who help us figure out what to do, not for us to point at what needs to be done
Be one of the main contributors to building a company with its unique culture in the cutting-edge tech space
No approval loops or unnecessary processes, quick decision-making and full ownership of your function
We are working on a kick-ass, meaningful benefits package, something truly useful and empowering - you will help us figure out what we'd need to stand out as the workplace of the future, we are open to any ideas
Frequent company offsites, we love remote but love to have fun together too - this year we went to Lisbon for a week, we're also coming to Switzerland for our Xmas party and more adventures are coming
 Glassnode is an equal opportunity employer. We respect and empower each individual who joins us. Glassnode commits to a transparent, inclusive, non-discriminatory recruitment process and employment.

swissQuant Group provides quantitative services, consultancy, and premium product solutions for local and global clients, including several global Fortune 500 companies. Our business edge originates from the effective translation of intelligent technology into measurables client values.


 swissQuants expertise is internationally recognized with its selection as one of the Worlds 100 most innovative AI Tech companies in financial services, and as one of the world’s 100 most innovative WealthTech Companies.


 We are currently looking for a Data Scientist to join the Big Data Technology team at our Zurich office.

 
Your Role
 In this role, you will:

Deliver timely and high-quality software solutions, including proof of capability to address client’s use cases, implementation, and integration into client’s infrastructure
Leverage efficient, large scale data analytics, AI and/or optimization to create new solutions, with focus on finance and utilities
Drive the development of swissQuant's products related to data analytics and applied machine learning for the financial sector
Diligently improve and develop existing products ensuring continued relevance, scale, and market suitability
Contribute to design architecture and play a key part in solution implementation, in close collaboration with the team and other swissQuants
Apply best practices to ensure scalability and efficiency
Actively participate in selection of best-fit and implementation of cutting-edge data science methodology
Actively participate in client meetings and delivery of our solutions
Grow key relationships with existing and prospect customers and drive deliverables across all ongoing and future projects
Work closely with other teams within swissQuant, as well as existing and potential customers to help grow our business in new areas



 You Bring

Relevant internship experience and understanding in Private Equity/Debt, Real Estate, and ESG/Sustainability Reporting.
Excellent communication skills in German and English.



 You Are

Master graduate (computer science or quantitative finance).


Self-starter personality eager to learn and further develop skillset.



 Interested? Please upload your cover letter, CV, and reference letters in PDF format (please compress in max. 2 attachments).


 Only direct applications are considered.

THE POSITION
  
 The Position  The Swiss Machine Learning (ML) group within Prescient Design in Roche/Genentech seeks exceptional researchers who have a demonstrated research background in machine learning, a passion for independent research and technical problem-solving, and a proven ability to develop and implement ideas from research.  The group provides a dynamic and challenging environment for cutting-edge, multidisciplinary research including access to heterogeneous data sources, close links to top academic institutions around the world, as well as internal Genentech Research and Early Development (gRED) and Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development (pRED) partners and research units.  Our mission is to develop and apply methods in designing novel macromolecules. Researchers will primarily work on the deep learning subfield of machine learning with a focus on methods that incorporate (graph/geometric/combinatorial) structure, but should be broadly interested in methods capable of effective representation learning that can help drive and sharpen the research questions we study. Fundamentally, our research goals allow us to collaborate closely with and–contribute uniquely to–many different project teams across the company.


 THE ROLE


 You will develop cutting-edge machine learning methods for the analysis of biological data and processes which can be represented as graphs or sequences, with focus on structural biology data and chemical molecules and applications to drug discovery, design, and development.
 You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams across gRED and pRED to solve complex problems in structural and computational biology.
 You will provide technical leadership in machine learning, driving and shaping research directions in Protein Sciences and broader gRED/pRED.
 You will be expected to contribute to and drive publications, and present results at internal and external scientific conferences.



 QUALIFICATIONS


 Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Computational Biology, Physics, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
 Good knowledge of machine learning fundamentals, as well as expertise in at least one of the following: graph representation learning, generative models, geometric deep learning, reinforcement learning. Experience with ML on biological data is desired but not necessary.
 Strong publication record and experience contributing to research communities, including conferences like NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AISTATS, UAI, CVPR, etc.
 Strong Python programming skills
 Intimate hands-on know-how on building and training neural networks — experience with at least one DL framework (preferably Pytorch), keen to build unconventional models, a knack for getting things to work
 Intense curiosity about the biology of disease and eagerness to contribute to scientific and computational efforts.


 #LI-DC2

 Genentech is an equal opportunity employer, and we embrace the increasingly diverse world around us. Genentech prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status and veteran status.

 Genentech requires all new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date. This requirement is a condition of employment at Genentech, and it applies regardless of whether the position is located at a Genentech campus or is fully remote. If you are unable to receive the vaccine due to a disability or serious medical condition, or because it is prohibited as a result of your sincerely held religious beliefs, you will have an opportunity to request a reasonable accommodation.

Accelerating the adoption of data science in Switzerland
The Swiss Data Science Center (SDSC) is a joint venture between ETH Zurich and EPFL. We have been mandated by the Swiss Confederation to accelerate the adoption of data science in academia and industry. Our team is very international and composed of data scientists passionate about solving data-related challenges, and software engineers developing RENKU – an open access solution for collaborative and sustainable data science.
The SDSC is a stimulating, startup-like, cross-disciplinary environment in a leading university, that offers opportunities for turning academic research into impactful solutions. We have excellent ties to research groups worldwide, both academic and industrial, and access to state-of-the-art infrastructure and resources.

Job description

You will work on one of the SDSC’s industry partnerships in the German part of Switzerland. In this role, you will meet partners (companies) to understand their needs and help them define a high-impact project with the SDSC. You will be responsible for successfully carrying out the project thanks to your machine learning expertise with the help and support of the SDSC team. More specifically, your responsibilities would include:

Be the main customer touchpoint of an industry collaboration
Carry out projects with industry partners, from solution design to hands-on development
Turn your machine learning skills into business value – go beyond split-fit-transform-test!
Share expertise in data science and machine learning with fellow data scientists
Increase awareness of SDSC in the Swiss industry
Present to a non-technical audience


Your profile

We are looking for candidates with the following skills:

Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field
Good knowledge of machine learning concepts
Ability to present to various audiences
Open to collaborative work and showing team spirit
Previous industry experience appreciated but not mandatory
Fluent in English; knowledge of German highly appreciated

Part-time arrangements and flexible hours can be explored based on individual circumstances. We are looking for candidates willing to contribute to an inclusive environment and eager to continuously learn.

Your workplace

We offer

Do you see yourself helping Switzerland become more data-driven? Are you passionate about data science and with experience in machine learning? Are you keen to share what you know and get exposed to several projects in various industries? Are you eager to be part of a diverse and adaptable team with equal growth opportunities of its members at its core?
If your answer to these questions is yes, you should consider joining us. Together, we can help move the Swiss Industry to the next level of data science.
During your time at the SDSC, you will benefit from the following opportunities:

Develop your soft skills and meet with key stakeholders in several industries.
Interact with and learn from fellow data scientists
Discover new data science applications in various industries
Exchange on advanced machine learning topics with our academic experts

About ARTIDIS
ARTIDIS AG is a clinical-stage health-tech start-up founded in Basel, Switzerland that has developed the first nanomechanical biomarker for cancer diagnosis and treatment optimization. The ARTIDIS nanotechnology platform integrates different types of clinical data into the ARTIDISNET digital platform, allowing physicians to significantly shorten the current diagnostic process and benefit both the patient and the healthcare system. ARTIDIS enables professionals to design personalized cancer treatment plans tailored to individual patients' needs and desired outcomes.

Job Purpose
ARTIDIS is changing the way cancer is diagnosed and treated. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to create products that will assist doctors, clinicians, nurses and patients in conducting clinical studies and providing better healthcare. An NLP Data Scientist at ARTIDIS is expected to communicate and understand customer requirements.
As an NLP Data Scientist, you'll be tasked to develop, deploy, and NLP models on a medical device and in the cloud.
Duties and Responsibilities

Develop, productionize, maintain, and improve NLP pipelines and NLP models for PHI redaction and medical text extraction using classical text analytics and deep learning NLP techniques

Qualifications

Strong interpersonal, organizational, and multi-tasking skills; attention to detail
 High level of expression and comprehension of the English language
 Experience in digital health and driving innovation in health care
 Experience with both classical NLP techniques (tokenization, part-of-speech tagging, stop word removal, pattern matching) and deep learning-based NLP techniques
 Experience developing and productionizing NLP models pipelines
 Experience implementing NLP techniques on medical documents (named entity recognition, span categorization, PHI detection, medical text extraction)
 Experience with OCR libraries
 Experience annotating and developing models with prodigy
 Experience with the Python data stack (spaCy, numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
 Experience with cloud-based NLP tools (preference for Microsoft Azure)
 Experience designing architectures and pipelines for NLP-focused applications
 Writing documented, clear and efficient code
 Understanding of how and why to use version control systems for code, data and models
 Ability to design and implement requirements with long-term objectives in mind
 Proactive way of thinking, communicating and working
 Ability to work without supervision

 Nice to have:

 Understanding of MLOps and putting pipelines into production (containerization, API creation)
 Understanding regulations in the medical device and software fields (and their relevance to machine learning)
 This position is eligible to be located in any of the following locations:
 o Basel, Switzerland
 o Houston, Texas
 o Fully Remote

Working conditions
The environment is a typical start-up with an intrinsically motivated international team. Our company is an excellent place for rapid advancement and offers a promising opportunity to learn and share know-how in a very agile environment. The position requires the employee to go the extra mile when needed. We are looking for a team player who appreciates direct communication. The effort is rewarded with challenging tasks, the possibility to take responsibility, a highly driven team and work serving a significant purpose. The job position comes with a competitive salary and a bonus for outstanding performance.

Minimum qualifications:

 Experience in machine learning algorithms
Experience in machine learning infrastructure

 Preferred qualifications:

 PhD in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
Experience in machine learning, speech, and general audio processing
Experience programming in Python


About the job
 At Google, research-focused Software Engineers are embedded throughout the company, allowing them to setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly. Ideas may come from internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world.
 From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, engineers work on real-world problems including artificial intelligence, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more. But you stay connected to your research roots as an active contributor to the wider research community by partnering with universities and publishing papers.
 Our team is focused on Machine Learning based models for audio processing, with an emphasis on models that generate audio as output including, for example, speech enhancement, bandwidth extension, neural audio compression, audio in-filling, and more. We have ongoing collaborations with several other teams in Research as well as with product teams, including Google Meet, Pixel, and YouTube. This allows us to advance scientific publications and at the same time push the outcome of our research projects to Google products. 
Google Research addresses challenges that define the technology of today and tomorrow. From conducting fundamental research to influencing product development, our research teams have the opportunity to impact technology used by billions of people every day.   Our teams aspire to make discoveries that impact everyone, and core to our approach is sharing our research and tools to fuel progress in the field - we publish regularly in academic journals, release projects as open source, and apply research to Google products.


 Responsibilities

Propose, implement, and evaluate novel, deep-learning-based approaches operating on discrete audio and text representations, exploring use cases that can be applied in Google products.
Contribute to the development of training/evaluation infrastructure to scale in terms of data and model complexity.
Publish in audio and machine learning conferences.

Data Scientist (f/m/x)  About the role You will work across EF’s tours portfolio in which you will help provide the opportunity for students to experience educational travel experiences worldwide. This role is embedded within the Commercial Steering team - a new, cross-departmental team focused on maximizing long-term customer and business success. Mainly, this team solves the puzzle of balancing demand and supply in our core destinations in the most effective and efficient way possible. Secondly, it provides the algorithms and tools to recommend and match the most suitable tour experience to the preferences of each traveler while maintaining a well-balanced production plan.
 As a Data Scientist (f/m/x) your main objective is to turn data into insights. You will create models and easy-to-use APIs across other departments and teams to foster the adoption of Commercial Steering’s offerings. You should be a team player with strong technical knowledge, who is eager to dive deep, keen on learning, and has a passion for building products that help us to provide the best experience to our travelers.  How you will contribute

 Design end-to-end solutions based on ML models and other statistical methods
 Translate business needs to project objectives to guide data exploration, modelling, implementation, and monitoring
 Build production-ready advanced analytics/machine learning models assisting users with complex problem solving
 Analyze ad-hoc problem statements to recommend new strategic efforts and inform decision makers
 Support the company to grow in a healthy way by creating a culture of constructive feedback, and participating in hiring and capacity planning

 Who you are

 3+ years of professional experience in data science and/or ML related roles
 Experienced in common programming languages such as Python, Scala, Spark, or R
 Proficiency in querying and analyzing data stored in relational Databases and cloud-based data lake products / data warehouses
 A desire to learn new and current technologies and go outside your technical comfort zone, with the pragmatism to find the most optimal solution for the problem
 Strong team player with great communication skills and a passion for collaboration, with the ability to articulate high-level concepts and engage a cross-functional audience

 About EF Education First
 At EF we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we have helped millions of people see new places, experience new cultures, and learn new things about the world and about themselves. Our culturally immersive education programs—focused on language, travel, cultural exchange, and academics—turn dreams into international opportunities.
 When you join EF, you join a multicultural and diverse community working across more than 600 schools and offices in 50 countries, all with one shared mission of opening the world through education. Whoever you are, whatever you are passionate about—we welcome you and want you to bring that to work every day. EF is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to inclusion and belonging across race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, parental status, identity, experience, and everything else that makes you unique.
 Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has school and offices around the world, including hubs in Boston, London, Mexico City, São Paulo, Shanghai, Stockholm, Zürich, and more.
 Learn more at https://www.ef.com.
 Engineering at EF Education First Technology in EF Tours is the core enabler for higher scalability of the business and a better and faster customer experience. We have engineers across the world building internal tools for EF staff, customer facing websites and apps, data processing and forecasting components. Working side by side with Product Management, the Engineering team supports all departments to create value for our travelers, partners, and suppliers. We love to adapt technologies to enable our business to grow.
 Our cross-functional teams are organized both vertically along the lifecycle of our products and horizontally across cross-cutting concerns. We collaborate closely with product management, UX and our stakeholders from the business to create an excellent experience for our travelers.
 We are building an internal engineering community that can support our growing teams and maintain best practices and technical excellence throughout the organization. Building a large-scale platform is not only a technical challenge, but an exciting social and organizational one as well!
 Our tech stack Let’s get this out of the way: yes, we do have a legacy system to support. It is a 20-year-old monolith based on .NET Framework, WPF / WinForms, and MSSQL. Fortunately, we are actively migrating away from it towards a modern platform powered by AWS, ECS/Fargate, Terraform and Docker.
 Our new services and backends are running on .NET Core, Node.js and Python, on top of the platform mentioned above. On the client-side we run on TypeScript and React with the help of Retool for rapid prototyping and internal CRUD applications.
 We store data in various persistence technologies like MongoDB or AWS RDS, using REST APIs, GraphQL and RabbitMQ to enable loosely coupled communication between systems and components.
 We empower our teams to experiment with new technologies, inspired by our internal Tech Radar, because we think that by using the right technology for the problem a great user experience for our customers can be achieved.
 Benefits EF offers a wide range of benefits ready for our team members to enjoy at the office, at home, during weekends, after work and with friends & family, including:

 Discounted passes to local destinations and tourist hot spots such as Mt. Titlis or Kunsthaus Zurich.
 Full reimbursement of the SBB ‘halb-tax’ travel card, covering country-wide public transportation.
 Free membership for our newly built gym or get involved with our variety of sports teams.
 Seasonal and monthly office events including holiday parties, ski trips, and pay-day happy hours.
 Discounts on a wide range of local restaurants, shops, hotel stays and EF products.
 15% off in-house childcare service (more info. available).
 Option to work in the office full-time, hybrid, or consideration for additional flexibility.
 Full visa sponsorship for Switzerland for non-Swiss / EU applicants
 Relocation support, if applicable
 Diverse and inclusive workplace
 Collaboration on choice of technology
 One flight home per year

 If this sounds good, then we would love to hear from you!

This role is responsible to lead the coordination of technical services activities across the large molecule platform. In this role the incumbent is charged with managing New Product Introduction and Life-Cycle Management projects that must drive reliability and sustainability of our Parenteral bulk drug substance manufacturing plants and products. This person will provide the overall project portfolio management and leadership role to lead and facilitate the activities related to all technical support related to establishing standardized Design-to-Value strategies in the Janssen's Biologics Drug Substance Supply Chain network, for both internal and external manufacturing facilities. This role will partner with R&D, Quality, and Regulatory to ensure processes are flawlessly introduced into and managed through the supply chain network and that models are developed and utilized to ensure both new and ongoing production consistently satisfies quality and regulatory needs. The incumbent must be able to work independently to drive and execute projects of a complex nature where analysis of situations or data requires an in depth evaluation of various identifiable factors in multifunctional areas, and must have strong communication skills to influence other functions/levels outside of own group and effectively leads cross functional and cross organizational teams to generally attain expected results for all parties. Strong knowledge in biologics bulk drug substance manufacturing processes and regulatory filing experience is a must. Hands-on experience in both R&D and Manufacturing Operation is highly desirable.
 





Responsibilities:




Represent Global Technical Operations and partner with operation, R&D, regulatory and quality to develop and implement a strategy for standard manufacturing practice, new product introduction and marketed product support across large molecule product portfolio. Responsible to assure ensure manufacturing site readiness, reliability and sustainability.
Accountable technical lead for identifying new technology or areas of improvements on current and future processes, capital utilization, cost of goods optimization, and advanced expertise on feasibility and risks management.
Strengthen external network of academic, regulatory, professional and cross company alliances to enhance standardization of current approaches and introduction of new technologies across platforms and industry.
Oversee Process validation, FDA filing activities.
Coordinates and executes product introduction at the site from drug substance (OS) transfer through launch covering raw materials and process integration. Supports the New Product Launch teams for site related launch activities.
Delivers clinical through commercial Drug Substance supply from the manufacturing site ensuring manufacturing performance, cost, and robustness requirements are met.
Provides required manufacturing technical support, documented technical input, review, and approval and serves as the JSC
technical expert. Represents JSC in all Design-for-Manufacturability (DfM) activities during the development process.
Responsible for delivering a Drug Substance process capable of meeting the Gross Profitability targets together R&D, Finance and Operation, and conduct Cost-of-Goods (COGS) sensitivity assessments.













Qualifications
 1. Specific knowledge

Proven track record in large molecule process development, new product introduction and ongoing production support of large molecule pharmaceutical products. Had accountability and success for design, start-up, and approval of both facilities and products within the large molecule space. Well established industrial, academic and regulatory track record.
Demonstrated competency and experience with introduction of Drug Substance products to manufacturing sites and thorough technical knowledge of manufacturing site unit operations.
Understanding of costing systems to support COGS sensitivity assessments as well as financial tools such as NPV, P&L and make vs buy tools.
Integration of new and re-developed DS manufacturing processes from R&D into the supply chain.
Tech transfer from R&D facilities, internal and external, to plants in the JSC network. The scope includes early development, full development, launch phase and life cycle management.
Contribution, review and approval of DS technical and regulatory documents, routine technical support during execution, integration of Janssen Supply Chain (JSC) technical expertise into project execution
Single point of contact for JSC plant readiness and execution from technical transfer into commercial production. Identifying and implementing opportunities for active decrease in DS COGs. Taking part in GP assessments led by the NPL.
Partnering with R&D and JSC groups to improve the fit for plant and commercialization of new products into the supply chain.

2. Personal and interpersonal skills / Leadership skills

Demonstrated leadership in providing integration of activities, information across multifunctional groups and sites. Planning and logistics skills capable of effective integration of DS deliverables at the manufacturing site level.
Ability to foster team productivity and cohesiveness and to work collaboratively to execute, deliver and get results through the various matrix teams.
Ability to influence and lead peers, superiors, and external partners.

3. Personal attitude and mindset

Motivated, self-starter able to work independently with demonstrated problem solving skills.

DEGREE:
Engineer, Msc or equivalent in a technical field (Chemistry, Pharmaceutics, Biological Sciences, Chemical Engineering).
