Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.
 For Drug Product Services (DPS), our successful Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) branch, located in Basel, Switzerland and Stein, Switzerland, we have exciting opportunities. Become part of a group that enables its customers to meet some of the greatest challenges in patient treatment and join us by applying for the position as Scientist Formulation Development.
 Key responsibilities:

 Plan and perform formulation development and characterization studies for liquid and lyophilized parenteral drug products of biologics (e.g. monoclonal antibodies, novel formats, ADCs, peptides)
 Execute analytical tests to support formulation and process development (e.g. HPLC and CE purity methods, content by UV, identity, color, clarity and opalescence, pH, osmolality, visible particles, subvisible particles)
 Document data following applicable lab procedures and current documentation practices
 Evaluate and implement new methods and technologies
 Install, qualify, and maintain equipment for formulation and process development and related analytics in close alignment with current best practices and regulations
 Assist establishment of Drug Product pharmaceutical development infrastructure and services for parenteral drug products

 Key requirements:

 Vocational training as lab technician or degree in science or engineering (BSc, MSc) in a relevant discipline, e.g. Pharmaceutical Sciences, Chemical or Biochemical Engineering
 Work experience as a research/technical assistant in the pharmaceutical or chemical industry, preferably in pharmaceutical development
 Work experience in relevant pharmaceutical development technologies
 Experience with parenteral dosage forms, protein formulation and analytics and aseptic working techniques is a plus
 Good knowledge of reporting, interpretation and documentation of scientific results
 Excellent communication skills with good command of English, written and spoken

 Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.
 People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

 Experience with the Python data stack (pandas, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, spaCy)
 Writing documented, clear and efficient code
 Understanding of how and why to use version control systems for code, data and models
 Ability to design and implement requirements with long-term objectives in mind
 Proactive way of thinking, communicating and working
 Ability to work without supervision
 High level of expression and comprehension of the English language

Preferred

Understanding regulations in the medical device and software fields (and their relevance to machine learning)


 Working conditions
Our work environment is a typical start-up with an intrinsically motivated international team. You will work in a highly motivated team and your work serves a highly meaningful purpose. We offer a great place for rapid advancement and a promising opportunity to learn and share know-how in a very agile environment. This position will require potential frequent traveling for the execution of experiments, on-site customer support or trouble shooting.
We are looking for a team player who appreciates direct communication and is willing to go the extra mile when required. The effort is rewarded with challenging tasks and the possibility to take responsibility. This position is located at our headquarters office in Basel, Switzerland and it comes with a competitive salary, a bonus, and an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) for outstanding performance.

EPFL, the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne, is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs more than 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of more than 16,000 people, including over 12,000 students and 4,000 researchers from more than 120 different countries.
   


Data Scientist (W/M)

Your mission :

 The aim of the EPFL Blue Brain Project (BBP), a Swiss brain research initiative founded and directed by Professor Henry Markram, is to establish simulation neuroscience as a complementary approach alongside experimental, theoretical and clinical neuroscience to understanding the brain, by building the world’s first biologically detailed digital reconstructions and simulations of the mouse brain.
   

     The Membrane Systems group in the Blue Brain Project is looking for a data scientist to work with large volumes of experimental data mainly from electrophysiology experiments. The
     main tasks include maintenance of a custom data sharing web application (Channelpedia), to convert all experimental data from their proprietary data format to standardized data formats and to make them accessible through Channelpedia (www.channelpedia.epfl.ch). The candidate should be proficient with data analysis programming languages (C/C++, Python, Matlab), familiar with Hierarchical Data Format (HDF), web programming (Ruby on Rails, PHP, JavaScript, HTML, CSS) and databases (RDBMS, NoSQL). The candidate should be an enthusiastic, agile team player who is excited to learn new concepts and deliver results on time. The position also requires effective communication with scientists and technical project managers.
   

 Job location: LNMC, AI 2119, Station 19, CH-1015 Lausanne, Switzerland
   


Main duties and responsibilities include :


 Redesign and upgrade existing data storage and analysis framework implemented in Matlab
 Convert all experimental data to standardized data formats
 Automated data upload to Channelpedia website and online visualization
 Support neuroinformatic group to store and annotate experimental data



Your profile : 


BS, MS, or PhD in computer science, computational biology, applied mathematics
 Experience with Linux, shell scripting and modern code version control
 Experience delivering and maintaining robust, data-intensive software
 Programming languages: C/C++, Python, Matlab, JavaScript, Ruby on Rails, HTML/CSS
 Experience with database management systems (MySQL, NoSQL)



We offer : 


A world-recognized leader in simulation-based research in neuroscience
 A dynamic, multidisciplinary, international and collaborative working environment committed to benefitting the global community
 A modern and highly international working environment, based at the EPFL Campus in Lausanne, consistently ranked among the world’s top institutions in scientific research.
 Remote work allowed up to 20%
 Relocation necessary



Start date : as soon as possible 

Term of employment : Fixed-term (CDD)

Work rate : 100%

Duration : 1 year, renewable 

Remark : Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered. Files sent by agencies without a mandate will not be taken into account.

Reference : Job Nb 2509

What's the role?
In the role of a Data Scientist, you will collaborate with our Data Engineers on advanced statistical modelling. Hilti has a tremendous wealth of external and internal data. We are using it to bring our customer relationship to another level as well as to develop advanced tools and services based on tool data. The  Data Science team is highly technical and at the same time at the core of Hilti’s digital business.
Who is Hilti?
If you’re new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software, and services for the global construction industry, and beyond. At Hilti strong customer relationships create solutions that build a better future, where there is pride and a sense of belonging across our 120 global locations. It’s where people explore possibilities, leverage their potential, own their personal development, and grow lasting careers.  The Global IT teams, operating from our technology hubs in Switzerland, Malaysia, and the USA, work closely together by translating the latest IT innovations into sustainable, value-creating solutions & services for our customers.
What does the role involve?
As a Data Scientist you lead discovery processes to identify the business requirements and business opportunities. To do so, you design experiments, test hypotheses, and you develop and program models. You work in agile, iterative processes, conduct advanced data analysis, and implement highly complex statistical algorithms. In close cooperation with our experienced business analysts you model and frame business scenarios that are meaningful and which affect critical decisions and business processes.  You identify what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources, structured and unstructured data, leveraging new data collection processes such as smart meters and connected tool information or social media. You collaborate with global subject matter experts to select the relevant sources of information. You make strategic recommendations on data collection, integration, and retention requirements incorporating business requirements and knowledge of best practices. The development of usage and access control policies and related systems are organized in close alignment with the data steward. Together you drive the continuous improvement processes that are impacting data quality in the context of specific use cases. You present and depict the rationale of your findings in easy-to-understand terms for the business stakeholders and, if applicable, you present back results that contradict common belief to subject matter experts and organizational leadership. You instruct the organization both from IT and the business  perspectives on new approaches, such as testing hypotheses and statistical validation of results. Based on this, you help the organization to understand the principles and the mathematics behind the process to drive organizational buy-in. You provide on-going tracking and monitoring of performance of decision systems and statistical model and  you lead the design and deployment of enhancements and fixes to systems as needed.  

CAREER - We want your thirst to learn, courage to challenge and desire to improve things, including yourself.

What do we offer?
We give you the autonomy to identify the right technology solutions for our customers. We also encourage you to grow, not only in this role, but also beyond - you will be able to move around the business, to experience various job functions and even work abroad in different markets.   Our IT department is located in Buchs SG, Switzerland in the beautiful and mountainous Rhine Valley. It is in convenient walking distance to the city center and train station as well as in close proximity to our corporate headquarters in Schaan, Liechtenstein.  As integral part of our performance oriented yet caring culture we want you to work your best. Offers such as flexible working/part time arrangements, comprehensive insurance and pension plans, day care for your children are just some of the ways we do that. Additionally, Hilti e-bikes are readily available for you to use free of charge!
What you need is:


You hold a PhD in mathematics, statistics, computer science, or related fields 
You bring 3 or more years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience 
You have deep knowledge of statistical techniques and experience using machine learning algorithms 
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g. AWS), strong programming skills in R, Python and Java are a given 
Your strong data engineering skills in SQL support you to partner up most efficiently with our data engineers 
You bring basic skills in software engineering (software architecture, version control systems, continuous integration software) 
Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and optimization algorithms will underline your expertise 
You have the ability to come up with solutions to loosely defined business problems by leveraging pattern detection over potentially large datasets 
Your strong communication and interpersonal skills support you in achieving your professional and personal goals 


Why should you apply?
For this position, we are seeking creative and open-minded people with a demonstrated ability to work both independently and in a global team setting. If you possess extraordinary analytical skills, when you have strong programming experience, and when you have rock solid statistical education, you are exactly what we are looking for.   


     Does this sound like you? We look forward to your application! 
      For further questions, please feel free to contact the hiring manager Andreas Wagner, our Global Head of Data Science: Andreas Wagner | LinkedIn: 
      https://www.linkedin.com/in/wagneremail/ 
     
 Learn more about us: 
      https://careers.hilti.li/en-li 
     
 Learn more about our IoT initiatives: 
      https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=esUQ6tdQnls 
     
 Learn more about our Global IT Competition here: 
      https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dlv1hDNuVw4 
     


For non-EU / EFTA citizens: Please state your eligibility status to work in Switzerland/ Liechtenstein and note that if you do not own a valid Swiss/ Liechtenstein work permit, Hilti cannot guarantee your final employment due to authority regulations. 


Hilti is an equal opportunity employer

job_title: Data Scientist for Trade & Market Surveillance Analytics
job_summary:
Your field of responsibility



 Your field of responsibility
The Trade & Market Surveillance Analytics Team is focusing on building strategic and global trade & market surveillance solutions for Financial Crime Compliance within Credit Suisse. We are looking for a highly motivated and passionate Data Scientist to support the team and our stakeholders in studying complex business questions and translating them into fully automated and data driven analytics solutions. Your responsibilities include user engagement, business requirement definition, pipeline engineering, model and front-end development on our strategic big data platform and in close collaboration with peers, business users and stakeholders.

Your future colleagues

The Trade & Market Surveillance Analytics Team is part of the highly visible and dynamic Compliance Data & Analytics area and is focusing on building strategic and global trade & market surveillance solutions for Financial Crime Compliance within the firm. You will join a team that is renowned for its fast-paced, collaborative and engaged culture working with a high level of integrity within an international and demanding environment. We believe our colleagues are our key asset and live a work culture that builds on high level of respect, integrity, and trust. Become part of a highly motivated, open-minded analytics team in a collaborative and flexible working environment.








 Your skills and experience



 We are looking for a candidate with the following skills and background:

A Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Computer Science)
Excellent and flexible programming skills, preferably PySpark and/or Scala. Experience with JavaScript React and CSS development is a plus
Advanced technical skills related to data discovery and data cleaning, data modelling, data mining and performance tuning
Good understanding of financial products and markets
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, attention to detail and emphasis on accuracy
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate and present complex technical information to a generalist audience
Be a self-starter with a strong curiosity for extracting knowledge from data and the ability to elicit technical requirements from a non-technical audience
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment where priorities change quickly
Dedication to fostering an inclusive culture and value diverse perspectives

*LI-CSJOB*
Mr. Joshua Albinus would be delighted to receive your application.
Please apply via our career portal.


 Your new employer
 Find a new home for your skills, ideas, and ambitions. Credit Suisse offers you the ideal environment to progress your career, attractive benefits and excellent training.
We are a leading wealth manager with strong global investment banking capabilities founded in 1856. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and with more than 45,000 employees from over 150 nations, we are always looking for motivated individuals to help us shape the future for our clients.
 Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success. We are committed to building a culture of inclusion with a deep sense of belonging for all of us. We will consider flexible working opportunities where possible. Our bank provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, as well as those with other needs or beliefs as may be protected under applicable local law. If you require assistance during the recruitment process, please let your recruiter know.

job_title: Consultant Data Scientist - Forensics in Zurich
job_summary:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 The Forensic Data Analytics team is a global group of technical specialists that practice the full life cycle of data management from the early stages of data scoping and capture, to its management, analysis and reporting. The nature of our work typically requires working with large datasets from disparate data sources to support fraud investigations and dispute services for our clients covering a range of industries. This is achieved by combining deep forensic investigation knowledge with advanced data analytics techniques such as investigative data linking, exploratory and descriptive analysis, social network analysis and predictive modeling.
 The opportunity

 The rapidly growing Forensics team within the Fraud Investigation department is currently seeking suitable candidates for an excellent career opportunity in the Forensic Data Analytics (“FDA”) team
 This team represents a critical component in EY’s Forensics growth strategy and is where most of the innovative early thinking in Fraud Investigation ecosystem takes place
 You will have a unique, career changing opportunity to play a key role in the growth and strategy of the FDA group

 Your key responsibilities

 Working on client engagement teams in carrying out both reactive and proactive data analysis of large volumes of structured and unstructured data involving a wide range of database management systems and financial platforms
 Working with clients, fraud investigators, internal and external auditors, lawyers and regulatory authorities in sensitive and sometimes adversarial situations
 Working in our specialized forensic technology labs and onsite, to help clients leverage knowledge from their data through the application of advanced analytics
 Supporting the development of new FDA tools and solutions, by understanding the state-of-the-art methods, customizing them to the FDA needs, and making them ready for production

 Skills and attributes for success
 To qualify for the role you must have

 Degree (Bachelor or Master) in all fields related to Computer Science
 Experience with SQL or similar database query languages
 Strong problem solving, analytical, technical, and interpersonal skills
 Consulting-oriented mindset, flexibility and “can-do” approach
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (German is a plus)

 Ideally, you’ll also have

 Experience with Python, R, Ruby scripting or other programming languages
 Solid knowledge of IT environments, networking, server architecture and IT security
 Experience in collecting, processing and analyzing large volumes of unstructured and structured data
 Knowledge of machine learning techniques such as (un)supervised clustering, SVMs, or deep learning
 Practical experience in a similar type of work

 What we offer

 International multi-cultural team of highly motivated professionals
 Continuous personal development with a steep learning curve – a system of trainings, mentoring, counselling and on-the-job learning
 Modern working environment and equipment, fostering mobile working flexibility
 Transparent performance-based recognition and progression system
 Acquire a fully accredited corporate MBA (EY Tech MBA) from Hult International Business School, whilst working with EY, completely free*

 If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Make the next step and apply for this position online. For further information please contact our recruitment team (recruitment.switzerland@ey.com / +41 58 286 33 66).
 The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

 exception of EY contractors, interns and alumni.


 EY | Building a better working world

 EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
 
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

 Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

 DAS SIND WIR

    Unsere IT-Lösungen machen unsere Kunden besser. Hinter diesem einfachen Satz verbergen sich anspruchsvollste Projekte auf hohem methodischem Niveau. Menschen, die stolz auf ihre Arbeit sind. Jobs, die in fünf Jahren noch zufrieden machen. Technologiekompetenzen, die in der Branche Massstäbe setzen und unsere Kunden in die Lage versetzen ihre Softwarequalität und Innovationkraft zu verbessern.
    Wir bei adesso glauben daran, dass unsere Kunden durch die intelligente Erhebung und Nutzung von Daten ihren Erfolg massiv steigern und so auch die Gesellschaft als Ganzes voranbringen können. Mit passgenauen Lösungen entlang der gesamten Wertschöpfungskette der Datenverwertung liefern wir nicht nur Antworten auf drängende Fragen, sondern katalysieren vielmehr die langfristige Entwicklung unserer Kunden. Hier kommst Du ins Spiel: Du arbeitest zusammen mit anderen Spezialisten auf Kundenprojekten entlang der gesamten Wertschöpfungskette – angefangen bei der Strategieplanung und Anforderungsanalyse über die Konzeption von modernen Datenplattformen und -produkten bis zu deren Umsetzung.
  


 DAS KANNST DU BEWEGEN 


Du hilfst unseren Kunden im Bereich Life Sciences strategisch und operativ, ihre Daten so gewinnbringend wie möglich für ihren Geschäftserfolg zu nutzen. Im Spannungsfeld zwischen klassischem Reporting und aktuellen Maschine-Learning-Initiativen dienst du mit deiner Expertise als Orientierungs- und Entscheidungshilfe für unsere Kunden.
Egal, ob es um die Anbindung neuer Datenquellen, die Datenkonsolidierung, -verarbeitung, -speicherung oder -visualisierung geht: Von der Analyse der (nicht-)funktionalen Anforderungen, über das Design und die Realisierung bis zur Qualitätssicherung und dem Betrieb hast du alles im Blick und bist eine vertrauensvolle und kompetente Kontaktperson für unsere Kunden.
Mit Deinen Kenntnissen über verschiedene Architekturen und Systeme entwickelst Du für unsere Kunden nachhaltige Lösungen zur Datennutzung. Du unterstützt unsere Kunden bei Entscheidungen hinsichtlich der Weiterentwicklung von bestehenden Datenprodukten oder der Identifikation neuer datengetriebener Geschäftsbereiche.
Neben der Projekttätigkeit gestaltest Du mit uns die Community als Speaker, Autor und Socializer. Zudem bist Du massgeblich bei der Definition unseres Dienstleistungsportfolios beteiligt, d.h. Kreation unserer Lösungsbausteine und Weiterentwicklung der Data Driven Company.
Gemeinsam mit den adesso-Sales trittst Du als Presales Consultant auf und unterstützt bei der Projektakquise zur Data Driven Company.




WIE DIR DAS GELINGT 


Mehrjährige Erfahrung als Data Analytics Manager oder einer vergleichbaren Rolle
Promotion und Hochschulabschluss
Erfahrung im Bereich Life Sciences
Verhandlungssicheres Deutsch und Englisch
Breite und tiefe Kenntnisse von Technologien und Methoden (T-Shaped) zur Batch- und Stream-Verarbeitung grosser Datenmengen und in Entwurf, Umsetzung und/oder
Betrieb moderner Dateninfrastrukturen
Erfahrung in der Datenmodellierung auf Enterprise Level
Erfahrung mit SQL sowie mit mindestens einer Programmiersprache
Erfahrung in der Datenvisualisierung
Erfahrung mit den Services zu Data Analytics, Machine Learning und/oder IoT von AWS, Azure oder Google Cloud, idealerweise auch via Infrastructure as Code
Lösungsorientierte, flexible, und kundenorientierte Einstellung
Schnelle Auffassungsgabe und Kreativität gepaart mit dem Willen, ständig dazuzulernen
Proaktive Persönlichkeit mit Consulting Mindset, die offen den Umgang mit anderen sucht
Begeisterung für neue Technologien im Bereich Data Processing und Data Analytics
Bereitschaft, neue Themen und Aufgaben zu übernehmen und sich beständig weiterzubilden




WAS DU VON UNS ERWARTEN KANNST 


Viel Raum für deine Erfahrung und ein breites Aufgabenspektrum
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit unseren erfahrenen und hochqualifizierten Teammitgliedern aus verschiedenen Fachbereichen
Selbstständiges Arbeiten und Verantwortung im Projekt
Die Möglichkeit, die Gestaltungshoheit für eigene Ideen und Konzepte zu übernehmen
Unterstützung dabei, sich pro-aktiv mit Themen auseinanderzusetzen
Vielseitige Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten

Ein starkes, weltweit agierendes Unternehmen im Rücken mit kontinuierlichem Austausch, Teamgeist und einem respektvollen, anerkennendem Umgang
Wir gehören zu den führenden Schweizer Beratungs- und IT-Dienstleistern und fokussieren uns auf die Optimierung der Kerngeschäftsprozesse unserer Kunden. In unseren interdisziplinären Teams aus den Bereichen Business Consulting, IT-Consulting, Software Development und IT-Management bringen wir unsere Technologie- und Beratungskompetenz mit der Branchenexpertise der Menschen zusammen. Kontinuierlicher Austausch, Teamgeist und ein respektvoller sowie anerkennender Umgang sorgen für ein Arbeitsklima, das verbindet. About ARTIDIS ARTIDIS AG is a clinical-stage health-tech start-up founded in Basel, Switzerland that has developed the first nanomechanical biomarker for cancer diagnosis and treatment optimization.The ARTIDIS nanotechnology platform integrates different types of clinical data into the ARTIDISNET digital platform, allowing physicians to significantly shorten the current diagnostic process and benefit both the patient and the healthcare system. ARTIDIS enables professionals to design personalized cancer treatment plans tailored to individual patients' needs and desired outcomes.

Job Purpose ARTIDIS is changing the way cancer is diagnosed and treated. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to create products that will assist doctors, clinicians, nurses and patients in conducting clinical studies and providing better healthcare. A Computer Vision Data Scientist at ARTIDIS is expected to communicate and understand customer requirements.
As a Computer Vision Data Scientist, you'll be tasked to develop, deploy, and maintain computer vision models on a medical device and in the cloud.
Duties and Responsibilities Develop, productionize, maintain, and improve computer vision models for image classification, segmentation and analysis with the use of deep learning and classical image analysis techniques.

Qualifications
 Required


Experience in digital health and driving innovation in health care 
Experience developing computer vision (image processing and deep learning-based) solutions for medical images – Preference for image segmentation, object recognition 
Experience with the Python data stack (TensorFlow, PyTorch, numpy, pandas, scikit[1]learn) 
Experience with OpenCV 
Writing documented, clear and efficient code
 Understanding of how and why to use version control systems for code, data and models 
Ability to design and implement requirements with long-term objectives in mind 
Proactive way of thinking, communicating and working 
Ability to work without supervision
 High level of expression and comprehension of the English language


 Preferred

Understanding of MLOps for automatic deployment, continuous training, and model monitoring – Preference for experience with model deployment on a medical device or edge-compute and cloud-based models
 Understanding regulations in the medical device and software fields (and their relevance to machine learning

This position is eligible to be located in any of the following locations:

 Basel, Switzerland
Houston, Texas
Fully Remote

 Working Conditions

The environment is a typical start-up with an intrinsically motivated international team. Our company is an excellent place for rapid advancement and offers a promising opportunity to learn and share know-how in a very agile environment. The position requires the employee to go the extra mile when needed. We are looking for a team player who appreciates direct  communication. The effort is rewarded with challenging tasks, the possibility to take responsibility, a highly driven team and work serving a significant purpose. The job position comes with a competitive salary and a bonus for outstanding performance.

80% or more | Baden 

Bring along your knowledge, enthusiasm and dedication as experienced Data Scientist and join our Advanced Analytics Team. The team is responsible for a profitable portfolio of machine learning based trading models that we would like to enhance with your help and initiative. As markets accelerate, we rely more and more on models and analytics to enhance our trading processes. At the same time, we are unlocking the spectrum of insights that can be derived from our operational models and would like to grow these activities further.



What you will do


Interact with trading desks on a regular basis to directly support profit generation with your models
 Design, implement and operate data centric use cases for trading activities in a professional cloud-based environment
 Leverage state-of-the-art machine learning, optimization and simulation techniques to maximize business impact of use cases in core trading activities
 Engage in insight creation using explainers, model-/data- and concept drift, causality concepts etc.
 Translate Machine Learning insights into trading and market recommendations
 Be part and actively collaborate with the company wide community of Advanced Analytics
 Contribute to the internal promotion of advanced analytics to business stakeholders
 Shape and develop the Advanced Analytics use case portfolio on a pan-European level




What you bring & who you are

Proven track record in data driven model development and deployment (>3-5 years of experience), ideally in a energy/commodity trading environment.
 Master's degree in Data Science, Quant Finance, Engineering or equivalent
 In-depth knowledge of machine learning algorithms, time series analysis, and ability to apply them in data driven trading systems
 Ability to quickly prototype ideas / solutions, perform critical analysis and use creative but pragmatic approaches for solving complex tasks
 Experience articulating business questions and using mathematical techniques to arrive at an answer using available data
 Strong conceptual skills and able to interact with different audiences at different abstraction levels to democratize Advanced Analytics and their use in trading
 Highly proficient in Python and with query languages such as SQL
 Team player, open to collaborate and share know-how with a cross-divisional mindset




What we offer

Lifelong learning Get off to a flying start with the induction programme at the Axpo Academy. And don't stop there: we offer a wide range of courses and training, including flexible e-learning. Benefit from time and financial support on your learning and development journey, and take advantage of initiatives like 'Lunch & Learn, individual development plans, coaching and talent management.


Your choice Flexibility comes in many forms. How about an annualised hours model, part-time position (even for managers) or the freedom to choose when and where you work? Axpo offers all these as well as the chance to buy additional vacation days if you need them.


You're covered Investing in your future starts now. Axpo pays generous employer contributions to the pension fund. If you get sick, we'll cover your salary in full for up to two years. And because safety's a priority, we offer private accident insurance for everyone as well as reduced premiums for health insurance.


The whole package As a market leader in our field, we offer competitive salaries across Axpo including a variable compensation component. Important to us is our commitment to equal pay for equal work.



About us
Axpo is Switzerland's largest producer of renewable energies. The Trading & Sales business unit is a world leader in energy trading and the marketing of solar and wind power. With a true entrepreneurial mindset and around 1,000 employees in asset-backed trading, prop trading and origination functions in over 30 countries throughout Europe as well as the USA and Asia, we develop innovative, sustainable energy solutions for our business customers and private customers worldwide. Good collaboration between colleagues in the team and the various specialist areas is central to our success. We have an open corporate culture and we value diversity. We therefore welcome applicants regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic or social background, religion or ideology, disability, age, sexual orientation or identity.



About the team
Axpo Solutions has decided to accelerate the Advanced Analytics transformation and the wider deployment of model-based trading across the different commodity desks and countries. The role of the Data Scientist is to translate the business needs to advanced mathematical models and create state of the art but yet pragmatic solutions, supporting profit generation. You will be part of a dynamic and diverse team across Axpo Solutions that focuses on end-to-end implementation of high impact use cases across Europe and commodity desks. Regular contact with teams of traders, quantitative analysts as well as the management who is a strong supporter of the ML-based trading approach. We offer you an entrepreneurial, dynamic and international environment in which you can actively contribute your strengths to help maintaining and ensuring the future success of Axpo.


Contact

job_title: Research Scientist - Oncology Drug Discovery & Radiobiology...
job_summary:
6500! That’s the number of associates in the Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR). This division is the innovation engine of Novartis, focusing on powerful new technologies that have the potential to help produce therapeutic breakthroughs for patients.
    
 NIBR Oncology is currently recruiting a research associate to join our expanding in vitro radiobiology team. Applications are invited for an associate position in an oncology research laboratory that will carry out cutting-edge research in the areas of oncology drug discovery and radioisotope-based therapies together with leading research groups within NIBR. This is an excellent opportunity to join a world class research team at NIBR in Basel, Switzerland.
    
 The candidate will be part of the in vitro radiation biology team and work towards understanding and validating the effect of radiation caused by radioligand conjugates on various cellular functions including DNA damage repair (DDR) and cell fate. The primary responsibilities of the candidate will be to perform in vitro radiobiology activities, cellular assays, immunofluorescence, FACS, and molecular biology, ultimately leading to target identification, validation and drug discovery. We seek an experienced, motivated, and ambitious associate wishing to continue a successful scientific career in a fast-paced drug discovery environment. 
    
 The ideal candidate should have a strong hands-on background in in vitro radiation biology, molecular biology, immunofluorescence, and expertise in cellular assays. The successful candidate will perform independent experimentation and data analysis and is expected to play a key role in the mechanistic understanding of the radioligand therapies and their cellular effects as single agents as well as in combination in the field of cancer.
    
 Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
    


Safe and effective work with radionuclides
Ability to work independently with minimum supervision
Independently generate hypotheses, design, perform, analyze, interpret experiments, and communicate data under guidance of the team lead
Strong team player with excellent presentation and communication skills in English (oral/written)
Recognize problems and provides input on solutions; suggest new approaches to established procedures to progress the projects
Efficiently contribute to maintaining a functional laboratory, technical equipment, and tools 
Enthusiasm and commitment to achieve set goals within tight deadlines




Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.



Minimum requirements

    What you will bring to the role:
    


Qualification as lab technician (apprenticeship or ‘Fachhochschule”) or first degree (MSc, BSc) in radiation biology, cellular biology, molecular biology or another relevant discipline
2-5 years (or more), practical work experience in radiobiology highly recommended, biomedical research gained in an industry or academic laboratory
Proficiency and hands-on experience in applying a wide range of cellular/molecular biological and/or biochemical methods (in particular RNAi, CRISPR, qRT-PCR, cloning, cell culture, transient/stable cell line generation, immunoblotting, ELISA, FACS) 
Expertise in fluorescence microscopy-based methods such as immunofluorescence is strongly desirable 
Good knowledge of cancer signaling/biology

 Why Novartis?
    
 769 million lives were touched by Novartis medicines in 2020, and while we’re proud of this, we know there is so much more we could do to help improve and extend people’s lives.
    
 We believe new insights, perspectives and ground-breaking solutions can be found at the intersection of medical science and digital innovation. That a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment inspires new ways of working.
    
 We believe our potential can thrive and grow in an unbossed culture underpinned by integrity, curiosity and flexibility. And we can reinvent what's possible, when we collaborate with courage to aggressively and ambitiously tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges. Because the greatest risk in life, is the risk of never trying!
    
 Imagine what you could do here at Novartis!
    


Some restrictions on flexible working options may apply and will be discussed during interview if applicable.

 Join our Novartis Network:
    
 If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Ihre Aufgaben 

Sie sind verantwortlich für den Aufbau, die tagesaktuelle Pflege, Validierung, und die Sicherung von Datenbeständen.
 Sie bringen sich in das integrierte Datenmanagement ein, und tragen zur Weiterentwicklung des Datenmanagements zusammen mit der IT und Fachexperten Forschung und Intensivmedizin bei.
 Die Harmonisierung von Daten/Datensemantik, Datenqualitätsprüfungen, Datenverarbeitung, und Modelling gehört ebenfalls zu Ihren Aufgaben. Insbesondere unterstützen Sie die Entwicklung und Aktualisierung von RDF-Schemen und die Erstellung neuer Datenkonzepte unter Verwendung spezifischer Ontologien (SPHN, SNOMED-CT, LOINC) in enger Zusammenarbeit mit zentralen Datenmanagern.
 Sie sind für die Erstellung von Datenexporten aus den elektronischen Krankenakten sowie Patientendaten-Monitoringsystemen (PDMS) und deren Verarbeitung für Linkage/Auswertungen und weitere Verwendung zuständig.
 Sie arbeiten in einem multidisziplinären Team inklusive IT, computational science, Intensivmedizin, Metabolik/Genomik, und Forschung zusammen.
 Im Rahmen des Projektes arbeiten Sie mit nationalen und internationales Registern und wissenschaftlichen Studien, auch im Bereich von Machine Learning/ Artificial intelligence/ Assisted decision-making zusammen.


 Ihr Profil 

Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung und entsprechende Berufserfahrung in Computer Science, Data Science, Data Management, Medizininformatik
 Erfahrung im Umgang mit Datenbanken sowie im Management grosser Datensätze
 Wünschenswert Erfahrung zu Prozessen / Daten auf medizinischen Fachbereichen
 Fundierte Kenntnisse in MS Office, MS SQL Voraussetzung, Kenntnis in Python, R, Stata, oder SPSS erwünscht, Erfahrung in RedCAP von Vorteil.
 Selbständige, zuverlässige und flexible Persönlichkeit
 Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse, gute Deutschkenntnisse


 Arbeitgeber Kinderspital Zürich Das Kinderspital Zürich ist mit rund 2'500 Mitarbeitenden das grösste Universitäts-Kinderspital der Schweiz und eines der führenden Zentren für Kinder- und Jugendmedizin in Europa. Das Grösste am "Kispi" aber sind die Kleinen: Bis zu 100'000 Patienten werden jährlich versorgt, in 47 Fachbereichen tun wir alles zu ihrem Wohl. Nicht nur modernste Geräte und höchste Qualität in der Behandlung werden am Kispi gross geschrieben, sondern auch ein gutes Gespür für Zwischenmenschliches. Neben dem gesamten kindermedizinischen und kinderchirurgischen Spektrum bietet das Kinderspital auch ein einzigartiges Rehabilitationszentrum und ein Forschungszentrum.

The Swiss Tropical and Public Health Institute (Swiss TPH) is a world-leading institute in global health with a particular focus on low- and middle-income countries. Associated with the University of Basel, Swiss TPH combines research, education and services at local, national and international levels. 900 people from 80 nations work at Swiss TPH focusing on infectious and non-communicable diseases, environment, society and health as well as health systems and interventions.   The Clinical Research Unit (Head: Klaus Reither) performs high quality clinical research with translational impact and fosters clinical development of safe, effective and affordable medicines and devices for the benefit of people in and from resource limited countries.   The Clinical Tuberculosis Research Group invites applications for a
TB Scientist (100%)

Your responsibilities include:

 To design, implement and coordinate clinical and epidemiological tuberculosis (TB) studies in close collaboration with partner institutes primarily in Tanzania, Lesotho and Georgia
 To analyze and publish research data and to present findings at scientific meetings
 To develop new TB research project proposals, trial budgets and study protocols
 To contribute to the teaching and training programs at Swiss TPH and University of Basel
 To develop and maintain clinical research partnerships with Swiss TPH’s collaborators


 You should have the following experiences and skills in: 


Medical Doctor certification required; an additional PhD is an appreciated asset
 Proven track record in clinical TB research (minimum of 5 years)
 Advanced skills in statistical analyses
 Ability to work independently
 Team player with good social skills
 Reliable, precise, and well-structured working style
 Flexibility and willingness to stay and work outside of Switzerland
 Fluent in English (spoken and written) is required; French is seen as an asset


We offer:


 Well-filled research project pipeline with a focus on clinical TB studies, especially in diagnostics
 Excellent collaborations with international TB study sites
 Established networks with leading TB research groups
 Interdisciplinary in-house collaborations in Mtb genomics (S. Gagneux) and TB immunology (D. Portevin)
 An individual career development plan and good options for academic advancement
 Adequate and attractive remuneration / appropriate pay package

 Swiss TPH an equal opportunity employer committed to excellence through diversity.

 The position is open immediately and will be supported for an initial period of at least 2 years (with the prospect of extension if further research funding is obtained). If you are interested, please submit your application in English with:
  

 CV

 Complete course grades
 Names and contact details of 2-3 referees

 Please note that we can only accept applications via our online recruiting tool: 
  https://jobs.swisstph.ch/Jobs/All. Applications via e-mail or external recruiter will not be considered.

 Start Date: As soon as possible

Contact
If you have any questions, please contact Dr. Klaus Reither, Head of Clinical Research Unit and Group Leader Clinical TB Research. Email: Klaus.Reither@swisstph.ch

Genedata transforms data into intelligence with innovative software solutions that incorporate extensive biopharma R&D domain knowledge. Multinational biopharmaceutical organizations and cutting-edge biotechs around the globe rely on Genedata to digitalize and automate data-rich and complex R&D processes. From early discovery all the way to the clinic, Genedata solutions help maximize the ROI in R&D expenditure. Founded in 1997, Genedata is headquartered in Basel, Switzerland with additional offices in Boston, London, Munich, San Francisco, Singapore, and Tokyo.About the RoleAre you a scientist who would like to use your scientific and technical knowledge to solve real-world problems in assay analytics? Are you interested in jointly exploring technical solutions with our customers to raise the impact of their R&D programs? Would you like to wear many different hats throughout your work week – scientific and technical expert, project manager, product developer, teacher, diplomat, business traveler – and sharpen your skills as you go along?As a Genedata Scientific Consultant/Field Application Scientist, you will act as a scientific and technical consultant for our scientist users, helping them to best leverage our software for efficiently conducting their research programs, adopting new methodologies, and making a difference towards the development of new medicines. You will investigate R&D workflows and IT infrastructures, analyze requirements, shape solutions for our customers, and manage projects to deliver these. You also will reflect on the value our products can bring to prospects and customers in concrete settings, and aid our sales team in communicating such value, including qualifying needs and giving pre-sales demos.
Your Responsibilities

Become an expert in biological screening data analysis in general and the use of our Genedata Screener software in particular
Support our customers in getting the most out of Genedata Screener, starting during pre-sales and continuing throughout the product life cycle
Propose, plan, execute and manage internal and external projects, such as scientific consulting, software implementation, systems integration, and data analysis projects
Work with our Business Account Managers to establish and communicate the value of our products
Use your knowledge, creativity, and technical skills to explore with our customers new areas of need and further advance our science, marketing, development, and product management

Skills & Experience

You should feel comfortable interacting with customers on all levels and be prepared to constantly communicate internally
You should be curious about the research and development our customers conduct as well as interested in understanding how they quantify business value and assign priority to their activities
PhD degree (preferably post-doctorate, industry experience is a plus), experience in immunology, antibody discovery, cell therapy or a related field
Experience with assay data analysis, preferably of high-volume life science data
Experience with a scripting language (preferably Python) as well as basic familiarity with the UNIX shell environment is a plus
You like business travel – up to 30% of your time may be spent visiting customers

What We OfferGenedata is on a mission to accelerate the pace of biopharma R&D. Our enterprise software solutions digitalize and automate lab operations so scientists can discover insights faster, push scientific boundaries farther, and drive change right now. With over two decades of success due to closely-knit teams of scientists, software engineers, and business experts, Genedata has become the market-leading provider of enterprise software solutions for biopharma R&D.As a private and majority employee-owned organization, we empower each employee to be a contributing voice in the company operations and evolution. Our collective expertise in scientific R&D informatics, combined with our open and scalable software platform, makes us the essential technology for the operations of top biopharma companies and innovative biotechs worldwide.We are headquartered in Basel, Switzerland and have subsidiaries in the US, Germany, UK, Japan, and Singapore.Genedata offers an attractive Total Reward Package comprised of a competitive salary and attractive benefits in return for your contribution to our success.As an equal opportunity employer, Genedata proudly celebrates diversity and believes in an inclusive workplace.
Next StepsGenedata does not accept applications from recruitment agencies.If you are interested in this position, please apply
Job Type: Full-time

job_title: Systems and Site Reliability Team Lead- VPN
job_summary:
A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.

 Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world’s largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.  
Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times, some of the world’s largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world.  
Join one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world’s most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.

 Purpose of the role Proton continues to scale at a rapid pace, and we're looking for experienced Site Reliability Engineers to join our team. As part of the Proton VPN Infrastructure team, you will lead the infrastructure team responsible for the continuous improvement and growth of Proton VPN's globally distributed infrastructure.

 You will liaise with the VPN R&D Team, and with Client Teams, to ensure the quality of our service is continuously improving to best serve our growing user base. You will also ensure the tooling used to perform operations becomes increasingly efficient, allowing us to accelerate Proton VPN’s growth and our ability to adapt to very rapidly changing circumstances in the global landscape.

 What you will do

 Establish service level objectives for your team and monitor service level indicators
 Continuously improve our monitoring and observability strategy at the infrastructure layer
 R&D new technologies & processes to optimize our infrastructure operations and performance
 Promote SRE best practices in our infrastructure architecture, and in build and deployment pipelines
 Contribute to work in our security layers
 Lead the System Administration Team
 Actively collaborate with the other VPN and Proton teams to find optimal solutions to everyday challenges


 BA/BS degree or equivalent
 10+ years of working experience preferred
 A software engineering background or code development experience in one of the following programming languages: shell, or Python
 Knowledge of monitoring and observability tools (such as Icinga, Prometheus, Grafana) and techniques
 Mastery of configuration management tools (such as Ansible or Puppet)
 Good command of networking and corresponding tooling (DNS, routing, nftables, OpenVPN, IKEv2, WireGuard...)
 Operational experience with Linux
 Able to troubleshoot outages or performance issues and do packet inspection analysis with WireShark
 Excellent knowledge of performance and security practices
 Fluent in English, our working language


 Why you should join Proton


 Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and supporting organizations that advance the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable. 
 Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit, with people coming from all walks of life. Many members of our team spent time at the world’s top academic institutions, including MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Princeton, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH. 
Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service – Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more. 
Grow with us - We’re one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields. 
Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else’s problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.
 Benefits – these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events, and team-building activities. 



Proton uses the Recruitee recruitment platform for a more effective hiring process and a better candidate experience. Your data will always be kept confidential and is not shared with any third parties. You will receive emails from the email address careers@protonmail.recruitee.com or other addresses on the protonmail.recruitee.com domain as part of the recruitment process.

 Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation where Proton employs the relevant candidate. 


By applying to a role at Proton, you acknowledge that we will process and store your personal data for at least the duration of the hiring process and as necessary to enter a contractual relationship with you.

Syngenta is a R&D global leader in agriculture; dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture.
Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. We invite you to help us shape the future of agriculture. At Syngenta, we believe every employee has a role to play in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet.
Formulation Chemist (m/f/d) - 18042822
Role Purpose and accountabilities:
The role of the Formulation Department in Münchwilen is key to turn Syngenta innovative active ingredients into Crop Protection products designed to support farmers to produce healthy, nutritious food and help lead the transition into a more sustainable agriculture. This includes the development and optimization of novel formulations from lab to production scale as well as products’ support throughout their whole lifetime. For our Formulation Department, we are looking for a Formulation Chemist to join a Team working on the design of formulations based on new active ingredients. Working in the lab, you will be planning and conducting experimental programs to support a portfolio of projects, working largely independently but under the support of your team leader, so good organization skills, scientific curiosity and an ability to solve technical problems are all critical for the role. It will be particularly expected that you apply your fundamental understanding of physical chemistry and a scientific approach to generate & implement innovative ideas/methods/technologies to support the delivery of formulations meeting the pre-defined design requirements. Our Formulation Scientific Specialists undertake research within the scope of the project, establishing a program of research activity working collaboratively with internal colleagues and external partners. Therefore, you need to be comfortable working at the interface of scientific disciplines as you will be working with scientists from other functions as part of multi-disciplinary project teams (as Chemistry, Biology, Analytical Science, Regulatory). You will need great communication skills to report, record and present your data to technical and business teams as well as influence key projects’ decisions and directions.


Requirements:

PhD (Postdoc experience beneficial) or Master’s degree (with relevant work experience) in a field of applied life sciences (pharmaceutical sciences, food sciences, chemistry, biochemistry, biotechnology) or chemical/process engineering.
Knowledge of several formulation types and technologies as well as experience with scale-up and manufacturing requirements is beneficial.
Ability to establish a personal network across functions, support implementation of new working practices or tools by showing their value to others.
Informed risk taking: Takes calculated, informed risks by leveraging a “minimum viable product” approach and challenging any work that does not add value.
Empowered decision making: Embraces the single decision maker model and drives decision making down to the lowest appropriate level.
Enterprise mindset: considers the impact of their efforts on the entire organization rather than any single team or function.
Team player: Strong organizational, communication, interpersonal skills, team-oriented, dependable with an ability to follow detailed verbal and written instruction.
Able to work in a fast-paced environment: Must be self-motivated, able to multi-task, and meet timelines efficiently and productively.
Demonstrated language skills in English (at least C1) and German (at least B2).


What we offer:


We offer a variety of financial and non-financial benefits including:
We offer a position which contributes to valuable and impactful work in a stimulating and international environment
A superb working environment with an open culture and diverse workforce where new ideas are always welcome
The opportunity to work with and learn from highly qualified and experienced employees and gain scientific and technical excellence
Learning culture (Together we Grow) and wide range of training options
You will profit from a competitive pension fund plan, attractive bonus system, onsite doctor, fitness room, canteen, and other benefits (Family friendly initiatives, Child, and Family allowance…)


Interested? We look forward to receiving your online application including all relevant documents (cover letter, CV) – reference number 18042822.
Please be aware that the job title may differ from the position title. Did you know? Syngenta has been ranked as a top employer by Science Journal. Learn more about our team, our mission and how we achieve our goals.
Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status

Data Scientist II, Lodging Analytics


 Do you want to make a difference in a global Technology & Travel company?



 Join us at Expedia Group and use your Analytical expertise to enable our partners to set up their properties optimally. In doing so, you will contribute to positively impact our Traveler’s experience and ensure that they build great memories from the trips they take with Expedia Group.



 In this position, you will dedicate part of your time to support the account management efforts for newly onboarded partners as they go live on Expedia Group websites. For this strategic project, you will be responsible to analyze interactions, identify trends and recommend actions, while building a model estimating the value derived from partner interactions. You will also support the Process Solutions team, which leads high-impact transversal programs across the account management spectrum to improve efficiency from Acquisition to Market Management.




 To succeed in these tasks, you will build on deep functional expertise and use your problem-solving skills to identify relevant datasets, create analytical frameworks and provide relevant recommendations for stakeholders. If you are self-driven and have demonstrated success in using analytics & data science to drive innovation and continuous improvement, then this position is for you!



 What you’ll do:



 Frame business challenges as analytical problems and apply problem solving techniques to break it down into a concrete set of analytical tasks
 Extract and clean data from multiple sources and combine them into the required datasets for model building or analytics
 Apply a range of common statistical methods, determining ideal method (incrementality analysis, hypothesis testing…) for the problem considering underlying assumptions






 Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards in Tableau to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs
 Articulate clearly and confidently decision-making rationale, methodology and recommendation to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
 Partner closely with your peers within the Lodging Analytics organization and beyond to ensure best practice sharing and build on each other work




 Who you are:





 Bachelor's, Master's, PhD, or Equivalent Experience; Mathematics, Science, Statistics or Technical degree preferred otherwise relevant experience is applicable
 2+ year of relevant experience in data science and/or analytics translating complex data findings into clear insights
 Familiar with Python, Scala or R, with an intermediate level in Statistics
 Hands-on experience in SQL
 Excellent data visualization skills and proficiency using tools like Tableau/Power BI…






 Passion for logical problem solving and intellectual challenges, with the ability to see the bigger picture whilst not missing the details.
 Ability to manage key relationships: mobilize, influence, and lead others without having positional authority, by interacting and building rapport with teams of all levels, in a fast-moving and ever-changing environment.
 Team player & Inclusive - Build a climate of inclusion to bring a diverse set of perspectives to the team and solutions.
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills.






 We offer:



 A work environment where you can grow your career. We invest in our employees’ development and prioritize making Expedia Group a great place to work.
 An equal opportunity work-environment, where we value diversity
 50% work from office
 2 weeks a year from any of our offices in the world






 New parent benefits (generous paternity, maternity and adoption leave)
 Leisure travel discounts and reimbursement budget for your weekend and holidays!
 Wellness reimbursement budget.

The Paul Scherrer Institute PSI is the largest research institute for natural and engineering sciences within Switzerland. We perform cutting-edge research in the fields of matter and materials, energy and environment and human health. By performing fundamental and applied research, we work on sustainable solutions for major challenges facing society, science and economy. PSI is committed to the training of future generations. Therefore, about one quarter of our staff are post-docs, post-graduates or apprentices. Altogether, PSI employs 2100 people.
    
 For the Solid State Spectroscopy Group within the Laboratory for Neutron Scattering and Imaging we are looking for a
    





Scientist (Tenure Track) 



  Neutron Spectroscopy
 

Your tasks



   You will be co-responsible for the thermal triple axis spectrometer EIGER at SINQ and use it together with the cold triple axis spectrometer TASP and the novel multiplexing spectrometer CAMEA for your research. You support the external user program, and be actively involved in the technical development of the instrument suite at SINQ, with a focus on the development of data reduction and analysis software. You will pursue an independent and ambitious research program preferably in the field of quantum materials. 
  


Your profile




You hold a PhD degree in experimental physics or chemistry and you have an excellent scientific record


 Experience in neutron spectroscopy and good programming skills (preferably Python) are mandatory


 You have good communication skills


 You enjoy working in a team-oriented interdisciplinary environment





We offer



   Our institution is based on an interdisciplinary, innovative and dynamic collaboration. You will profit from a systematic training on the job, in addition to personal development possibilities and our pronounced vocational training culture. If you wish to optimally combine work and family life or other personal interests, we are able to support you with our modern employment conditions and the on-site infrastructure.
   

     This is a Tenure Track position. The employment contract will initially be limited to 3 years.
   

 For further information, please contact Prof. Dr Christof Niedermayer, phone 
    +41 56 310 20 86.
   

 Please submit your application online 
    by 15 September 2022 (including list of publications and addresses of referees) for the position as a Scientist (Tenure Track) (index no. 3302-00).
   
 Paul Scherrer Institut, Human Resources Management, Sevil Minniti, 5232 Villigen PSI, Switzerland

Minimum qualifications:

 Experience in data acquisition. 
Experience with machine learning infrastructure.

 Preferred qualifications:

 Experience with geospatial data acquisition, ingest, and hosting at planet scale. 
Experience with deep learning research. 
Experience with meteorology.


About the job
 At Google, research-focused Software Engineers are embedded throughout the company, allowing them to setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly. Ideas may come from internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world.
 From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, engineers work on real-world problems including artificial intelligence, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more. But you stay connected to your research roots as an active contributor to the wider research community by partnering with universities and publishing papers.
 Weather impacts users, businesses, and many Google products. It also influences everything from how we plan our day to how we survive in a changing climate. With vast amounts of collected data from diverse sources such as radar stations, geostationary satellites, and user input, predicting the weather is a planet-scale problem. Our team aims to accelerate the transition to AI-based weather forecasts by pursuing research and enabling product development. Our approach uses machine learning to cast the weather with greater resolution (e.g., space and time) and accuracy that existing physics-based models. 
As a Research Engineer, you will work with data ingestion and understand excellent ML research to create a solution that can affect all users. 
Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software engineers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world's fast-paced business needs.


 Responsibilities

Develop, deploy, and improve the weather forecast model. 
Ingest planet-scale weather datasets, including radar, satellite, and ground stations.
Train and test ML models at scale on Google infrastructure. 
Innovate model architectures in order to improve performance.
Work with Product teams in Search and across Alphabet to deploy improved weather predictions in Google products.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Company information 
Solvias is an internationally recognized provider of integrated solutions in contract analytical research, development and manufacturing. The company offers a broad spectrum of services and solutions in the Pharmaceutical, Biotech, Medical Device, Cell&Gene Therapy and Cosmetic industries. With headquarters near Basel, Switzerland, over 700 highly qualified employees take pride in putting science at the heart of serving customers to bring safer and better products to market faster. 
Our team characterizes pharmaceutical products and possible contaminants using among others: Light and Electron Microscopy, Spectroscopy, Laser Diffraction, Flow Imaging methods and more. 

 Job Description 



Independently handle customer orders in the field of drug product and drug substance analysis
You will be responsible for planning and execution of analytical projects including reporting and order coordination
You plan and perform experiments in the context of method development, qualifications and validations
You provide scientific and technical support to customers, both individual and as part of larger project teams
Take over responsibility for analytical instrumentation (troubleshooting, data integrity and coordination with suppliers)
GMP-compliant documentation of activities as well as support and maintenance of equipment
 Requirements 



Degree in chemistry, pharmacy, forensics biology or comparable natural science degree
Hands on experience with microscopy light and/or electron microscopy and corresponding sample preparation techniques)
Experience in one or more of the following is advantageous: Microscopy/imaging of biological/viral samples; pharmaceutical powder/particle characterization; analysis/identification of foreign particulate matter, subvisible particle analysis
Proactive with a can-do attitude and very good communication skills
Work experience in a GMP regulated environment is an advantage
Team player with a strong service mentality and sense of resposibility
Very good knowledge of German and English (written and spoken)
 Our employees are very close to our hearts. Each individual can make a difference and develop both professionally and personally.

Junior Data Scientist (f/m/d) – Python /SQL Development / Agile / Machine Learning / English

Project:  For our customer Roche Diagnostics International AG based in Rotkreuz we are looking for a highly qualified Junior Data Scientist.
 Background:
 As a Junior Data Scientist in the RMD System Development (SD) chapter, the candidate will have a unique and rewarding opportunity to shape upcoming Data Mesh products built around RMD platforms. The candidate will work as a team member across the complete instrument data products life cycle including architecture, design, development, test, and deployment, with the focus of applying data science best practices to Systems Root Cause Investigations (RCI).The team includes a diversity of backgrounds from Data Scientists with a focus in survival analysis, anomaly detection, natural language processing to experienced systems and software
 engineers. Therefore, the team is looking for candidates with formal Data Science training and solid software engineering skills.
 Tasks & Responsibilities:

Understand product requirements and translate them into data science outcomes that will support Product Care activities
Build and own Tableau dashboards with data narratives (KPI, trends etc)
Support the entire SD Product Care team with ad hoc data tasks/requests including data engineering tasks
Apply automation to make the most of our data platform’s computation and storage resources
Leverage big data technologies perform distributed data processing pipelines: AWS/ Snowflake


 Must Haves:

Min. Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Software engineering, Mathematics or similar (STEM)
Min. 6 months of experience as a data scientist, preferred in a project environment
Hands-on coding and programming experience (e.g. Python)
Project experience with SQL development
Fluency in English (spoken and written), German is a plus
Great problem solving and communication skills
Able to prepare and create clear documentation and communicate and adapt the processes
Ability to interpret and translate/explain technical requirements into tasks

Nice to have:

Experience working in an agile development environment as part of a sprint team
Interest in Machine Learning
Interest in systems reliability engineering

Was du bewegst:
Mit Leidenschaft und Teamgeist arbeiten wir an innovativen Lösungen, die vor den Folgen von Krankheit und Unfall schützen. Damit das Leben unserer Kundinnen und Kunden einfacher wird.  Visualisierung und Kommunikation von Resultaten im Team, gegenüber Stakeholder und Management



Weshalb dir das gelingt:

Du verfügst über eine relevante Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Engineering / Data Science und bist versiert in den Programmiersprachen Python, R und SQL
 Du bist mit den gängigen Cloud-Plattformen (von Vorteil GCP) vertraut und bringst idealerweise Erfahrung mit MLOps mit. Know How über Kafka und/oder Infrastructure as Code ist von Vorteil

 Du verfügst über einen (Fach-)Hochschulabschluss mit naturwissenschaftlichem oder technischem Schwerpunkt und gute Deutschkenntnisse



Worauf du zählen kannst:
Mit rund 840'000 Kundinnen und Kunden gehört Sanitas zu den grössten Krankenversicherungen der Schweiz. In einem modernen und flexiblen Arbeitsumfeld entwickelst du dabei deine Fähigkeiten weiter.

Flexibles Jahresarbeitszeitmodell mit 5 bis 7 Wochen Ferien
 Moderne Büros an urbanen Standorten

 Beiträge an die Pensionskasse deutlich über dem gesetzlichen Minimum
 Zukunftsweisende Fragestellungen und ein breites Angebot an Aus- und Weiterbildungen



Ergänzende Informationen

Diese Du-Kultur möchten wir daher gerne auch in deinem weiteren Bewerbungsprozess pflegen und werden daher per Du mit dir kommunizieren.
