A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.
 Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world’s largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared. 
Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times, some of the world’s largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world. 
Join one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world’s most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.

 Purpose of the role

 As an Engineering Manager for Proton Calendar, you will be responsible for managing and growing a dedicated team of mobile developers (iOS and Android) developing our mobile encrypted calendar apps. Your team will have direct responsibility for successfully bringing the applications to production and driving adoption by our community. As a member of the Proton Calendar leadership team, you will advocate for making continuous investments in developer productivity, code quality, and security standards while ensuring fast feature delivery. You will also extensively collaborate with our product managers to develop a strategic direction for your team.

 What you will do

 Build products, systems, and services that solve our customers' problems
 Lead and participate in the technical design and product discussions
 Guide your team to continuously improve our systems towards greater observability and resiliency
 Collaborate with other engineering managers and your peers to develop your team's strategy
 Hire, develop, and mentor engineers to help them achieve their goals and grow in their career
 Foster an inclusive environment for your team to show up and give their best each day
 Hold yourself and your team accountable to high engineering standards
 Develop efficient processes, and motivate your team to operate with high velocity, ownership, and accountability 
Contribute to Proton's technology and open source communities


 Technologies we use

 Languages: Swift, Kotlin, C
 RESTful APIs
 Collaboration tools: git, GitLab, JIRA, Confluence


6+ years of professional experience
 2+ years directly leading / managing engineers
 Knowledge of Kotlin or Swift
 Experience in building complex UI projects
 Background operations / push notifications experience
 A history of collaboration with product, product marketing, design, and analytics on developing product roadmaps
 A curious, passionate, and growth-oriented mindset
 Experience creating well-crafted, maintainable code
 Eagerness to share your ideas, and openness to those of others

  Why you should join Proton

 Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.
 Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world’s top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH. 
Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more. 
Grow with us - We’re one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields. 
Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else’s problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.
 Benefits – these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events and team building activities. 



Proton uses the Recruitee recruitment platform for a more effective hiring process and a better candidate experience. Your data will always be kept confidential and is not shared with any third parties. You will receive emails from the email address careers@protonmail.recruitee.com or other addresses on the protonmail.recruitee.com domain as part of the recruitment process.

 Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation where Proton employs the relevant candidate.

 By applying to a role at Proton, you acknowledge that we will process and store your personal data for at least the duration of the hiring process and as necessary to enter a contractual relationship with you.

Company Description
  MindMaze is a global leader in digital neuro-therapeutics (DTx) solutions with a mission to accelerate the brain's ability to recover, learn and adapt. With over a decade of work at the intersection of neuroscience, bio-sensing, engineering, mixed reality, and artificial intelligence, our healthcare division is addressing some of the most challenging problems in neurology, including stroke, Alzheimer disease, and Parkinson disease, by creating the universal platform for brain health and recovery and unique digital therapeutic interventions. MindMaze's pioneering FDA cleared and CE marked neuro-digital therapeutics accelerate patients' recovery from many critical neurological conditions. Join our eclectic mix of scientists, physicists, engineers and clinicians, and grow with MindMaze.
 Join our eclectic mix of scientists, physicists, engineers, and clinicians, and grow with MindMaze.



 Job Description
  You will join a small team and participate in the maintenance and evolution of the IT infrastructures. The HQ is in Switzerland, your scope will be multi-site with a mix of in-house and cloud environment.
 If you are flexible, open-minded, with a flair for new technologies while able to adapt to healthcare regulations and constraints, please get in touch!
 You will:

 Configure, manage and maintain the technical and security requirements of physical servers, Virtual systems and operating systems in a mixed Linux/Windows/MAC environment
 Provide admin support for special purpose systems including new services implementations – Collaboration services (Atlassian Confluence/Jira/Bitbucket), File sharing solutions (Owncloud), and SSO integration (Keycloak, LDAP/Kerberos/SAML/OAuth/OpenID)
 Perform periodic performance reports and optimize resources
 Harden and lock down Windows and Linux systems to ensure full compliance with security requirements
 Windows server management in particular in a mixed environment
 Configure and manage Authentication systems, SSO, Hardware authentication (Yubikey..), PKI, Radius
 Configure and manage virtualisation environments – Docker, KVM, LXC
 Ensure monitoring – Zabbix, Prometheus, Elastic Stack
 Configure and Deploy management tools – Ansible
 Use and management of versioning tools – Git
 Standardize workstations equipment - Ansible management across multiple platforms
 Maintain network facilities in individual machines and settings of personal computers
 Ensure new account creation/adjustment/cancelation. Manage users’ systems/accounts authorization rights in the IT infrastructure
 Maintain data center environment and equipment
 Perform regular security monitoring to identify possible intrusions
 Documentation, POC and validation




 Qualifications
 

 Bachelor degree in computer science or Systems Administration/system Engineer certification or equivalent is a plus
 5+ years of work experience as System Administrator
 Experience in Linux system administration and networking
 Experience of Linux shell scripting, programming skills (Bash, Python, Perl...)
 Experience of virtualisation
 Experience with Network design and security
 Windows systems administration is a plus

 Additional Information
 

 Flexible work environment
 Excellent location, easily accessible with an amazing lake view
 Unlimited coffee, fresh fruits and snacks

 Benefits

 Homeoffice

 Warum Du mit uns Deinen nächsten Karriereschritt machen solltest?
 Wir sind als KMU im Familienbesitz seit über 20 Jahren die spezialisierte Partnerin für die Besetzung von Fach- und Führungskräften. Die Firmengruppe ist in verschiedene Fachbereiche unterteilt und verfügt in jedem Segment über fundierte, fachliche Kompetenz.  Dass unsere Bewerber über die nötigen fachlichen Voraussetzungen für eine ausgeschriebene Position verfügen, setzen wir voraus. Durch diese sehr engmaschige Selektion schaffen wir die Möglichkeit, für unsere Kandidatinnen und Kandidaten mehr Zeit zu haben. Zeit für eine ausführliche Beratung und umfangreiche Betreuung.
 Wir gestalten die Zukunft mit

 Wir wertschätzen Vielfalt und begrüssen daher alle Bewerbungen – unabhängig von Geschlecht, sozialer Herkunft, Religion/Weltanschauung, Alter und Identität.

job_title: Data Science Consultant Specialized in Machine Learning
job_summary:
NCCR Evolving Language
Data Science Consultant Specialized in Machine Learning 80-100 % Within the National Center of Competence in Research (NCCR) Evolving Language, which involves nearly 40 different research groups from a large variety of disciplines across Switzerland, and the University of Zurich Technology Platform LiRI (Linguistic Research Infrastructure), we seek to hire an expert in machine learning.
  
 The successful candidate will join our small Team of Data Scientists and contribute to our mission of delivering state-of-the-art machine learning solutions and workflows. The position is initially limited for a period of one year with the possibility of extension and a permanent contract. The successful candidate will join a data science task force at the NCCR's headquarters in Zurich in co-affiliation with the University of Zurich's Technology Platform LiRI (Linguistic Research Infrastructure). 
 

Your responsibilities If you are interested in language evolution, you want to develop the next generation machine learning solutions for research on brain and behavior, and you enjoy collaborating with language scientists, ethologists, and neuroscientists, then you are the person we are looking for. You will be expected to work proactively in a team of data scientists and software engineers, to provide consulting services, to help organize workshops, and to spend time in the various labs of the NCCR network. We collaborate with data science platforms at the ETH Zurich and EPF Lausanne as well as with partners in industry (e.g. the Google Research Natural Language Processing Group in Zurich). 
 

Your profile You have a PhD degree in a relevant discipline such as natural language processing, speech recognition, sound separation, computational neuroscience, neuroinformatics, action recognition, etc. You are knowledgeable in problem settings in the domains relevant to the NCCR and are well versed with machine learning techniques including deep learning and reinforcement learning. You are experienced in developing efficient solutions in both small and big data settings. You have excellent communication and collaboration skills. We place great emphasis on teamwork and on multidisciplinary perspectives. 
 

What we offer We offer varied and interesting work in an inspiring and respectful environment. We promote a work environment of diversity and inclusion. We place emphasis on gender balance; we particularly encourage women to apply. 
 

Place of work Zurich 
 

Start of employment Applications should include
  
 a cover letter stating your motivation and vision for the field,
 a CV with publication list,
 a copy of the highest degree,
 and the names of three references.

 Review of applications starts May 20 and applications are accepted until the position is filled. Please submit your application as a single PDF labelled 'MachineLearning-YourSurname.pdf'. Questions can be addressed to Prof. Richard Hahnloser.

As one of the top suppliers to our client, a prestigious bank in Basel, Swisslinx are looking for a highly motivated and technology savvy Data Engineer with solid experience in data modelling, business intelligence and Big Data/DWH systems to accelerate implementation of our client’s next generation data and analytics systems.
 
 This is a rolling contract for a role based in Basel, Switzerland, initially running for 12 months with an excellent chance of extension as the role is crucial to the day to day running of the bank.
 
 The scope of the project is to build a strategic corporate business intelligence and data analytics platform using sophisticated data and visualization technologies, starting with the finance cost and IT budget management area.
 
 The project is initially planned for 2 years i.e., until financial year 2023/24, subject to annual prioritization process.
 
 As a hands-on Data Engineer in a small, diverse and passionate Agile team your responsibilities include:
 


Provide implementation support on a variety of data management and analytics projects using the Bank’s approved databases (big data as well as relational databases) and analytical technologies
Develop optimal data models for data storage as well as end-to-end data pipelines for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from/to a wide variety of RDBMS or NoSQL data stores
Translate functional and technical requirements into detailed designs, as well as derive use cases where appropriate
Design, develop, construct, install, test, and maintain highly scalable, robust, and fault-tolerant data management & processing systems by integrating a variety of programming languages & tools together
Work with stakeholders including the business area sponsors, product owners, data architect, data engineers, project managers and business analysts to support their data needs and help capture business requirements
Ensure effective design and development of system architectures through frequent product deliveries; employ effective governance methods for transparency and communication.
Translate functional and technical requirements into detail design

 Apart from technologies, this role requires continuous collaboration; not just among the team but also outward with expert business analysts, technologists, project managers, data scientists and statisticians – and sometime counterparts in other international organizations and central banks.
 
 This is a great chance to work in a highly collaborative environment, not just among the team but with expert economists, technologists, data scientists and statisticians – and counterparts in other international organisations and central banks.
 
 In order to be considered for this role, you are a mid level/intermediate Data Engineer able to build data pipelines and to run data modelling in building strategic platforms with a great sense of independency and proactivity in data engineering technology.
 
 You will possess the as many of the following skills and experience:
 


Ca 5+ year of work experience as a Data Engineer/BI Developer 
Experience working with RDBMS, designing physical models, authoring SQL queries and procedural extensions, and carrying out performance tuning 
Knowledge on Data warehousing/Data Mart and Data Lake architectures, with experience in building associated data ingestion pipelines. 
Strong, in-depth experience in data modelling and experience with business intelligence systems (dimensional modelling, data vault, data mining, predictive analytics etc)
Working knowledge of Apache NiFi and experience developing SQL-based data pipelines, ideally using dbt
Fluency in English

 The following skills are nice to have but not mandatory:
 


Hands-on development using open-source big data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive and Impala
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: dbt, Python, Jinja, Java, Scala, etc.
Knowledge of Service-oriented architecture and experience in API creation and management technologies (REST, SOAP etc)
Experience in workflow management and automation tools such as Airflow or RunDeck 
Knowledge of various ETL / ELT techniques and frameworks
Knowledge of Service-oriented architecture and experience in API creation and management technologies (REST, SOAP etc)
Experience in Automated Testing, Test-driven Development, debugging, troubleshooting, and optimizing code: senior level experience and knowledge

 Interviews would be conducted remotely, however the role is based 100% in Switzerland. Our client offers:
 


The opportunity to work in a diverse and international environment on a long-term basis with an attractive hourly rate
50% working from home
20 days working remotely from abroad per year

 Are you interested to work in an international environment in one of the leading financial companies in Switzerland on a long term basis? Then apply now! We look forward to receiving your full application.

Overview:
 

 Monte Rosa Therapeutics (MRT) seeks an experienced, highly skilled, and creative computational chemist and drug designer to lead MRT’s CADD team. You will connect chemistry to biology to rationally design a new class of novel molecular glue degraders (MGDs). The successful candidate will be involved in all aspects of chemistry research activities, interface with team members on the development of unique chemical matter to solve novel biological problems and contribute to the development of our growing program portfolio. You will work tightly with chemistry, biology, data sciences and machine learning, and biomolecular teams to develop, validate and optimize novel chemical matter to treat patients. In this position, you will make significant contributions at the forefront of drug discovery. Monte Rosa is based in Basel and Boston.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Lead and mentor MRT’s Computational Chemistry team
 Continue the build-out of computational chemistry capabilities
 Design and optimize MGDs by integrating protein modeling, molecular docking, ligand-based design, library design, diversity analysis and conformational analysis.
 Tight interactions with chemists, structural biologists, data scientists and biologists to drive drug discovery programs at all stages from early target validation, hit-finding, lead optimization, to candidate delivery.
 Leverage results from MRT’s biomolecular platforms, including HTS and crystallography, to determine structure-function relationships, model pharmacophores and design MGDs.
 Apply MRT’s cutting-edge in silico Rhapsody™ platform, a fast, AI-based, cloud optimized suite of CADD tolls, to design MGDs, computationally screen ternary complexes, and optimize MGDs from hit discovery to LO to DC selection.
 Qualifications: 
 
Demonstrated modelling impact on drug design, including experience in ADMET predictions and multiparameter optimization, ligand and structure-based design, conformational analysis, and pharmacophore development.
 Deep understanding of modern drug discovery including medicinal chemistry, DMPK principles and multi-parameter optimization.
 Team leadership experience and proven track record of mentoring scientists
 Experience of working in multi-disciplinary teams in drug discovery environment
 Excellent communication skills and the ability to forge productive relationships and collaborations both internally and externally.
 Experience using CADD/cheminformatics/ML tools to identify patterns and determine structure-function relationships, including knowledge of relevant databases and tools.
 Experience in targeted protein degradation is a plus.
 PhD in computational chemistry or related field, at least 12 years of experience in a pharma or biotech environment and a proven track record of impact and innovation as measured by patent inventorship and publications.

Citizen Science Center Zurich
IT Systems Administrator (Student Assistant) 20-30 % The Competence Center Citizen Science is a jointly established center of the University of Zurich and the ETH Zurich. The Center supports the implementation and running of Citizen Science projects at these two institutions and operates a Citizen Science platform. We are looking for a enthusastic and communicative
  

IT Systems Administrator (Student, 20-30%)

 to enhance our team (
  initially for 1 year, with possible extension). The platform was developed in close cooperation with front-end and back-end developers and a community of contributing partners, as well as with S'IT, a unit of the University of Zurich specialized in the use of IT for reasearch. 
 

Your responsibilities We are seeking an IT specialist with proven technical abilities and accomplishments, experience with setting up and managing Linux servers, a strong passion for science, and the willingness to “go the extra mile” to ensure the highest quality of experience for our users. The primary role will be to ensure the reliable operation of the overall platform running on cloud infrastructure. Further enhancing the platform in collaboration with the partners is an additional task. The platform's purpose is to enable rapid prototyping and execution of Citizen Science projects while maintaining the highest standards of data security and building an increasing community of citizen scientists in Zurich. All code was developed and continues to be enhanced publicly at: https://github.com/citizensciencecenter 
 

Your profile

Experience in setting up and managing Linux servers
Experience with PostgreSQL
Interest in Citizen Science and working in an academic environment
An excellent command of spoken English
Eligibility to work in Switzerland


 The following qualifications will be considered strong


Knowledge of agile development methods and CI/CD
Experience in secure web applications (using Docker and other build tools)
Experience using Python and collaborating in an open source project
Knowledge of Vue.js 



What we offer We offer a dynamic work environment with friendly colleagues in direct contact with many IT experts and interdisciplinary research groups. You will have an exciting opportunity to operate and further enhance the Citizen Science platform and be an integral part of a growing competence center, jointly established by the University of Zurich and ETH Zurich. In addition to perks (e.g. access to University's city-wide sports facilities and lunch checks) you will be compensated according to the high living standards of Zurich. 
 

Place of work Citizen Science Center Zurich
   Kurvenstrasse 17
   8006 Zürich 
 

Start of employment Employment start date to be mutually agreed (ASAP). Please send your application (motivation letter, CV, diplomas, references) by email to Rosy Mondardini, Managing Director of the Citizen Science Center Zurich

Your field of responsibility





Ensure trackable, clear, complete, comprehensible, testable and binding documentation of requirements for the software to be developed by data engineers while complying with requirements guidelines
Identify priorities and manage requirements accordingly while complying with technical, legal and design requirements
Identify and resolve conflicts between individual requirements
Engage with relevant stakeholders to capture, design, validate, verify and track progress of requirements
Coach the scrum team according to the Agile methodology and scrum practices and help it achieve higher levels of scrum maturity
Help the team make progress by ensuring each developer is working on the right tasks, assist in the removal of impediments, and protect the team from distractions
Facilitate the scrum ceremonies
Support the product owner and provide education where needed


 

Your future colleagues


 A mixed technical (Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Data Analysts) population with diverse skills and background and a strong sense of team spirit and friendly collaboration. Autonomous and competent, our team offers a good level of maturity, a collective sense of commitment and urgency, and safe environment to speak up.







 Your skills and experience



 As both scrum master and Data Analyst you will encompass full oversight of the priorities and workpieces of a team of data engineers building a solution aiming to fight money laundering.

Master’s degree in a technical field
Familiarity with Python development and SQL querying
Scrum master certification (preferred) or excellent knowledge of Scrum techniques and artifacts (e.g. definition of done, user stories, automated testing, backlog refinement, etc.)
Ability to create and maintain high-quality technical documentation and reports
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively and establish good working relationships across departments
A very professional, diligent and can-do attitude
Excellent problem-solving and organizational skills, servant leadership skills and conflict-resolution ability
Knowledge in banking industry
Dedication to fostering an inclusive culture and value diverse perspectives

CSL has an exciting opportunity available for a Senior Scientist, Computational Genomics to join our growing team. In this role, you will provide scientific and technical expertise to help the advancement of biomedical research in the pre-clinical, platform-build and product development areas of drug development using advanced bioinformatics and genomics methods.

 You will expand CSL’s R&D capability to leverage and integrate public and commercial genomic data with in-house generated data, as well as continuingly integrating novel, cutting-edge ‘omic technologies and analytics into the drug development pipeline.

 You will work closely with CSL scientists in our US, Europe and Australia research sites, across multiple function groups including Global Research Data Science, Gene Therapy Research and Product Development to set project objectives and to devise and implement data generation, data analytics and bioinformatics platform development strategies. You will also work alongside CSL’s external collaborators including spending time in their research laboratories as required to enable alignment of work.

 Reporting to the Manager of Computational Genomics and Platforms, you will:

 Contribute to our expanding capability in gene therapy related informatics and analytics
 Design and analyse omic experiments using platforms including NGS / single cell / long-read, genomic / transcriptomic / proteomic sequencing, to answer key questions around cell biology, drug mechanism-of-action, target validation and biomarker discovery
 Contribute to the interpretation and reporting of the biological insights derived from omic experiments and bioinformatics analyses in collaboration with life scientists and other subject-matter experts at CSL.
 Work with in-house and external bioinformatics software developers to develop automated and reproducible analysis workflows.


 Your Experience

 PhD in computational biology, bioinformatics, computer science, biomedical informatics, informatics engineering, molecular biology, genomics or a related discipline with emphasis in the computational and biomedical areas.
 Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in biological sciences (e.g., computational biology, bioinformatics, molecular biology, translational sciences, genetics, etc.)
 3+ years of post-doctoral experience in biomedical data analytics in a highly collaborative, interdisciplinary environment in academia and/or industry.


 Strong hands-on, Unix-system-level experience in short-read and long-read sequence analysis.
 Demonstrated experience in working with genomic variants and genetic information to answer biomedical questions.
 Demonstrated experience in single cell RNAseq, ATACseq, CITEseq analysis to understand cell biology.
 Demonstrated experience in using public databases to answer key research questions related to experimental design, biomarker discovery and patient stratification.
 Demonstrated experience in working in a Unix-like and high-performance computing (HPC) environment. Cloud computing competency is a plus.
 Demonstrated experience in developing workflows using various programming languages, e.g., Python, R, WDL, etc.

EPFL, the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne, is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs more than 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of more than 16,000 people, including over 12,000 students and 4,000 researchers from more than 120 different countries.
    
 The Swiss Data Science Center (SDSC) is a joint venture between EPFL and ETH Zurich. Its mission is to accelerate the adoption of data science and machine learning techniques within academic disciplines of the ETH Domain, the Swiss academic community at large, and the industrial sector. In particular, it addresses the gap between those who create data, those who develop data analytics and systems, and those who could potentially extract value from it. The centre is composed of a multi-disciplinary team of data and computer scientists and experts in selected domains, with offices in Zürich, Lausanne, and Villigen.

A structured work style with a fun approach to solving complex tasks. Commitment and self-responsibility to deadlines. Eagerness to learn and adapt in uncertain situations, manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

Located in nearly 40 studios and more than 60 offices around the world, it comprises a 10,000+ strong team of strategists, data scientists, product and experience designers, brand experts and technologists who develop new digital services, products, experiences, and business models for sustainable growth.

You will be responsible for:

 development in the field of sampling and sample portioning

Would you like to learn more about CTC and the opportunity outlined? Please, get in contact with us: you may either use the 'apply now' button, or write an email to us, or reach out to us on the phone.

The Biozentrum of the University of Basel is one of the leading life sciences institutes in the world. It consists of 32 groups and 500 employees that research how molecules and cells create life, spanning the scale from atom to organism. Founded in 1971, the Biozentrum has been the birth place of many fundamental discoveries in biology and medicine, spawning several Nobel Laureates.  We are seeking a highly motivated analytical Laboratory Technician to join the Proteomics Core Facility (PCF).  The PCF provides state-of-the-art proteomic techniques to support life science research at the Biozentrum. It is tightly integrated in an internationally leading scientific surrounding. The main focus of the group is the set-up of automated sample preparation workflows for proteomics samples with very low starting material and the development of new targeted and global LC-MS workflows for sensitive and precise quantitative analysis of proteins and their modifications.




Ihre Aufgaben  The primary responsibilities for this position will include the operation and maintenance of liquid handling platforms for automated sample preparation (Tecan Evolution for SP3 and TMT workflows, Agilent Bravo AssayMap for phosphorylation enrichment, Tecan A200 for solid phase extraction) as well as general lab management. Main duties will include the development and implementation of new automated preparation workflows for clinical bacteria isolates as well as for internal tissue, bodily fluid and cell samples. The position also includes the possibility to get hands-on training on our LC-MS/MS systems and data analysis tools to carry out independent proteomics analyses. 


Ihr Profil  The ideal candidate should have practical experience in preparation workflows of biological samples and in organizing a laboratory. Prior experience in LC-MS analysis (sample preparation, LC-MS workflows and data analysis) as well as operation of liquid handling platforms is not required. The successful candidate should be highly organized, detail-oriented and computer literate. The candidate should have good written and verbal communication skills, be able to work both independently and within a team and have an apprenticeship as laboratory technician (or other degree such as DUT) or higher education (e.g. Bachelor or Master) in a biology or chemistry related subject with 2+ years of experience. High proficiency in spoken and written English is required. 




Wir bieten Ihnen  The position offers a challenging opportunity to join a growing and rapidly evolving bioanalytical field and to work in a team of highly motivated scientists. The position is part of the NCCR “AntiResist” program, initially for 2 years, with the possibility of further extension after positive evaluation. We offer flexible working times and salary and benefits according to University of Basel standards. 




Bewerbung / Kontakt

 Please apply online: https://biped2.biozentrum.unibas.ch/apply/analytical-lab-technician
    The application should include a brief personal statement, explaining how your qualifications and experience make you a good candidate for this job, together with a full, up-to-date CV and addresses of 2 references.
   
 We start reviewing applications from 16 September 2022 until the position is filled. In all cases, you will be notified of the outcome of your application. Please note that only online-applications will be accepted.
   
 For further information, please contact Dr. Alexander Schmidt, Head of Proteomics Core Facility, 
   +41 61 207 2059, alex.schmidt@unibas.ch

Jobdescription 

 Caring for the world … one person at a time inspires and unites the people of Johnson & Johnson. This culture of caring is the focus of our corporate philosophy, that is anchored in the internationally applicable Credo. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. We have more than 260 operating companies in more than 60 countries employing approximately 140,000 people. 
Janssen Vaccines, one of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, is a global biopharmaceutical company dedicated to bringing meaningful innovation to global health. We do this by discovering, developing, manufacturing and marketing products that combat major threats to the health of people worldwide. The Bern site, with its approx. 600 people of over 25 nationalities, acts as a center of expertise for development and manufacturing of innovative cell based viral- and bacterial vaccines and bacterial based therapeutic products. 
The Analytical Development (AD) Department develops, transfers and validates various batch release, stability, in process and characterization test methods for our product portfolio. It performs characterization, comparability and stability studies and provides routine analytical support to the process development teams. The Associate Scientist position is located in the Process Development Analytical Services (PDAS) team within the AD Department. The focus of the position is to support the team in analytical transfer activities and assay implementation for routine testing within PDAS. The position holder will collaborate closely with AD scientists and analysts to ensure smooth transfer and timely delivery of analytical test results. 


Main Responsibilities:
 Work with viruses, cells, proteins and nucleic acids. From sample preparation to analysis and data treatment. 
Acceptance and coordination of all non-GMP samples 
Planning, coordination, and execution of analytical assays with focus on method transfer and routine testing in line with established procedures. 
Main techniques include cell culture/viral work (BSL2) and flow cytometry but can include additional analytical methods such as qPCR, ELISA, Octet, HPLC, cGE, SoloVPE and others 
Specialist of the electronic analysis order system of PDAS (eGondola) 
Close collaboration with local AD scientists and analysts and colleagues from the broader Janssen organization 
Summarize and present experimental data to the team 
Adequate handling of notebooks and logbooks, regular update of lab databases and tracking systems. 
Create and review GLP documentation (study plans, assay protocols, work instructions, equipment instructions) in close consultation with AD scientists 
Support routine laboratory activities such as maintenance of equipment and instruments, ordering of materials and material stock management 
Follow project plans including protocols, SOPs and work schedules in a self-sufficient manner 
Functie-eisen 


Who we are looking for:
 MSc degree in a life science discipline 
Work/research experience in relevant field 
Experience with cell culture/viral work and flow cytometry is major advantage 
Independent way of working and taking ownership of assigned tasks to plan and deliver according to project timelines 
Team player with a communicative personality that can easily integrate into an existing team in a multicultural environment and efficiently collaborate 
Good organizational and planning skills 
Very good communication in English, German is an advantage 
This job based in Bern, Switzerland will initially be limited to approx. 12 months. If you are interested in working with a global leading pharmaceutical company in a dynamic, progressive, and collaborative environment, then send us your application today. Or give us a call if you have any questions!

We are seeking a postdoctoral researcher to join a team of researchers studying the influence of child gut microbiota on development of metabolic-related disorders.


  Project
 

  The symbiotic microorganisms colonize all mucosal body surfaces of newborns and play a key role in shaping the development and maturation of immune system. In the intestine, the first vigorous immune response to colonizing bacteria after birth occurs at weaning. This response termed "weaning reaction" is critical for generating an immune memory that prevents the susceptibility to multiple inflammatory pathologies in adult mice (Al Nabhani et al., Immunity 2019, Nature Metabolism 2019). In the framework of ERC starting project, we are seeking to gain knowledge regarding the microbiological mechanisms that affect the induction of the weaning reaction. The project will involve cultivation of bacteria and fungi under controlled laboratory conditions, incubating with stable isotope tracers, and conducting biogeochemical and molecular biology (metagenomics, transcriptomics, metabolomics) analyses. In this role you will: analyze interactions between host and microbial symbionts (fungal and bacterial); contribute to the conception, design, and execution of research to address questions in host-microbial interactions; collaborate with other scientists and technical personnel; perform independent research and lead new projects in the area of gut microbiome research and mouse experimentation.
  
 The post-holder will be supported by a well-funded interdisciplinary research program in a young and dynamic environment at the Department for BioMedical Research (DBMR), University of Bern, and at the Department of Visceral Surgery and Medicine, Inselspital Bern, Switzerland. We work closely with groups of Prof. Andrew Macpherson and Prof. Stephanie Ganal-Vonarburg, and we are involved in joint lab meetings and journal clubs. We are now developing an international and national collaborative network in which the postdoc will be involved.
  
 We are requesting candidates to please explain work related experience around the topics below within submitted Cover Letter:
  

Experience in designing, running, and analyzing data from microbial ecology studies
Experience with bioinformatics and statistical analyses of metabolic pathways, functional gene patterns and microbial community assembly




Required Minimum Qualifications
 The candidate should have a strong interest in gut microbiota and mucosal immunology and a PhD degree by the time that they start the job.
  

Preferred Qualifications


Experience with cultivation techniques for fungal, or bacterial interactions studies
Publication record in the peer-reviewed literature reflecting intellectual leadership and scientific creativity
Demonstrated ability as an independent and innovative experimentalist
Experience analyzing 'omics datasets (metagenome, metatranscriptome, or metabolomics)


Our offers

  We provide excellent scientific opportunities in a highly motivating environment with a multidisciplinary approach to microbial ecology and mucosal immunology discussions as well as seminars with wide-range topics. The project offers a special opportunity to be trained on experimental immunology using germ-free and gnotobiotic mouse models. We offer close supervision with ample support and interesting discussions. We support also participation in international and national research conferences. We assist postdoc for an independent global scientific career through and after the project.
  

Starting date: October 2022 or on agreement
  
Duration: 2-4 years
 
Application Contact

  Please send your application before September 30th, 2022, including a short letter of interest, curriculum vitae with description of your professional experience, a list of publications, a list of 2 contact referees or their references letter as a single pdf-file by email to: 
  Prof. Ziad Al Nabhani: 
  
   ziad.alnabhani@dbmr.unibe.ch
  
 Applications will be considered on an on-going basis. A first contact is usually established through an informal Skype/Zoom interview (~15 minutes).

Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.
 As a Principal Scientist - Microbial High-Throughput Technologies within our in Microbial R&D Team in Visp you will implement automation and screening technologies and will develop automatable and cell-based screening assays to engineer microbial production strains. You will collaboratively work in an interdisciplinary team to build overarching workflows that link strain engineering, cell-based high-throughput screening and process development with automation and Data Analytics/Bioinformatics to develop our next generation microbial production hosts. You are enthusiastic about innovation, data-driven engineering, and high-throughput technologies and enjoy transferring science into tangible deliverables.
 Key responsibilities:

 Drive the implementation of high-throughput technologies (screening and automation) incl. Data Management and Data Analysis for the engineering of microbial production hosts
 Develop single cell-based reporter systems and automatable screening assays for phenotypic characterization of engineered production strains to optimize them for recombinant protein production processes
 As a SME for microbial high-throughput technologies for strain engineering and (single cell-based) high-throughput screening, you will align with other SMEs from Bioinformatics/Data Science and High-throughput Technologies and help to build efficient and standardized workflows throughout the organization
 Manage and coordinate projects, plan and execute experiments with scientific rigor, analyze/interpret and present data in internal and external meetings
 Train and assist colleagues in experimental lab work

 Key requirements:

 Ph.D. in Biotechnology, Biochemistry, (Molecular - or Systems) Biology or similar
 Strong background in development of phenotypic screening assays, and cell-based high throughput screening methods (e.g. FACS) or (automated) MTP-based screening
 Experience in Molecular Biology (CRISPR), Synthetic Biology, engineering of microbial recombinant expression systems, and recombinant protein technologies
 Knowledge of next-generation sequencing and bioinformatics workflows, automation or advanced data analysis (e.g. Machine Learning) is a plus
 Experience in cellular pathway engineering, laboratory evolution or in bioprocess development would be advantageous.
 Scientific rigor, initiative and willingness to learn. Ideally, you have an affinity for data management and data science and bioinformatics.
 Excellent communication skills in English complete your profile. German is a plus.

 Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.
 People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.
 Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world’s largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared. 
Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times, some of the world’s largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world. 
Join one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world’s most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.

 Purpose of the role

 We are looking for an enthusiastic Windows software engineer to become part of our ProtonVPN team. ProtonVPN clients support all major platforms, including Windows. We want to build a secure product that is competitive on usability, functionality, and stability, to offer our users the best VPN experience.

 What you will do

 You will be an active part of the ProtonVPN Windows team through tasks including : 

Improving and extending the ProtonVPN clients by building user interfaces, optimising network protocols, and creating Windows kernel drivers
 Taking part in the development of innovative solutions to improve the interface, usability, connectivity, stability, performance, and resilience of ProtonVPN and extend its functionality
 Collaborating in the analysis of complex challenges related to various aspects of a Windows system, related but not limited to its networking stack
 Taking part in extending existing open source projects or in creating new one
 Taking part in close collaboration with the entire ProtonVPN development team in any outstanding projects


 Expert-level knowledge of Windows
 Good knowledge of the C# and .Net ecosystem
 A documented track record of contributions to multiple Windows projects and applications
 Strong software engineering skills such as CI/CD
 Knowledge of the networking stack (especially on the Windows environment) 
Basic understanding of the principles of quality assurance


 Bonus points for

 Windows Kernel driver development
 VPN protocols such as OpenVPN, IKEv2 or WireGuard
 Windows system administration
 Code debugging and profiling
 HTTPS certificates and public key infrastructure
 Agile methodologies and frameworks
 Open source software development


 Why you should join Proton


 Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.
 Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world’s top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH.
 Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more.
 Grow with us - We’re one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields.
 Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else’s problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.
 Benefits – these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events and team building activities.


 Proton uses the Recruitee recruitment platform for a more effective hiring process and a better candidate experience. Your data will always be kept confidential and is not shared with any third parties. You will receive emails from the email address careers@protonmail.recruitee.com or other addresses on the protonmail.recruitee.com domain as part of the recruitment process.

 Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation where Proton employs the relevant candidate.

 By applying to a role at Proton, you acknowledge that we will process and store your personal data for at least the duration of the hiring process and as necessary to enter a contractual relationship with you.

EPFL, the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne, is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs more than 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of more than 16,000 people, including over 12,000 students and 4,000 researchers from more than 120 different countries.
    
 The Swiss Data Science Center (SDSC) is a joint venture between EPFL and ETH Zurich. Its mission is to accelerate the adoption of data science and machine learning techniques within academic disciplines of the ETH Domain, the Swiss academic community at large, and the industrial sector. In particular, it addresses the gap between those who create data, those who develop data analytics and systems, and those who could potentially extract value from it. The center is composed of a multi-disciplinary team of data and computer scientists, and experts in select domains with offices in Zürich, Lausanne, and Villigen. www.datascience.ch
   


Biomedical Data Engineer

Your mission :

 We are looking for a motivated and enthusiastic individual to join the Swiss Data Science Center (SDSC) in Lausanne as a Biomedical Data Engineer. You will make an impact on the healthcare industry by joining collaborative SDSC projects to develop solutions for biomedical data. 
   


Main duties and responsibilities include :

 This role sits in the Open Research Data (ORD) Engagement and Services team within the SDSC, which aims to support, encourage and inspire ORD practices across research communities in academia, industry, and beyond. You will participate in collaborative projects involving clinical and research partners to design and implement biomedical data streams. You will be responsible for bringing project data into BioMedIT and hospital systems, troubleshooting, and making it ready for downstream applications. Likewise, you will architect data models, build ETL workflows and harmonize disparate data sources according to the SPHN Interoperability Framework.
    
 Working closely with biomedical project teams, you will design and build systems for storing, processing, and analyzing clinical, molecular, and multi-omics data. In addition, you will automate and monitor data ingestion and transformation pipelines with hooks for quality controls and validation according to data management specifications. 
   


Your profile : 


 We encourage applications from a broad range of fields and experiences. You have knowledge and experience in software engineering and data science, acquired either through an M.Sc./Ph.D. in a relevant field or work experience. You enjoy building and using semantic data models, (non-)relational databases, and ETL systems. Metadata standards, controlled vocabularies, and ontologies are your friends (with bonus points for the SPHN framework and related standards such as SNOMED CT, LOINC, RDF, SPARQL). You are great at understanding infrastructure designs and eager to propose improvements. Coding in Python and workflow orchestration should be a passion of yours! You are ready to learn about and become familiar with tools and trends which will enable you to excel in your work. We also value previous experience or curiosity about best practices for information security, especially safe harbor privacy principles for sensitive data. Finally, you can communicate your ideas clearly and succinctly to a diverse audience (in English, with bonus points for French and/or German).
   


We offer : 


A stimulating, collaborative, cross-disciplinary environment in a world-class research institution;
 Flexible work arrangements, including remote working, flexible time, condensed week, and the opportunity to work part-time;
 Exciting challenges, varied projects, and plenty of room to learn and grow;
 An opportunity to follow your passion and use your skills to make an impact on research communities and society;
 A possibility to spark your creativity by experimenting and learning new technologies;

 Curious? So are we!
    We look forward to receiving your application with the following documents:
   

 Motivation letter
 CV
 Diplomas


     We only accept applications submitted through our online application portal and will not consider applications via email or postal services. If you have questions regarding this position, please email: Oksana Riba oksana.riba@datascience.ch (no applications).
   

 In line with our values, EPFL encourages an inclusive culture. We promote equality of opportunity, value diversity and nurture a working and learning environment in which the rights and dignity of all our staff and students are respected. Visit our Equal Opportunities and Diversity website to find out how we ensure a fair and open environment that allows everyone to grow and flourish. 
   


Start date : As soon as possible 

Term of employment : Fixed-term (CDD)

Work rate : 100%

Duration : 1 year, renewable 

Remark : Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered. Files sent by agencies without a mandate will not be taken into account.

Reference : Job Nb 2510

Introduction



       The University of Lausanne (UNIL) hosts 17,000 students and 5,000 collaborators, professors, and researchers. Ideally situated at the banks of Lake Geneva, near Lausanne's city center, its campus brings together more than 120 nationalities and is embedded in the larger, regional, vibrant life science research cluster.
     




 Presentation



       To complement the research activities in the group of Prof. Alexandre Reymond at the CIG (Center for Integrative Genomics) of the University of Lausanne, we are seeking to recruit a PhD student to identify new loci associated with intellectual disability.
     




 Job information



       Expected start date in position : 01.10.2022 / to be agreed 
     

      Contract length : 1 year, renewable 2 x 2 years, maximum 5 years
     

      Activity rate : 85%
     

      Workplace : University of Lausanne, Dorigny
     




 Your responsibilities



       The main responsibility consists in conducting scientific research in the framework of the Reymond's lab to disentangle the genetics of syndromic and non-syndromic intellectual disability. Towards this goal, we are combining data of consanguineous families with animal and cellular modelisation. We routinely model disease in mice and zebrafish. The last publications of the team can be found at https://www.unil.ch/cig/reymond.
     




 Your qualifications



       Highly motivated scientist and critical thinker with a Master degree in biology or related discipline. Team player. Good knowledge in English (full working proficiency). Willingness and interest in developing a PhD thesis in the broader field of metabolism.
     




 What the position offers you



       We offer a nice working place in a multicultural, diverse and dynamic academic environment. Opportunities for professional training, a lot of activities and other benefits to discover.
     

      The Reymond's lab is hosted at the Center for Integrative Genomics (CIG) at the University of Lausanne (UNIL), a vibrant, well-funded institute with a focus on functional genomics and equipped with modern core facilities (see www.unil.ch/cig). It is embedded in the broader Lausanne research environment that includes two universities (UNIL, EPFL), the Swiss Institute of Bioinformatics, Ludwig Center for Cancer Research, university hospital, and a cluster of biotech companies flourishing in the larger lake Geneva area. We offer a nice working place in a multicultural, diversified and dynamic academic environment.
     

      The PhD student will be enrolled in the Faculty of Biology and Medicine's doctoral school.
     




 Contact for further information



       Prof. Alexandre Reymond
     

      alexandre.reymond@unil.ch
     




 Your application



       Deadline : 02.09.2022
     

      To apply, please submit a motivation letter describing why you are interested in joining our group, a CV (with copy of your Master grade), and contact details for 2 or more referees.
     

      Only applications through this website will be taken into account. We thank you for your understanding.
     




 Additional information



 UNIL is committed to equal opportunities and diversity.

www.unil.ch/egalite


UNIL supports early career researchers.

job_title: Computer Scientist for AI in Medical Imaging
job_summary:
Computer Scientist for AI in Medical Imaging

The Artificial Intelligence in Medical Imaging (AIMI) lab at the University of Bern's ARTORG Center for Biomedical Engineering Research invites applications from data scientists and software engineers with a strong background in data science and programming to work on innovative tools in the domain for healthcare.
We are looking for enthusiastic candidates with excellent technical skills to join our research group. We require outstanding in-depth technical skills in programming. Candidates are expected to have the following experience:



BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
 Experience in python and related libraries (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn). Knowledge of pytorch is considered a plus;
 Experience in building web interfaces. Our tech stack is based on Django, PostgreSQL and React JS, but experience on other technologies is welcome;
 Experience in data science methods (i.e., machine learning, deep learning);
 Experience with Linux System Administration and Docker;
 Interest in learning/applying new machine learning or deep learning methods;
 Good English language skills.




   The appointee will pursue the design and development of disruptive delivery solutions for machine learning methods in the medical domain. No previous experience in healthcare is necessary - only a desire to learn and innovate in this area. For this purpose, the appointee will have access to a significant database of medical images from our clinical partners. A secondary responsibility of the appointee will be to support other team members with dataset curation for their specific projects and to maintain these.
   
 The AIMI lab offers a creative and international environment to conduct competitive research in an interdisciplinary team. Strongly linked to the Bern University Hospital (Inselspital) and part of the new Center for AI in Medicine, the AIMI lab strives to provide a coherent and holistic view of how AI in healthcare can benefit patients, by designing and developing fundamental and translation research.
  

   More about the positions
  

   The positions are funded for a 1-year period at first with the possibility to extend to 4 years thereafter. The start date is expected to be in the October-November 2022 period (flexible start dates possible).
   
 Strong communication skills in English are required, as it is the working language of the ARTORG center. German courses are available for those wishing to learn. There are no associated teaching duties, but opportunities are possible for those interested.
  

   Application
  

   Applications will be accepted until the positions are filled.
   
 Applications should be emailed to Davide Scandella (davide.scandella@unibe.ch) with the subject “[OPSE-04] Computer Scientist for AI”. Contained must be a cover letter and a CV.
  

About the University of Bern

 The University of Bern is located at the heart of Switzerland. Internationally connected and regionally anchored, the University of Bern cultivates exchange with society and strengthens partnerships between science, medicine business, and politics. The University of Bern is committed to a deliberate and ethical responsibility towards people, animate and inanimate nature. It strives as an important educator, promoting enterprise and industry in the region and beyond, and distinguishes itself through problem-oriented research into questions of pressing social relevance.
   
 The University of Bern is an equal opportunity employer and strives to increase the number of women at all levels in its faculties.
   

 www.unibe.ch

job_title: Data Scientist II, Headcount Allocation Analytics
job_summary:
Data Scientist II, Headcount Allocation Analytics

 Do you want to make a difference in a global Technology & Travel company? Join us at Expedia Group in highly dynamic industry and use your Analytical expertise to help steer the strategic decision making of where and how to optimally allocate our sales team accounting for both market dynamics and business constraints.
 The Data Scientist II of Headcount Allocation will be part of a larger team of 4 people reporting to the Senior Manager of Core Operations Analytics. This person will be responsible to build mathematical models to solve Constraint Optimization problems in the field of Headcount optimization. The types of business problems this person will have to answer include questions such as “How many headcounts do I need and where in order to maximize my Return on Investment (RoI)?” / “Assuming that I only have X headcounts to allocate, what would be the optimal location/role for them to be?” / “Given the known market dynamics, what degree of flexibility does each model option allows?”. While solving for those optimization problems, the data scientist will account for all relevant constraint (e.g., productivity, geographical limitations).
 The successful candidate will be responsible for most of the headcount allocation problematic, including problem definition, problem solving, machine-learning/algorithm building, stakeholder management. In complement of developing the optimization model/engine, the candidate will also be responsible to build the dynamic tool allowing stakeholder to easily monitor current/recommended headcount allocation and observed impact on relevant leading indicators. If you are self-driven and have demonstrated success in using analytics to drive innovation and continuous improvement, then this position is for you!

 What you’ll do:

 Manage stakeholders with frequent communication and expectation management
 Frame business challenges as analytical problem and apply problem solving techniques to break it down into concrete set of analytical tasks
 Extract data from multiple data sources and combine them into the required datasets for model building or analytics
 Assess and evaluate various methods to solve for Constraint Optimization business problem
 Apply your knowledge with Python, Scala or R, or any other major ML programming language
 Become knowledgeable in EG visualization tools, creating complex calculations using advanced features and building complex charts with limited supervision
 Articulate clearly and confidently decision-making rationale, methodology and recommendation to both technical and non-technical partners across various levels of the organization
 Be accountable to design/build the Headcount Allocation recommendation model and develop the visualization to enable leadership to monitor current situation and gap to optimal output
 Partner closely with your peers within the Core Operations Analytics team and the broader Lodging Analytics organization to ensure best practice sharing and build on each other work

 Who you are: 

Bachelor's, Master's, PhD, or Equivalent Experience; Mathematics, Science, Statistics or Technical degree preferred otherwise relevant experience is applicable
 2+ year of relevant experience in Analytics team working with large amount of data – ideally with experience in developing constraint optimization models
 Display strong domain knowledge, business acumen and critical reasoning skills
 Bias for action and ability to function independently with minimal direction
 Applied knowledge of SQL and familiar with Python, R, or any other major ML programming language
 Excellent data visualization skills and exposure to tools like Tableau/Power BI/…
 Experienced in the fundamentals of big data architecture (streaming events, data lakes, analytics engines) and relational database models.


 Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or age.
