Willst du Cloud-Technologien kennenlernen und anwenden, um ML-Modelle in Businessprozesse zu integrieren? Das junge und dynamische Team "Digital Analytics & AI" ist in der Coop Informatik angesiedelt und bearbeitet als zentrales Kompetenzzentrum für Analytics und AI Fragestellungen für die verschiedenen Abteilungen der Coop Gruppe. In dieser Einstiegsposition als Machine Learning Engineer (w/m) wirst du Teil unseres neuen ML-Engineering und DevOps Teams und arbeitest vom ersten Tag an aktiv an der Umsetzung und Automatisierung verschiedener Projekte. Dazu verwendest du bekannte Machine Learning Pakete (z.B. Tensorflow, xgBoost oder NLP-Sprachmodelle) und modernste Technologien auf der Cloud wie Kubernetes, Airflow oder Docker. Die Tätigkeitsschwerpunkte stellen ein ausgewogenes Verhältnis zwischen Teamwork und Einzelarbeit da. Zur Unterstützung stehen dir unsere erfahrenen Data Scientists/ML-Engineers zur Seite. Wir wenden uns an eine jüngere Person, die kürzlich das Studium abgeschlossen hat und ggf. über erste Berufserfahrung verfügt.
 Anne Marchon, HR Marketing
 Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung.

job_title: Digitalization Scientist for Application in Spectroscopy
job_summary:
"Modis. We believe that the future belongs to those who drive innovation, who shape change and who network through collaboration."

 Your tasks
 You implement the digital strategy of the laboratory with technical execution and scientific conception. The activity implies two main work packages:
 (i) implementation of a data management plan (DMP) following the FAIR principles of open science;
 (ii) implementation of data analytics and dashboards for real-time visualization and chemometric classification of primary data.

 The former is based on the OpenBIS platform; the latter is based on your original contribution in interaction with the laboratory scientists. You will also participate in scientific projects of the laboratory, centered on chemical database generation. Examples are "digital reference materials" (within a EU collaboration) and "materials genomics" (with a Swiss collaboration). You report to the head of laboratory and contribute actively in the evolution of the digital strategy.

 Your profile
 You have a MSc in data science or equivalent degree, with hands-on experience in digital transformation. You have experience in networks, cloud computing, API interfaces, digitalization of chemical lab workflow, coding and implementation of LIMS/ELN platforms and data warehouse. You are familiar with Linux, LabView and Python. Knowledge of Jupyter, OpenBIS and Zenodo are a plus

 We are looking forward to receiving your application.

job_title: Senior Clinical Scientist Neuchatel, Switzerland Life Scienc...
job_summary:
Senior Clinical Scientist – Neuchatel, Switzerland 
 
 Be a part of a revolutionary change.
 
 At PMI, we’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business, and building our future on smoke-free products. We’re also exploring new categories, looking beyond nicotine to develop a new portfolio of innovative products.
 
 With huge change, comes huge opportunity. So, wherever you join us, you’ll enjoy the freedom to dream up and deliver better, brighter solutions and the space to move your career forward in endlessly different directions.
 
 It’s so rare in R&D that everything aligns to create the ideal conditions for outstanding work. Right now, at PMI, that’s exactly what’s happening. R&D is the driving force for our bold new vision: to replace cigarettes with a revolutionary portfolio of alternative products.
 
 Join us and you’ll have the resources, support and technology you need to break new ground and see ideas come to life. You’ll be surrounded by some of the brightest scientists in their fields, with fast access to subject experts and commercial decision-makers.
 
 If you’re creative, courageous and ready to take risks, you can make a huge impact and propel your career in an endless number of directions. Ultimately, by delivering our smoke-free and beyond nicotine future.
 
 This opening is for talent pipelining. If you recognize yourself in the description below and you are curious to better understand our vision, do not hesitate to apply. We will contact you if you are meeting the criteria.
 
 Your ‘day to day’
 
 As a Senior Clinical Scientist you will act as the scientific leader for clinical studies and projects according to study planning, within the Clinical Science & Epidemiology (CSE) department, being also responsible to develop and review documents in line with ICH/GCP, provide scientific/clinical input and expertise to the team and support the clinical operations. We are conducting GCP clinical studies and now also focusing on consumers’ needs and interests; you will design “out-of-the-box” studies / work on research to support consumer’s claims.
 
 More specifically, you'll
 


Lead the development of clinical study documents (protocol and amendments, summaries, fact sheets and reports) including drafting and review process until approval. Provide input to study documents with scientific content: Inform Consent Form, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Case Report Form, laboratory and analytical documentations. Review study data in line with Data Review Plan and clinical results: tables, figures, listings (TFLs) according to the SAP.
Ensure that the study documentation is developed following ICH-GCP, with respect to subject assessment of eligibility, enrollment, clinical safety (adverse events, serious adverse events), data consistency, as well as the quality management system (QMS) applicable to the PMI R&D environment.
Participate to clinical operations activities requiring scientific input (internal and external meetings, investigator meetings, discussions with CRO/vendors/third parties). Contribute to the clinical assessment team activities (assessment plans, presentations, publications and literature searches), interact with other functions, external partners and 3rd parties. Collaborate with the clinical study, regulatory, quality and safety teams for the resolution of issues and crises.
Raise relevant information, ensure feedback is sought and a solution is achieved with no delay. Collaborate to write, review and update of SOPs/WKIs related to assessment activities. Work on the registration and publication of clinical studies/results on ClinicalTrials.gov and prepare the publication of results in peer-reviewed journals.

 Who we’re looking for
 


MD, PharmD or PhD (preferred) or equivalent skills through demonstrated experience.
Substantial experience in clinical research (academic, pharmaceuticals, medical devices, CRO), in planning, execution and reporting of studies. Thorough knowledge of clinical research, ICH/GCP, trial documents, design and regulatory processes.
Experience in consumer’s research and claims in fields such as, for example, wellbeing or cosmetics, would be a great added value.
Good understanding of statistics. Proficient in performing literature review and familiar with document storage/systems, working according to a QMS.
Proficient in MS Word, PowerPoint and Excel
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.

 What we offer 
 
 Our success depends on the people who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join PMI and you too can:
 


Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.
Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
Take pride in delivering our promise to society: a smoke-free future.


 # LIJobs

Unternehmensbeschreibung
  Wir sind bereit Neues zu wagen. Bist du es auch?
 Syntegon Technology ist ein weltweit führender Anbieter von Prozess- und Verpackungstechnik. Rund 6.000 Kolleginnen und Kollegen in mehr als 15 Ländern arbeiten für die Syntegon-Gruppe an intelligenten und nachhaltigen Technologien für die Pharma- und Nahrungsmittelindustrie.
 Die Syntegon Technology Services AG in Beringen (SH) ist ein Unternehmen der Syntegon-Gruppe und ein zentraler Baustein unserer globalen Service-Organisation. Mit rund 100 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern stellen wir unseren Kunden ein umfassendes Serviceportfolio zur Verfügung, welches vom Support vor Ort bis zum Online-Service reicht und sorgen für den erfolgreichen Ausbau unseres Service-Geschäfts.
 Gehe den ersten Schritt! Bewirb dich jetzt!



 Stellenbeschreibung
  Im Bereich Digital Solutions entwickelt Syntegon mit einem Team aus Software Entwicklern, Data Scientists und Solution Architects hochmoderne digitale Lösungen zur Verbesserung des Serviceangebots. Digitalisiere mit uns die Verpackungsindustrie und trage damit wesentlichen zum Erfolg von Syntegon bei.

 Du arbeitest an verschiedenen Entwicklungsprojekten im Bereich Sensorik mit und übernimmst die Funktion als Teilprojektleitung.
 Für unser gesamtes Maschinenportfolio im Food und Pharma Bereich identifizierst du für verschiedene Use Cases die richtige Sensorik inkl. der dazugehörigen Komponenten (Bsp. Stromversorgung, Übertragungsart, Gehäuse).
 Du stellst eine zuverlässige und effiziente Datenanbindung von lloT Sensoren über drahtgebundene oder drahtlose Technologien (Bsp. 10-Link/WiFi/BLE/LoRa) auf unsere lloT Edge Gateways sicher.
 Du erstellst Test-Szenarien und führst diese selbstständig im Labor und an unseren Verpackungsanlagen durch.
 Du unterstützt bei Produkteinführungen und dem Life-Cycle-Management durch Definition und Anbindung der Sensoren und Übergabe an das Projektmanagement.




 Qualifikationen
 

 Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Informatik oder einer ähnlichen Disziplin.
 Du konntest bereits erste Erfahrungen in der lloT Sensorik im industriellen Umfeld, sowie in der Verwendung verschiedener Netzwerkprotokolle und dem Verbindungsaufbau zu Maschinen, Sensoren und lloT sammeln.
 Die Analyse von Netzwerklogs liefert dir aufschlussreiche Informationen über Datenflüsse/Verluste.
 Du findest dich in Linux-basierten lloT Edge Gateways zurecht und hast Kenntnisse in analoger und digitaler Messtechnik, den Kommunikationsschnittstellen und Übertragungsarten.
 Dich zeichnen eine hohe Eigeninitiative sowie eine zielorientierte, fokussierte und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise aus.
 Sichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift runden dein Profil ab.

 Zusätzliche Informationen
  Start: per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung Pensum: 100% Unbefristete Anstellung
 Benefits

 Profitiere von unseren attraktiven Mitarbeiterangeboten in diversen Bereichen durch Corporate Benefits – lass Dich von einem bunten Angebot überraschen.
 Freu dich auf eine erstklassige Verpflegung in unserem Restaurant mit vielfältiger Auswahl und gesunden Ernährungsangeboten - bei uns ist für jeden Geschmack etwas dabei.
 Nutze unsere kostenfreien Parkmöglichkeiten sowie Ladestationen für Elektroautos oder eine gute Verkehrsanbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr - damit du entspannt in den Tag startest.

 Kontakt Julia Wachter Tel: +41 58 674-6031

 Bei Syntegon am Standort Beringen sind wir über alle Hierarchiestufen hinweg per Du. Aus diesem Grund führen wir auch den Rekrutierungsprozess in der DU Form. Gerne kannst Du uns in deinen Bewerbungsunterlagen mit unseren Vornamen ansprechen.
 Syntegon ist ein globaler Arbeitgeber dem die Vielfalt im Unternehmen ein wichtiges Anliegen ist. Wir begrüßen ausdrücklich ein Umfeld, in dem alle Mitarbeitenden ungeachtet des Geschlechts, Alters, der Herkunft, der Religion, Behinderungen, sexueller Orientierung und geschlechtlicher Identität gleichwertig sind. Sofern in dieser Stellenanzeige ausschließlich die männliche Form verwendet wird, dient dies einer besseren Lesbarkeit und bezieht sich auf Personen jeglichen Geschlechts.

Digital solutions are changing almost all areas of life of people around the world. In the mimacom team, we show our customers the way into the digital age and increase their performance through our individual and high-quality software solutions. 

 mimacom is an international team of 350 “innovation geeks” with a passion for the most innovative open source technologies. Do you share this passion, are you eager for knowledge, do you have an agile mindset and a hands-on mentality? Then you should become a member of our global mimacom family and actively shape the digital future with us! 

 As a Data Engineer, you lay the foundation for Data Scientist, Analyst and AI/ML professionals to do their job. You use your skills to create software solutions around data. 


Locations:


Bern, Switzerland
Lausanne, Switzerland
Zürich, Switzerland
 Tasks 

 As a Data Engineer, you'll help our customers along their journey to create modern data platforms. You will leverage your expertise in all project's development phases using wide range of data related technologies. This is what it looks like: 



Data pipelines: You architect, design and implement stages of complete data pipelines (ingestion, transformation, storage, computation) leveraging modern data stack focusing on data streaming and (near-)real time processing and cloud solutions
Strong & Reliable Partner: You provide expert consultation for our customers
Teamwork: You are self-organized, committed and work in cross-functional agile teams
 Requirements 

 Do you keep the pace with the ever-expanding data engineering technology ecosystem? Do you have critical and analytical thinking skills? Do you enjoy working in agile teams and yet you could work independently and assume responsibility? Cool, then you still need on the technical side: 



Proficiency in developing distributed data pipelines using public cloud services (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)
Proficiency in data streaming solutions (e.g., Apache Kafka, Spark Streaming, ...)
Deep knowledge and understanding of Event Driven Architectures, Event Streaming and Event Sourcing
Thorough knowledge of RDBMS & NoSQL concepts (SQL, Document Stores, Column Stores, ...)
Experience in software engineering (development of projects based on the microservices architecture using Java or JVM languages and frameworks like Spring is preferred)
Bonus: You have some of these additional skills or knowledge:
Experience with Elastic
Experience with Cloud technologies and DevOps
Python programming skills
Experience with Data Governance and Visualization solutions
Fluent in English and either German or French
 Benefits 

 Home office, flexible and self-organized working, snacks & coffee in the office and "choose your own device" policy are an absolute given - but there's more: 



Modern Stack (Spring, Elastic, Kafka, Cloud Foundry, AWS, Azure, Kubernetes, Docker etc.) & Partnerships with open-source major players (Elastic, Confluent, Pivotal, Flowable)
Company culture: Direct communication, quality focus and the freedom to give impetus as well as cool team events (lunch & learn, hackathons, "mimacomBeer", cross-fit, team building etc.)
Impact: make a difference by driving forward the digitalization of our renowned clients
Growth & Training: Trainings, conferences, innovation projects, certifications & more!

 Expedia Group is revolutionising travel through the Power of Technology!

 The Pricing team combines strategy, operations, and analytics specialists to help craft the way Expedia Group offers competitive and differentiated promotions on conventional lodging, vacation rentals, transport, and package products across each of its retail brands.
 The team is looking for a data-driven fast-learner with an eye for detail to join the Pricing Analytics team as a Data Scientist II.

 In this role, you will apply advanced analytics techniques, statistical knowledge, and big data handling skills to unlock significant business opportunities via analytical deep-dives and hypothesis of optimization. You will collaborate with a wide analytics community across Expedia Group's teams to make recommendations on promotions and pricing, based on outstanding insight into the profitability and customer impact of these programs.

 Do you want to make a difference in a global Technology & Travel company? If so, we are looking forward to hearing from you!

 What you'll do


Apply advanced analytics techniques, statistical knowledge, and big data handling skills to unlock significant business opportunities via analytical deep-dives and hypothesis of optimization
Build specific performance reporting within central performance hub, tracking performance moves as well as test results
Report on pricing performance and tests results in Pricing Working Group or any other relevant forums
Provide technical mentorship to other Advanced Data Insights Analysts.
Collaborate with technology and business leaders as appropriate to sustain momentum of delivery


 Who you are:

 Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD in Mathematics, Science, Economics or related field; or equivalent related professional experience
 2+ years experience in a similar analytical role
 Display a true passion for data and analytics as well as possessing a strong commercial awareness
 Strong SQL skills; demonstrated experience of using Python (or similar) to structure, transform and visualize big data, and a passion for learning new frameworks and languages required for the task
 A multifaceted individual who consistently, and inventively, applies - and often enhances - analytical concepts and playbooks to tackle business problems and unlock opportunities
 Experience in partnering with business areas and collaborating with other teams (Commercial, Operations or Data science) is desirable

At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.

 Functional Area Description
 The Clinical Scientist function provides scientific expertise necessary to design and deliver clinical studies and programs.

 Position Summary / Objective

 Will be responsible for design and execution of assigned clinical trial activities and work closely with clinical team members within the assigned project to execute activities associated with the conduct
 May serve as Clinical Trial Lead for one or more trials
 May lead or support trial level activities for one or more trials with the necessary supervision
 May co-lead study team meetings in partnership with GDO protocol manager and collaborate with cross-functional study team members


 Position Responsibilities

 Collaborate and liaise with external partners (e.g., KOLs)
 Seek out and enact best practices with instruction
 Provide regular and timely updates to manager/management as requested
 Develop Protocol and ICF documents / amendments and present these to governance committee and development team meetings as required
 Conduct literature review
 Submit clinical documents to TMF
 Develop site and CRA training materials and present these at SIVs and Investigator meetings
 Review clinical narratives
 Monitor clinical data for specific trends
 Develop Data Review Plan in collaboration with Data Management
 Ensure CRF design adequately supports data collection in alignment with the protocol in collaboration with Data Management/Programming
 Submit clinical contributions to clinical study reports (CSRs) and clinical portions of Regulatory Documents (e.g., IB, DSUR, PSUR, Orphan Annual Reports, HA, EC, IRB responses and contribute to regulatory submission.)


 Degree Requirements

 Degree in Life Sciences (MD, PhD, Pharm D, MS, RN or other scientific field preferred). Appropriate for new entrance to pharma (post fellowship/ new to industry)


 Experience Requirements

 Basic knowledge of GCP/ICH, drug development process, study design, statistics, clinical operations
 Ability to understand assigned protocol(s) and their requirements
 Basic knowledge skills to support program-specific data review and trend identification
 Intermediate medical writing skills and medical terminology
 Basic planning/project management skills (develop short range plans that are realistic and effective)


 Key Competency Requirements

 Detail-oriented with commitment to quality
 Basic knowledge of disease area, compound, current clinical landscape
 Basic knowledge of the establishment and operation of data monitoring committees, dose review teams, and independent response adjudication committees
 Intermediate critical thinking and problem-solving skills
 Adaptable / flexible (willing and able to adjust to multiple demands and shifting priorities; ability to meet day-to-day challenges with confidence and professionalism)
 Intermediate skills in Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint and data review tools (e.g., Pt Profiles, report generating tools)


 Travel Required
 Domestic and International travel may be required.

 Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases.  Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

job_title: Post-doctoral Fellow in induced resistance towards plant dis...
job_summary:
Syngenta is a leading agriculture company helping to improve global food security by enabling millions of farmers to make better use of available resources. Through world class science and innovative crop solutions, our 28,000 people in over 90 countries are working to transform how crops are grown. We are committed to rescuing land from degradation, enhancing biodiversity and revitalizing rural communities. Through leading innovations, we help farmers around the world meet the challenge of feeding a growing population and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. We invite you to help us shape the future of agriculture. At Syngenta, we believe every employee has a role to play in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet.
The Research Institute of Organic Agriculture FiBL was founded in 1973 and is situated in Frick (canton of Aargau). It is one of the world’s leading research and information centers for organic agriculture and employs 300 people in Switzerland. The close links between different fields of research and the rapid transfer of knowledge from research to advisory work and agricultural practice are FiBL’s strengths. The competence of FiBL Switzerland is also sought after beyond the Swiss borders. Thus, FiBL is involved in numerous international projects – not only in research, consultancy and training but also in development cooperation. FiBL has a modern research infrastructure and close links with organic farms.
Post-doctoral Fellow in induced resistance towards plant diseases (m/f/d)
We offer a post-doctoral researcher position to work on a collaborative project between FiBL and Syngenta on the induction of plant defenses to control plant pathogens. The position is limited to three years and is primarily located at the Syngenta Global research site in Stein (Switzerland) within the Disease Control Research Biology group. A significant amount of time might also be spent at the research facilities of FiBL in Frick.
Role Purpose:
With your proven track record and sound scientific knowledge in plant pathology and agronomy, you will contribute to strengthening Syngenta’s and FIBL’s activities in the field of induced resistance. You will explore and assess diverse methods and tools to efficiently apply induced resistance (in vitro and in planta). Thanks to your excellent interpersonal and communication skills you will collaborate and share the advancement in the field of induced resistance with internal and external stakeholders.
Accountabilities:

Assess pathology information and knowledge for induced resistance from agronomic to biochemical/molecular level, especially for the host/pathogen systems sugar beet/Cercospora beticola, tomato/different diseases and/or wheat/Septoria
Drive the development of new screening methodologies for the discovery of inducers of resistance to be used as crop protection products, covering both biological and chemical solutions
Actively perform and coordinate screening activities based on these testing methods at the laboratory and greenhouse scale
Conducting proof of concept field experiments with identified candidate substances
Analyse and interpret experimental data, present conclusions in detailed reports and presentations
Enable the research team to be linked to relevant agronomic questions in relation to induced resistance to control plant diseases on a global level
Act as a contact point for this topic within internal Syngenta functions, FiBL and external global collaborations (CROs, academics)
Be an active member of the scientific community by effectively networking e.g., with the relevant scientists, research institutes, universities, and scientific societies
Contribute to Syngenta’s and FiBL’s scientific impact through publications in peer-reviewed journals and presentations at international scientific meetings



Requirements:

A PhD in Plant Pathology or Agronomy, with knowledge about induced resistance
Good level of practical experience in agronomic and pathologic aspects of plant disease and/or general plant-pathogen interactions
Proven expertise in setting microbial assays in vitro and in planta, ideally with a focus on induced resistance
Experience in molecular biology desired
Able to work in a self-sufficient manner with strong problem-solving skills
Curious and willing to develop new capabilities and skills
Planning skills and organized working style, able to communicate scientific results to different stakeholders
Fluent in English, written and spoken (B2-C1 level), German is a plus

What we offer:

   We offer a variety of financial and non-financial benefits including:
   


We offer a position that contributes to valuable and impactful work in a stimulating and international environment
Connection to two World-leading organizations: Syngenta (Crop protection) and FiBL (organic agriculture)
A superb working environment, primarily at the Syngenta Global Research Center in Stein plus activities at FiBL in Frick, with well-equipped laboratories with an open culture and diverse workforce
The opportunity to work with and learn from highly qualified and experienced employees and gain scientific and technical excellence
Learning culture (Together we Grow) and wide range of training options
You will profit from a competitive pension fund plan, attractive bonus system, onsite doctor, fitness room, canteen, and other benefits (Family friendly initiatives, Child and Family allowance…)


Interested? We look forward to receiving your online application including all relevant documents (cover letter, CV, diploma, certificates) – reference number 18043574.
Please be aware that the job title may differ from the position title.
Learn more about our team and our mission.
Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status

About the RoleAre you a Java Software Developer who would like to shape scientific software products for researching the next generation of medicines, and who is curious about how scientific data is generated, analyzed, and used for decision making?As part of our team, you will create scientific enterprise software systems that help pharma companies develop drugs against the next wave of diseases. Our products constantly evolve with the science they serve and with the capabilities of modern software technologies.
You will help our customers by developing new product features to support their latest advances in experimentation, and accelerate research processes by introducing scalable software architectures and AI methods.
Your Responsibilities

Develop new functionality according to product backlog
Create solutions that work, test our software, teach new users by writing readable documentation
Take your fellow developers to the next level by creating development tools, rejoice when you finally make complex code understandable
Work on professional service projects and give power to our customers by designing public APIs
Explore new software technologies

Skills & Experience

BSc, MSc, Ph.D., or comparable on-the-job training in computer science or bioinformatics
At least three years of professional experience in product development (full cycle)
Expert knowledge in Java
Proven experience in modern front-end technologies such as Angular or React
Experience with building tools such as Gradle, Gulp, or NodeJS/NPM

What We OfferGenedata is on a mission to accelerate the pace of biopharma R&D. Our enterprise software solutions digitalize and automate lab operations so scientists can discover insights faster, push scientific boundaries farther, and drive change right now. With over two decades of success due to closely-knit teams of scientists, software engineers, and business experts, Genedata has become the market-leading provider of enterprise software solutions for biopharma R&D.As a private and majority employee-owned organization, we empower each employee to be a contributing voice in the company operations and evolution. Our collective expertise in scientific R&D informatics, combined with our open and scalable software platform, makes us the essential technology for the operations of top biopharma companies and innovative biotechs worldwide.We are headquartered in Basel, Switzerland and have subsidiaries in the US, Germany, UK, Japan, and Singapore.Genedata offers an attractive Total Reward Package comprised of a competitive salary and attractive benefits in return for your contribution to our success.As an equal opportunity employer, Genedata proudly celebrates diversity and believes in an inclusive workplace.
Next StepsGenedata does not accept applications from recruitment agencies.If you are interested in this position, please apply
Job Type: Full-time

The Multiplayer Group (MPG) are 300 developers and data scientists, helping our clients and partners build 20+ AAA projects at any one time. We’re probably the most experienced multiplayer dev group in the world and we’re set up to help the games industry make games more easily, to deliver the highest quality, and become long-term partners.
  


 We hire the best people, our talented team is spread across the globe. We’re remote-friendly and big on wellbeing, so if you love the sound of us, we’d love to hear from you!
  



What you'll be doing?


 Architect, design and implement functionality for AAA external clients
 Plan and execute delivery of projects within their unit/client base
 Support the CTO as required on technical discussions with prospective clients
 Willingness to dive in to a number of areas including but not limited to gameplay, AI, UI, Multiplayer, Core Tech as and when required
 Lead a team of Lead, Principal, Senior and non-Senior Engineers, with responsibility for performance management and development/pastoral care ensuring exceptional level of service to our clients
 Providing support/input to the People Team on HR initiatives relating to the MPG People Plan
 Identify and highlight any potential risks in the solutions that are being worked on
 Solve problems through the application of sound software engineering principles
 Continuously work to minimise technical and maintenance issues
 Champion quality in MPG and our clients development process
 Other duties as assigned






What we will need from you?


 A experienced Technical Director or Lead Engineer with at least five shipped games
 Professional experience in the architecture of multiplayer game development
 Experience in leading a small team on a number of shipped games with at least two or more as Lead
 Experience with consoles like PS4/PS5 and XboxOne/SeriesX is preferable
 Excellent C++ programming skills
 Experience of supporting HR initiatives including development discussions, interviewing and performance management
 Knowledge of Unreal (UE4), Unity and other proprietary engines is preferable
 Experience with smart or mobile devices would be a plus
 Attention to detail with a strong ability to analyse and comprehend direction
 Awesome technical insight and a finisher of technical tasks on time
 A good communicator with the ability to verbalise conceptual thoughts and the willingness to accept constructive critique
 Excellent problem solving, debugging and optimisation skills
 Confidence in front of clients and the ability to answer technically challenging questions in prospective client negotiations

*This position can be based in Tampere, Finland or Zurich, Switzerland*
 At Scandit, we develop smart data capture technology that enables businesses to use smart devices to extract data from barcodes, ID documents, text and objects. Our newest product, ShelfView, is a machine learning-powered platform for retail that enables real time shelf visibility and empowers more intelligent and efficient store operations. With our scalable data capture technology via robots and mobile devices, retailers are on track to save tens of millions in operating expense and in turn generate tens of million more in value for their customers. For more information, please check our product website.
 We are now looking for an experienced and passionate Engineering Manager to support and grow one of our ShelfView product teams. You will take responsibility for one of Scandit's core product innovations and lead a team of skilled software engineers in developing mobile data capture applications, as well as on-device computer vision and machine learning algorithms which power the ShelfView Platform. This is a great opportunity to drive technical projects and provide leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment within a rapidly growing company.
 What You Will Do

Manage an excellent team of engineers with diverse skill sets by leading and empowering them to build great products, systems, and services that have an immediate impact on our customers
Lead and participate in critical technical, design, strategy and product discussions with stakeholders across the team and the company.
Manage the scrum process for the team, and contribute to quarterly and yearly plannings
Participate and take responsibility in all aspects of the product development cycle, working closely with adjacent engineering teams or the product and design team
Own the success of your team's product and deliver quantifiable results in a timely manner
Define your team's vision and roadmap by thoroughly understanding your customers' needs
Build a world-class team by coaching and developing engineers, cultivating pragmatic engineering decision-making, hiring exceptional talent and leveraging your technical expertise to constantly raise the bar
Lead and contribute to the software development in your field of expertise (eg mobile, backend, computer vision or machine learning) by architecting, developing and reviewing code as well as setting up testing infrastructure

Who You Are

You have a track record of developing and leading software projects. ShelfView is a full-stack project, with engineers developing code for mobile applications, backend systems and databases or cutting edge computer vision and machine learning algorithms. Ideally you have gained hands-on experience in at least one of those fields.
You have excellent communication skills and the ability to provide technical mentorship and guidance to the team
You have the ability to lead and cultivate a sense of ownership, accountability and urgency in the team
You have deep technical experience and appreciate good software architecture
You are curious, thorough, pay attention to detail and you have a desire to get things done
You have 4 years experience in hands-on software development and 2 years experience in leading a team or a project involving a significant number of stakeholders

What We Offer

The opportunity to shape an interesting and growing product line with many technical challenges. Still in its nascence, there are many aspects to optimize and new features to build.
A highly skilled team and a fun environment where you can put your enthusiasm for cutting-edge technologies to use
Flexible working hours and working locations and the opportunity to travel
A team of international researchers, scientists and engineers to work with
Hackathons, Christmas fondue parties, company outings, Friday beers and other regular events

Who We Are
 Scandit enables enterprises and consumers to change the way they interact with everyday objects and augment the physical world with real-time data captured by scanning barcodes and recognizing text, objects, and other visual identifiers using smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones and robots.
 Scandit's mobile data capture platform is built on proprietary computer vision, augmented reality, and machine learning technologies. Companies in industries such as retail, transportation & logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare can use Scandit's technology to create and power mobile apps for crucial enterprise workflows like mobile point of sale, mobile shopping, self-checkout, inventory management, and proof of delivery.
 Many of the world's most innovative and successful companies are benefiting from Scandit's enterprise-grade mobile data capture platform, including Sephora, Nissan, DHL, and Levi Strauss & Co.
 Scandit was founded by a group of researchers from ETH Zurich and MIT. The company is headquartered in Zurich and is also represented in Boston, London, Tampere, Warsaw, Tokyo and Singapore. Over the years, our company has evolved into a world-class team of mobile image processing, cloud computing and "Internet of Things" experts from around the globe.
 "Everybody is welcome here" - Is a celebrated component of our DNA.
 At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.
 All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed.

job_title: Solution Owner in Data & Technology, IKEA Core Business Supp...
job_summary:
Company description
 Inter IKEA Group brings together three core businesses: Franchise, Range and Supply. Together we work constantly to improve the IKEA home furnishing offer and make it more accessible for the many people. You will be part of IKEA Supply and the Supply Chain Development organisation. IKEA Supply is responsible for securing that the product offer is produced and delivered to our customers. We lead the supply agenda across many functions and work together with all business areas, different business units, but also retail markets to secure customer availability in all markets and sales channels at lowest total cost.
 Together, we create a workplace where everyone feels free to be themselves – to experiment, try new ways, and dare to ask, “What if…?” We believe in everyday personal growth and offer the opportunity to develop your career globally. At IKEA we have a vibrant culture where ideas are heard, where there is opportunity to learn new skills and where the goal always is "to create a better everyday life for the many people". We give down-to-earth, straightforward people the possibility to grow, both as individuals and in their professional roles. We offer this position in a fast paced, truly global environment with an endless supply of challenges and development opportunities
 Job description
 Data & Analytics, in Core Business Supply and Supply Chain Development, has the assignment to create value and enable business movements by bringing data, people, process, and technology together. Data & Analytics is a reasonably new department with the ambition of securing access to data, competence, and the right tools for all parts of the organization. We are working closely every day with the business and product teams that deliver cutting edge, data driven solutions to the many IKEA customers and co-workers.
 As a Solution Owner you will be an active business partner by supporting different business units within IKEA Supply. You will lead the process to make data product accessible for the many people. Supporting the business to convert complex and large data sets into to actionable insights.
 More specifically, in this role you will be accountable for:

 Lead the development of use cases and Data Product within the Data & Analytic Platform, connected to performance and follow up measurements such as: Availability, On Time Development, Portfolio Management & Scorecard and Dashboards.
 Responsible to make sure that the insights and conclusions from data products are easily available to other parts of the organisation.
 Manage data product to maximize their value for IKEA.
 Support initiatives in the Data & Analytical Platform to maximize the value delivered.
 Support a culture of data-driven decision making across IKEA organisations.
 Work closely together with data scientists, data engineers, architects, analysts, peers, and other relevant roles across IKEA as well as in your team.
 Drive continuous improvement, collaboration and knowledge sharing of data products and their value (methodologies, tools and materials) across the IKEA Community.

 In this role you will report to our Data & Analytics Manager in Data & Technology at IKEA Supply. You can find more information about our digital journey at Technology and Digital Career Hub at IKEA
 Are you looking for the challenge of your life? Come on board!
 Qualification
 We are on the journey to transform our digital capabilities, bringing core business processes, people, data & technology together - an enabler for IKEA to become an even better home furnishing company in the future. A journey that needs passionate people who embrace change, dare to question and want to make a difference. If that sounds like you, come and join us. Together we can do great things.
 We’re doing some amazing things in IKEA Supply chain; therefore we need some amazing people – this position is not an exception.
 We are making movements to develop IKEA by bringing in passionate people who embrace change, dare to question and want to make a difference. You are inspired and energised by the possibilities and opportunities that digital and information technology brings to enable, transform and break new grounds, always with the user’s best interest in mind. You also share our values striving always for simplicity and togetherness.
 You have some years of working experience from data analysis, where you´ve derived conclusions and consequences out of information and have helped the organisation to make new insights and better decisions. Of course, your analytical skills are excellent and you are able to see the big picture as well as the details and can structure information in a good way.

 Ability to understand the end-user’s everyday life at work and good at reading between the lines, i.e. challenge and identify business needs and have the ability to see what’s hidden in the requirements.
 Experience of deriving value from data by creating data assets, integrations, data as a service or improving data quality.
 Experience of taking ownership of data products and optimising and manging a data landscape.
 Experience within designing creative solutions to your colleague’s data needs by optimising and complementing the IKEA data landscape
 Experience from modern development techniques such as Agile and DevOps.
 Willingness to always strive for improvement and to have great motivation to learn new things.
 University degree in Business Administration, Economics or corresponding knowledge
 Fluent in English, both spoken and written.

 You are a big fan of home furnishing and enjoy building a purposeful business by creating engaging and trustful relationships with colleagues, stakeholders and business partners. As a person you are appreciated for collaborative spirit and how you lead with strong focus on both technology and people. You create impact and inspiration regardless of function or formal reporting lines.
 The IKEA culture & values are crucial for our business and day to day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values! You find more regarding our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com or just watch this video: https://bit.ly/ikea-what-if
 More Information
 Questions & Support? Let’s connect.
 If you have any questions about the role, please reach out to Robert Pernetun, IKEA Supply Data & Analytics manager, robert.pernetun1@inter.ikea.com  This position is located either in Älmhult, Sweden or Pratteln, Switzerland. Please also note that we do only handle applications in English sent in via our recruitment system and no applications coming in by email. We look forward to receiving your application at the latest August 31st, 2022.  You might have some questions about the recruitment process, and we are more than happy to answer those! Feel free to connect with the People & Culture Leader Dan Gustafsson at dan.gustafsson@inter.ikea.com
 #JoinUsInIKEASupplyDataAndTechnology

About Us
 RAW Labs is a rapidly expanding Swiss enterprise data technology company that was spun out of École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL), by Prof. Anastasia Ailamaki and a team of highly successful engineers and scientists from amongst others CERN, Cisco and Salesforce.
 At RAW Labs we have developed novel and innovative technologies to interrogate massive quantities of data in different formats, that are held in a variety of data stores across an enterprise infrastructure and in the Cloud. By leveraging this core technology RAW Labs has built a Cloud based Data Sharing platform for creating and maintaining APIs. The RAW platform enables our customers to exploit all forms of data to create curated Data Products via our DataOps infrastructure, and securely share data in hours, not days. Enterprises use RAW Labs’ platform to drive ML/AI, business intelligence and data analytics applications without having to build and maintain complex data engineering infrastructures.
 RAW Labs is funded by a group of highly sophisticated and experienced technology investors and are advised by technology luminaries including: Prof. Martin Odersky (creator of Scala), Prof. Mike Franklin (co-creator of Spark), Dr. Alon Halevy (from Facebook’s AI team).
 Where you'll be
 Our R&D team is based in two development centers: one in Lausanne, Switzerland, and the other in Athens, Greece. The successful applicants will be working in/near either office, with Remote working available if desired by agreement - note that access to either office will be required for face-to-face meetings with your project supervisor.
 Requirements
 Firstly and foremostly, we are looking for candidates with a passion for new technology, an inquisitive mind, a self-starting approach, and a can-do attitude. You may be working on problems that may not have been solved yet, or only partially solved. We are looking for:

 Masters' candidates only.
 Commercial experience a benefit, not a pre-requisite.
 Evidence of an innovative project you have undertaken in the software and/or data space.
 Great oral and written communication skills, preferably in English, but we have French, Greek and Portuguese speakers too.

 For technical skills, we can tailor the project to the successful candidate's experience. Here are some of the technologies we use currently:

 Scala and/or Java and/or Kotlin, and SQL.
 Development of distributed / big data, especially Spark
 Development of Visual Studio Code Extensions
 Cloud Service Provider's stack, e.g: AWS
 Benchmarking and profiling tools, e.g., JMH, Apache JMeter
 Container technologies such as Kubernetes and/or Docker
 CI/CD tools, e.g., Jenkins, Artifactory and DevOps tooling, e.g., Terraform, Docker, Compose, Ansible
 Security frameworks/libraries/providers, e.g. Auth0


 Our Projects
 Please indicate in your application which of the projects are of interest to you.
 1. GraalVM/Truffle code generator
 For Whom: Students interested into gaining hands-on into compilers and database architecture. Duration: Flexible, but min. of 3 months. Ideally 6 to 12 months.
 RAW’s query engine implements just-in-time code generation techniques, and additionally supports multiple experimental code emitters. The goal of this internship is to contribute to an experimental Truffle-based code generator for the RAW query engine.
 This project requires knowledge of Java and basic knowledge of compiler design (e.g. university course on compilers). Database engine design knowledge is desirable. Experience in – or strong desired to learn - GraalVM and Truffle in particular are a big plus, so please mention it.
 We provide learning material, so above all, this project requires willingness to learn, implement and experiment.
 2. AI/ML for Schema Discovery
 For Whom: Students interested into gaining hands-on experience in the development of practical AI/ML models. Duration: Flexible. Expect 2 to 6 months.
 A major feature of RAW’s query engine is the ability to read “raw” data (CSV, XML, JSONs, etc) with complex structures, directly from source and without any previous processing. Among other features, this requires a complex schema detection framework. For this we have developed an inferrer.
 The goal of this project is to advance the use of AI/ML techniques for the inferrer to detect the structure and schema of typical datasets in a performant matter, e.g. character encoding, headers, delimiters, data types, formats of dates, numbers, nulls, etc. It is an opportunity to develop novel techniques, which may lay the foundation for future research-level work. This project requires previous experience in building AI/ML models. No specific toolchain is required. Above all, this project requires a deep interest in the development and experimentation of new techniques as well as its careful evaluation.

RMS is the world's leading provider of analytics and decision science solutions for the quantification and management of catastrophic risks throughout the world. RMS models and services are used by hundreds of insurance and reinsurance companies, hedge funds, corporations, and governments to assess a wide-range of natural and man-made perils, from earthquakes and hurricanes to terrorism and disease pandemic.
 JOB DESCRIPTION

 Our high performing Customer Success team is looking for a Client Success Manager to work closely within the Continental Europe Primary and Reinsurance Market Segment in London to support clients and expand strategic client relationships. The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated, pro-active, results-oriented professional with an ability to work with moderate direction. The main functions of this role are to execute the strategic account plan, work closely with our client base, partner with the RMS sales team to retain revenue while ensuring a high quality of service and effective communications between the client and internal RMS business units. Success will be determined by client retention and satisfaction as well as performance on individual project-based initiatives.

 
Essential Job Functions

 Act as a strong client advocate, while maintaining business priorities
 Actively participate in regularly scheduled account team meetings designed to review the "state of the client" and align strategic plans
 Collaborate with sales team on execution of account strategies
 Support account renewal and cancellation mitigation activities
 Proactively identify and improve upon areas of client dissatisfaction
 Monitor the progress of client inquiries up to confirmation of final resolution; ensure the final resolution fully meets RMS standards
 Support event response outreach and on-going support
 Support change management activities for updated product and model releases
 Manage Client onboarding and training of new products and services
 Provide ongoing technical expertise & assistance
 Work both independently and with a team


 Travel

 Moderate travel may be required


 Minimum Qualifications

 Bachelor’s degree in any discipline with a strong academic track record
 Minimum 2 years of experience in insurance, software service, analytics or related fields
 Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
 Strong presentation skills
 Strong networking and influencing skills
 Solid organizational skills and ability to work under pressure
 Ability to coordinate across different teams, working effectively in a team and as an individual
 Fluency in English (written and spoken) is a must
 Preference will be given to candidates fluent in Continental European Languages


 About RMS
 There is a 1% chance an earthquake will cause $50 billion of insured loss within the next 12 months and a 5% chance that a hurricane will cause $60 billion of insured losses next year. At RMS, we turn risks into real numbers. How? By building simulation models that allow insurers and investors to understand and manage their global risks-from hurricanes, quakes, and wildfires, to cyberattacks, terror attacks, and pandemics. Why? We want to build a more resilient world, and we are on a mission to help make every risk known.
 Insurers, reinsurers, investors, financial institutions, governments, and NGOs trust RMS solutions to better understand and manage catastrophe risks. RMS was founded in 1989 by Stanford scientists who created our first model for California Earthquake. Today, RMS has some 1,300 employees across 13 offices in the US, London, Bermuda, Zurich, India, China, Japan, Singapore, and Australia, and over 1,000 products and models now covering six continents.
 RMS helped pioneer the natural catastrophe model market we now lead – and we continue to innovate. In May 2019, we announced RMS Risk Intelligence™ (RI), an open-standard platform for strategic risk management. Through this purpose-built platform, clients can tap into RMS HD models, rich data layers, intuitive applications and APIs that simply integrate into existing enterprise systems to support business decisions across underwriting, risk selection, mitigation, and portfolio management.
 How we understand and manage risk affects everyone and our passion is nothing less than creating a more resilient world through a better understanding of catastrophic events. Join our team of leading scientists, developers, industry experts, and world-class professionals. Together, RMSers make a difference on a truly global scale.
 Visit RMS.com to learn more and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
 RMS is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, creed, gender, religion, marital status, registered domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic characteristics, sexual orientation, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal law.
 To all recruitment agencies: RMS does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and will not be responsible for the payment of placement fees related to unsolicited resumes submitted to open positions, job aliases, or to our employees.

Description 

 Debiopharm is an independent biopharmaceutical company based in Switzerland with an ongoing commitment to research in oncology and infectious diseases in order to improve patient outcomes and quality of life. Our main activities include drug development, drug manufacturing and digital health investment. Debiopharm International SA aims to develop innovative therapies that target high unmet medical needs. Our unique “development only” business model allows us to act as a bridge between disruptive discovery products and patient access in international markets. We first identify high-potential compounds for in-licensing, clinically demonstrate their safety and efficacy and then select large pharmaceutical commercialization partners to maximize patient access globally. 

 At Debiopharm you will be at the forefront of the fight against cancer and infectious diseases, and you will have the opportunity to work on new innovative medicines for patients. Efficiency is our mode of action, saving lives our collective target. 


Here: https://apply.workable.com/debiopharm-group-sa/ 

 For our Clinical Pharmacology & Drug Metabolism organization based at our Headquarters in Lausanne, we are looking for a 

 Scientist, Clinical Pharmacology and Pharmacometrics 

 In this role, you will contribute to the development of clinical pharmacology and pharmacometrics scientific strategy and manages assigned clinical pharmacology and pharmacometrics activities to add 

 value to, support, and accelerate the development of Debiopharm’s innovative therapeutics. 


Your responsibilities will be but not limited to:
 Manage finance, budget and timelines related to assigned clinical pharmacology and pharmacometrics activities

 Requirements

Strong communication & presentation skills

This position is office based, with up to 40% home-office 

 Benefits

Our SaaS platform enables trustless data collaboration between organizations. Will you be part of our mission? 

 Imagine all data silos get unlocked overnight. Every startup founder, every data scientist, magically gets access to all data ever collected. What'd be the impact? Will this double world GDP in 5 years? 10? What if I told you we can already do this? - Elad Verbin 

 The most valuable data is often sensitive and restricted in how it can be used. Join us and make data useful while at the same time guarantee privacy by design. We leverage the latest advances in confidential computing, cryptography and privacy tech to build a cloud platform that enables companies to run analytics on unseen sensitive data in a privacy-preserving way. 

 Would you like to be central to our future success, contribute to the cutting-edge development of a revolutionizing and be a part of a team fueled by positive energy, enthusiasm and supportive colleagues? 

 The integrity and security of our platform are the core value propositions of our platform. As a security engineer, you will be focused on developing S-SDLC activities and controls that will ensure our platform is designed and implemented with regards to the highest level of security standards.We are looking for a senior software engineer ( >=80%, starting as soon as possible) to join our mission. The work location can be fully remote (+/- 4h CET) or in the Zurich/Berlin office. 

 Tasks 



Secure design, architecture, and implementation covering all steps of our Secure Software Development Life Cycle (S-SDLC).
Ownership of external audits (ISO 27001, SOC2, ISO 27701) and internal security projects (vulnerability scanners, authentication & authorization, creation of new security practices, ...)
Create security documentation, including compliance as code as well as artifacts like whitepapers which will be made publicly available
Guide secure design discussions by threat modeling sessions and participate in risk assessments
Process for intrusion and threat detection, including regular external penetration tests
 Requirements 



Master/Bachelor Degree or PhD in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering and 2+ years of professional experience
Good communications and writing skills in English
Significant applied application security and cryptography experience
Deep technical understanding of common security vulnerabilities and risks, as well as countermeasures and compensating controls
Professional experience with security threat models
Understanding of application and cloud security frameworks such as OWASP’s and NIST CSF
Plus: Having been involved in security audits and penetration tests
 Benefits 



Work on making the world a better place by keeping personal data private.
Being able to create, shape, and benefit from a young company.
An amazing and fun team which is distributed over entire Europe
Competitive salary.
A lot of opportunities for self-development.
TGI(F and/or T) drinks and regular physical team events.

6000! That’s the number of associates in the Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR). This division is the innovation engine of Novartis, focusing on powerful new technologies that have the potential to help produce therapeutic breakthroughs for patients.
    
 Do you want to become part of the research team that invented transformative therapeutics in dermatology such as Cosentyx and Xolair? 
    
 The department for Autoimmunity, Transplantation and Inflammation (ATI) within the Novartis Institutes for Biomedical Research (NIBR) is investigating the discovery of innovative and transformative therapies to improve the lives of patients suffering from autoimmune and inflammatory diseases. As part of this effort, ATI is seeking an experienced and highly motivated Lab head to initiate and guide research and drug discovery efforts in the area of immunodermatology. The position will be based in Basel, Switzerland.
    
 Major Accountabilities
    
 You will
    

lead a pre-clinical drug discovery project team up to clinical proof-of-concept studies in patients
lead a state-of-the-art laboratory of BSc/MSc level scientists to discover and develop novel therapies for treatment of inflammatory skin diseases. 
contribute to unravel the pathomechanism of complex inflammatory skin diseases and increase our molecular disease understanding
validate novel therapeutic targets and establish biochemical and cellular and ex-vivo assay systems 
contribute to and/or lead early drug discovery projects within multidisciplinary teams up to clinical proof-of-concept studies in patients 
collaborate with scientists, clinicians, and technology experts across different departments in the global organization and academia
evaluate internal and external assets scientifically and support sound business decisions 
Your scientific work will continue to result in impactful publications in peer-reviewed journals, patent applications and presentations at international conferences





Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.



Minimum requirements

A PhD degree with several years of postdoctoral experience, strong technical and theoretical background/expertise of research in immunology and/or dermatology.

 Experience
    


Significant scientific accomplishments and successful collaborations documented by publications in high-impact journals. 
Proven track record of leadership, strategic thinking, creativity, and risk taking. 
Excellent communication, presentation and analytical skills. 
Mind-set of a strong team player, experience in working in a matrix environment and cross-functional teams. 

 Desirable requirements: 
    


Track record as an independent research scientist in an academic setting and/or in the pharmaceutical/biotech sector. 
Experience in preclinical drug discovery in pharmaceutical industry or biotech setting is a strong plus 
Proven success in independently initiating and leading projects.

 Languages
    


Excellent oral and written communication skills in English, German desirable

 Why consider Novartis?
    
 750 million. That’s how many lives our products touch. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives? We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.
    
 We are Novartis. Join us and help us reimagine medicine.

job_title: Scientific software engineer for life science research 100%
job_summary:
Scientific software engineer for life science research 100%
 fixed-term
 Every major activity inside living cells is driven by the action of proteins. These molecular machines have complex shapes and dynamics that can be increasingly studied by experimental techniques capable of generating measurements in vast quantities.
 Project background The groups of Prof. Paola Picotti and Prof. Pedro Beltrao have a long-standing interest in studying how these molecular machines function and have established expertise in generating large-scale data that relate to protein structure, dynamics and function (Picotti lab) as well as methods to computationally model and study protein 3D structure (Beltrao lab). This project aims to develop a web-based database that allows sharing these types of large-scale datasets to a wider audience and interactively exploring them to support new workflows and projects in the area of structural and systems biology.
 Job description You are the perfect candidate for this job if you are an experienced computer programmer familiar with both front and back-end development with prior experience in bioinformatics and protein structural bioinformatics in particular. We welcome people with either strong experience in full stack web development or strong background in structural bioinformatics that are keen to learn on the job.
 Your profile

 Degree in Computer Science or a Bioinformatic-related degree.
 Knowledge of bioinformatics, especially structural bioinformatics and prior work experience as a web developer would be very positively considered.
 Proficiency with fundamental front-end languages such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
 Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular JS, React and Amber.
 Proficiency with server-side languages such as Python, Ruby, Java, PHP and Net.
 Familiarity with database technology such as MySQL, Oracle and MongoDB.
 Ability to work collaboratively with excellent verbal communication skills.
 Good problem-solving skills.
 Good command of written and spoken English, as well as excellent verbal and written communication skills.

 We offer

 You will have the opportunity to shape the development of the project from the start and have strong support from bioinformatics and domain knowledge experts.
 You will have the opportunity to learn the handling and interpretation of large-scale proteomics and structural systems biology datasets generated with cutting-edge technologies.
 You will work in a dynamic and highly interdisciplinary team including computer scientists and experimentalists.
 You will be involved in cross-disciplinary collaborations and have training opportunities to further develop and grow on the job.
 There will also be IT support for infrastructural aspects of the work.

 Working, teaching and research at ETH Zurich
 We value diversity In line with our values, ETH Zurich encourages an inclusive culture. We promote equality of opportunity, value diversity and nurture a working and learning environment in which the rights and dignity of all our staff and students are respected. Visit our Equal Opportunities and Diversity website to find out how we ensure a fair and open environment that allows everyone to grow and flourish.
 Curious? So are we. We look forward to receiving your online application including the following documents:

 a full CV
 a short statement of experience and qualifications of max. 1 page
 work certificates and contact information of at least two referees

 Please note that we exclusively accept applications submitted through our online application portal. Applications via email or postal services will not be considered. The position is already available. A pre-selection step will result in a shortlist of candidates to be invited for an interview.
 Further information about the Institute of Molecular Systems Biology can be found on our website. Questions regarding the position should be directed to Mr Silas Kraemer, kraemer@imsb.biol.ethz.ch (no applications).
 For recruitment services the GTC of ETH Zurich apply.
 About ETH Zürich
 ETH Zurich: Ready?
 ETH Zurich is one of the world’s leading universities specialising in science and technology. We are renowned for our excellent education, cutting-edge fundamental research and direct transfer of new knowledge into society. Over 30,000 people from more than 120 countries find our university to be a place that promotes independent thinking and an environment that inspires excellence. Located in the heart of Europe, yet forging connections all over the world, we work together to develop solutions for the global challenges of today and tomorrow.

  Arbeitsort:Zürich
 ETH Zürich, HPM  Otto-Stern-Weg 3  8093 Zürich

job_title: Sr Scientist - Statistician Neuchatel, Switzerland Life Scie...
job_summary:
Sr Scientist – Statistician – Neuchatel, Switzerland 
 
 Be a part of a revolutionary change.
 
 At PMI, we’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business, and building our future on smoke-free products.
 
 With huge change, comes huge opportunity. So, wherever you join us, you’ll enjoy the freedom to dream up and deliver better, brighter solutions and the space to move your career forward in endlessly different directions.
 
 It’s so rare in R&D that everything aligns to create the ideal conditions for outstanding work. Right now, at PMI, that’s exactly what’s happening. R&D is the driving force for our bold new vision: to replace cigarettes with a revolutionary portfolio of alternative products.
 
 Join us and you’ll have the resources, support and technology you need to break new ground and see ideas come to life. You’ll be surrounded by some of the brightest scientists in their fields, with fast access to subject experts and commercial decision-makers.
 
 If you’re creative, courageous and ready to take risks, you can make a huge impact and propel your career in an endless number of directions. Ultimately, by delivering our smoke-free and beyond nicotine future.
 
 Your ‘day to day
 
 As Sr Scientist – Statistician you will apply statistical and mathematical techniques to complex pre-clinical data, in order to ensure a correct interpretation of scientific results and help make informed decisions! You will support the study teams by establishing fit-for-purpose statistical designs. You will also contribute to the publication of major results in peer-reviewed scientific journals and thereby to the scientific credibility of Philip Morris International (PMI). 
 
 More specifically, you'll
 


Contribute to the statistical design of preclinical studies and life science product innovation experiments and recommend the most appropriate statistical procedures for the outcome evaluation.
Develop and implement statistical techniques and tools, perform data analysis and reporting based on pre-clinical, laboratory data and methodology validation.
Guide peers and management in data interpretation to support them in making informed decisions
Provide input and evidence to the development of project and study scopes, schedules and estimates
Perform duties in accordance to PMI policies and/or external regulations, e.g. Good Laboratory Practices (GLP).
Contribute to the writing and preparation of reports, presentations, publications, patents and evidence packages that are submitted to regulatory authorities, as well as present these materials to internal or external events such as conferences
Provide mathematical and statistical expertise on new projects and techniques, as well as statistical training.

 Who we’re looking for
 


MSc, or PhD preferred, in biostatistics, statistics or other related areas (physics, mathematics, computational science/biology/chemistry/toxicology, data science).
Demonstrated experience in industrial (pharmaceutical, food, medical devices) setting with a sound expertise in biostatistics and advanced statistical designs.
Strong expertise in programming with R or SAS statistical software, development of Shiny applications is a plus.
Practical experience in (pre-)clinical research and basic knowledge of GLP and GCP. Knowledge of standardized data formats (SDTM, ADAM, SEND) are an advantage.
Ability to work in a multi-disciplinary environment.
Confirmed publication skills.
Sound expertise in planning and scheduling activities with other groups.
Fluent in English both written and spoken.

 What we offer 
 
 Our success depends on the people who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress.
 
 Join PMI and you too can:
 


Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.
Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
Take pride in delivering our promise to society: a smoke-free future.

Sobi offers the opportunity to work at an international pharmaceutical company focused on specialty pharmaceuticals meeting the high medical needs of rare disease patients and providing treatment and services to them. Our employees come from a variety of backgrounds within research, healthcare, industry and the academic sphere.






 Clinical Science Expert





 Role & Function
 The main scope of work for the Clinical Science Expert is to manage all medical aspects of the clinical trials as the expert of assigned therapeutic area. The Clinical Science Expert works in the Clinical Science team and reports to the Medical Director Clinical Science (if in place) or to the VP RDMA Clinical Science and Medical Affairs. Key responsibilities include to manage assigned Clinical Development Studies and projects from a medical perspective and contribute/author Clinical documents such as CSP, CSR, IB etc. Oversees the setting up and monitoring clinical trials. This involves collaborating with trial investigators and training the clinical trial sites. In addition, clinical science expert is responsible for writing clinical protocols, monitoring data, and reporting safety-related events.




 Key Responsibilities




       Support the Medical Director Clinical Science in the design and implementation of the overall clinical development strategy for the assigned molecule or therapeutic area.
     




       Prepare/review scientific documents, study protocol, master informed consent, investigator brochure, statistical analysis plan, publications, and regulatory documentation.
     




       Lead the scientific and medical content of the study and is the Clinical Science Representative in the trial team for the assigned study(ies) and a key contributor of the Clinical Science strategy.
     




       Perform clinical review, analyze and interpretation of data.
     




       Contribute to the assessment of the benefit / risk profile of the therapeutic modality.
     




       Represent Clinical Science within the cross-functional study team 
     




       Manage the clinical study conduct for scientific and medical questions, provides guidance to the study team and CRO.
     




       Track and report costs for assigned outsourced activities.
     






 Qualifications




       MD, PhD or equivalent Life Science degree 
     




       At least 5-10 years working in the clinical development as clinical scientist, ideally in a rare disease indication
     




       Previous clinical development experience in the pharmaceutical industry
     




       Experience in writing protocols, reviewing, analyzing and reporting clinical study data
     




       Experience with preparation and/or interaction with Health Authorities (FDA, EMEA)
     




       A background in immunology and/or in chronic inflammatory diseases, and rare diseases program
     




       Fluency in written and spoken English
     




       Knowledge of analytics platforms such as Spotfire, Graphpad as an advantage
     






 Personal attributes
 • Demonstrated leadership skills including e.g. build, lead and motivate workstreams/projects • Ability to see a complex program from a "big picture"/strategic level • Strong interpersonal skills with communicative and flexible attitude• Excellent written and oral communication skills • Good influencing skills and Interpersonal skills• Excellent problem-solving skills, results and action oriented, hands-on • Performs competently in a multicultural environmentIn addition, you must demonstrate behaviors in line with Sobi's core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership.




 Location
 The position will be based in Basel, Switzerland.





 Sobi is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin. Sobi is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs and activities.

The SIB Swiss Institute of Bioinformatics is an internationally recognized non-profit organization, dedicated to biological and biomedical data science. Its data scientists are passionate about creating knowledge and solving complex questions in many fields, from biodiversity and evolution to medicine. They provide essential databases and software platforms as well as bioinformatics expertise and services to academic, clinical, and industry groups. SIB federates the Swiss bioinformatics community of some 800 scientists, encouraging collaboration and knowledge sharing. The Institute contributes to keeping Switzerland at the forefront of innovation by fostering progress in biological research and enhancing health.
